title: Tens Of Millions In Foreign Funds Could Be Flowing Into 2024 Election To Help Dems, Report Reveals
content:
A Democratic-aligned dark money group that receives significant backing from a foreign billionaire is dumping tens of millions of dollars into influencing ballot initiatives ahead of Novemberâ€™s election, according to a new report.
The Sixteen Thirty Fund received $143 million in backing from the Berger Action Fund, a nonprofit bankrolled by Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss, between 2019 and 2022. This election cycle, the Sixteen Thirty Fund has spent nearly $23 million on ballot initiatives in a number of swing states on issues like abortion, minimum wage policy and election reform, according to a report from watchdog group Americans for Public Trust (APT).
â€œItâ€™s unconscionable that foreign money is currently influencing our politics through a loophole most mainstream media and politicians are either ignoring or donâ€™t know about,â€ APT executive director Caitlin Sutherland told the Daily Caller News Foundation. â€œActivists like the ones running Sixteen Thirty Fund are targeting competitive states â€” not just to usher in left-wing legislative changes via these ballot measures, but also to give a boost to the liberals at the top of the ticket, which folks have openly admitted thatâ€™s their goal.â€
â€œAmericans for Public Trust â€” a right-wing group tied to Leonard Leo â€” published this report because they resent our successful efforts to guarantee freedoms for all Americans, work Leo fundamentally opposes,â€ a Sixteen Thirty Fund spokesperson told the DCNF. â€œSixteen Thirty Fund proudly supports local groups organizing around ballot initiatives that expand fundamental rights like access to abortion, the ballot box and livable wages. Every contribution we receive is used in strict compliance with all guidelines, regulations and laws.â€
Some Democratic strategists view ballot abortion referendums, which the Sixteen Thirty Fund has spent considerable funds supporting, as a way to sway people toward their partyâ€™s candidates. The Sixteen Thirty Fund has pumped millions into ballot initiative campaigns in Arizona, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada and Ohio, all of which have competitive presidential or senatorial races â€” both in some cases.
Federal law doesnâ€™t currently prohibit foreign dollars from funding ballot measure campaigns, according to APT. Foreigners, however, are barred from donating directly to candidates and political action committees.
The Sixteen Thirty Fund has spent a total of $115 million on state ballot issues since 2014, with Wyss donating at least $243 million to the group since its inception, per APTâ€™s analysis of campaign finance and nonprofit records.
â€œState legislatures and the U.S. Congress should act to close this foreign influence loophole,â€ the reportâ€™s conclusion reads. â€œForeign nationals are already prohibited from donating to U.S. political candidates, committees and Super PACs, and the same prohibition should apply to state ballot issue campaigns â€¦ American policy debates should be for American citizens.â€
When reached by the DCNF in February, a spokesperson for the Berger Action Fund would not comment on whether or not Wyssâ€™ money supported political activities but stressed that it â€œcomplies with laws and rules governing its activities and prohibits its grants from being used to support or oppose political candidates or parties, or otherwise engage in electoral activities.â€
Berger Action Fund did not immediately respond to the DCNFâ€™s request for comment.

title: Swing State Supreme Court Upholds Ruling To Count Mail Ballots Without Postmarks Up To Three Days Post-Election
content:
The Nevada Supreme Court affirmed Monday a lower courtâ€™s ruling that mail ballots arriving up to three days after the Nov. 5 election can be counted, regardless of whether they bear a postmark.
The verdict upholds a previous lower courtâ€™s decision and expands the scope of the state law mandating that such ballots be counted when a postmark â€œcannot be determined,â€ according to the ruling. The ruling marks a setback for the Republican National Committee (RNC), which maintained that the law should only cover ballots with unreadable postmarks.
The courtâ€™s majority opinion argued that dismissing a vote mailed on or before election day due to missing postmarks from postal errors would contravene public policy. The justices argued that no valid reason exists to differentiate between ballots with smeared or illegible postmarks and those completely lacking one.
The Nevada Supreme Court upheld a lower courtâ€™s ruling Monday, allowing mail-in ballots without postmarks received by Election Day to be counted in the days after the election. https://t.co/rhcuUAQM0f
â€” David Charns (@davidcharns) October 28, 2024
â€œIf a voter properly and timely casts their vote by mailing their ballot before or on the day of the election, and through a post office omission the ballot is not postmarked, it would go against public policy to discount that properly cast vote,â€ Nevadaâ€™s majority opinion reads.
Justices said they acknowledged the RNCâ€˜s standing due to competitive injury, yet they upheld the lower courtâ€™s decision, noting the RNCâ€™s unlikely success in their case, according to the court document. The justices also said both interpretations of the law are reasonable but highlighted discussions among lawmakers during the billâ€™s passage about allowing the counting of ballots without postmarks. (RELATED: Federal Judge Upholds Arizona Law To Verify Votersâ€™ Citizenship Status)
They further emphasized that the lawmakers intended the legislation to broaden voting methods and simplify the voting process, the court filing added. The court dismissed the notion that mail ballots inherently favor Democrats, thus rejecting any claims of partisan bias in their decision.
Out of the seven justices, five agreed with the majority ruling, according to the court filing. The two remaining justices concurred with the outcome but for differing reasons; one cited inadequate evidence from the appellants, and the other emphasized the imprudence of altering electoral rules so close to election day.
â€œRequiring ballots to be postmarked on or before election day is a critical election integrity safeguard that ensures ballots mailed after election day are not counted,â€ RNC Spokesperson Claire Zunk said, The Hill reported. â€œIt is also a requirement of Nevada law. By allowing Nevada officials to ignore the lawâ€™s postmark requirement, the stateâ€™s highest court has undermined the integrity of Nevadaâ€™s elections.â€
The RNC did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: Conservative Commentator Banned From CNN After Spat With Ex-MSNBC Host Who Labeled Trump Supporters â€˜Nazisâ€™
content:
CNN fired conservative commentator Ryan James Girdusky after a heated Monday night exchange that started after former MSNBC host Mehdi Hasan defended calling Trump supporters Nazis.
CNN host Abby Phillip shared a CNN statement that said Girdusky would not be allowed on the network after the fiery exchange, and apologized to Hasan following the incident. Girdusky had earlier clashed with Phillip over media portrayals of Trumpâ€™s Sunday rally at Madison Square Garden before Hasan and Girduskyâ€™s heated exchange. (RELATED: â€˜Deeply Dangerousâ€™: MSNBC Host Says Media Needs To Stop Covering â€˜Both Sidesâ€™ Of Issues)
â€œNobody wants to be called Nazis. Itâ€˜s very inflammatory, but if you donâ€˜t want to be called Nazis, stop doing-â€ Hasan said after making the comparison, prompting Girdusky to cut in and say, â€œYouâ€™re called an antisemite more than anyone at this table,â€
â€œAre you calling me an antisemite?â€ Hasan asked, with Girdusky responding, â€œNo, Iâ€™m just saying people call you that.â€
WATCH:
Hasan has been a vociferous critic of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and of Israelâ€™s response to the Oct. 7, 2023 attack by the radical Islamic terrorist group Hamas that killed over 1,200 people.
â€œIâ€™m used to it because I support the Palestinians,â€ Hasan said.
â€œWell, I hope your beeper doesnâ€™t go off,â€ Girdusky responded, referring to an Israeli operation that targeted the radical Islamic terrorist group Hezbollah. Girdusky apologized repeatedly for the remark, saying he thought the former MSNBC host mentioned Hamas. (Watch The Daily Caller Documentary â€œAnarchy Uâ€)
Girdusky was removed from the panel and Phillip later addressed the exchange on-air after a commercial break.
â€œI want to just address what happened in the last segment. First, I want to apologize to Mehdi Hasan for what was said at this table. It was completely unacceptable,â€ Phillip said. â€œWhen we get this discussion started, youâ€™ll see that Ryan is not at the table. There is a line that was crossed there and itâ€™s not acceptable to me, itâ€™s not acceptable to us at this network. We want discussion, we want people who disagree with each other to talk to each other, but when you cross the line of a complete lack of civility, that is not going to happen here on this show.â€
Vice President Kamala Harris and her running mate, Democratic Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota, have escalated attacks on Trump, labeling him a â€œfascistâ€ during an Oct. 24 CNN town hall. Walz compared Trumpâ€™s rally at Madison Square Garden to a 1939 rally by Nazi sympathizers Sunday. â€œMorning Joeâ€ co-host Mika Brzezinski called the rally at Madison Square Garden hate speech Monday, while Washington Post columnist Eugene Robinson compared it to the Nazi rally on the MSNBC morning program Tuesday. (RELATED: CNN Host Claims Trumpâ€™s â€˜Abraham Accordsâ€™ Caused Hamas To Carry Out Oct. 7 Attack)
You can stay on CNN if you falsely call every Republican a Nazi and have taken money from Qatar-funded media. Apparently you canâ€™t go on CNN if you make a joke. Iâ€™m glad America gets to see what CNN stands for.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Ted Cruz Campaign Accuses Political Opponent Of Violating Federal Law With Chuck Schumer, Fellow Democrats
content:
Republican Texas Sen. Ted Cruzâ€™s campaign filed a complaint Thursday with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) against Democratic Rep. Colin Allred. The senator is claiming his opponent is operating illegally in coordination with Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee (DSCC).
The Daily Caller first obtained a copy of the complaint, which states that Allred and his Senate campaign are illegally coordinating with Schumer and the DSCC on television ads that exceeded the coordinated party expenditure limit, resulting in potentially millions of dollars in excessive in-kind contributions from DSCC to Allred.
The complaint specifically mentions four advertisements that the Cruz campaign believes meets the criteria for qualifying as â€œhybrid ads.â€ The campaign says that the DSCC must be held accountable for allegedly presenting an advisory opinion request to the commission under false pretenses and making representations that it now fails to abide by.
â€œColin Allredâ€™s campaign is illegally coordinating with Chuck Schumer and the DSCC. We are calling on the FEC to immediately investigate and put a stop to this flagrant violation of federal law,â€ a Cruz campaign spokesperson told the Daily Caller. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Cruz, Top Republicans Push Back Against Agency Weaponizing Bidenâ€™s Woke Agenda)
The race between Cruz and Allred remains very tight. Polling shows Cruz and Allred are neck and neck as Allred has continued to pitch himself as a moderate candidate and has been distancing himself from Vice President Kamala Harris and her bid for the presidency as polling continues to tighten between her and former President Donald Trump. (RELATED: Battleground Democrats Are Avoiding Kamala Harris Like The Plague As Election Day Nears)
READ THE COMPLAINT HERE:
(DAILY CALLER OBTAINED) â€” â€¦ by Henry Rodgers
â€œAllred and his Senate campaign are blatantly coordinating with the DSCC on television ads far in excess of the coordinated party expenditure limit, thus resulting in potentially millions of dollars in excessive in-kind contributions from DSCC to Allred. Complainants ask the Federal Election Commission (â€˜FECâ€™ or â€˜Commissionâ€™) to immediately investigate and put a stop to this flagrant violation of federal law,â€ the complaint states. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Alyssa Farah Encouraged Cassidy Hutchinson To Leak To Reporters Amid Investigation)
The Caller contacted Allredâ€™s campaign about the complaint and it did not immediately respond.

title: â€˜Iâ€™m Nervousâ€™: Sense Of Unease Persists Among Harris Rally Crowd
content:
WASHINGTON, D.C. â€“ American flags waving, USA signs in hand, snacking on Pop-Tarts and cotton candy, thousands and thousands of Kamala Harris supporters squeezed into the Ellipse to see the vice president make her final pitch for the White House.
The joy was high. But even at a high-energy, packed rally, some of Harrisâ€™s supporters expressed a sense of nervousness about what would happen Nov. 5 and beyond.
â€œIâ€™m very nervous honestly. I think Trump might win. I donâ€™t know,â€ one female student from Maryland told the Daily Caller as her friend nodded in agreement. The Caller granted anonymity to the Harris supporters so they could speak freely about their thoughts.
Another rally goer, a woman from Maryland in the travel industry, remarked that the Harris event was very joyful, but she felt anxiety over the vice presidentâ€™s chances.
â€œI am confident that she will get the popular vote but I am worried about the electoral college,â€ she told the Caller. â€œThe electoral college does not go with the American people.â€
Across a majority of polls, both nationally and in swing states, Harris and Donald Trump have been locked neck-and-neck. The vice president rode a honeymoon wave into the Democratic National Convention this summer, helped by dodging media interviews for the first month of her campaign.
But as pressure from the media built up, Harris eventually began to do more press. Some repeated lines and non-answers began to quell her momentum, and the Trump campaign started to surge back.
The two female Maryland students the Caller spoke to said they believed the mediaâ€™s coverage of Harris had been unfair compared to Trump, which they think could be hurting Harrisâ€™s chances. They added they were nervous people may not elect Harris because she is a woman.
â€œI think there is a lot of misogyny, I donâ€™t think people want to see a woman as president,â€ one of the students told the Caller.
We have an opportunity to turn the page on a decade of Donald Trump trying to keep us divided and afraid of each other.
America, that is not who we are. It is time for a new generation of leadership. pic.twitter.com/iTfcnTCOJh
â€” Kamala Harris (@KamalaHarris) October 30, 2024
The vice president took the stage shortly after 7:30 p.m., speaking for just over thirty minutes to a crowd that extended up the National Mall. Harris capitalized on the location of her rally, the Ellipse, where Trump addressed his supporters ahead of the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot. She called the former president a â€œpetty tyrantâ€ that is â€œobsessed with revenge,â€ alleging that he would use the military against his enemies if elected to the White House. (RELATED: Harris Completes Pivot To Failed â€˜Democracyâ€™ Message With Speech At J6 Site)
While Harris was on stage, Biden, sitting in her backdrop in the White House, was igniting a firestorm.
The president attended a get-out-the-vote call on Tuesday hosted by Voto Latino where he responded to a joke made by comic Tony Hinchcliffe. During Trumpâ€™s Madison Square Garden rally over the weekend, Hinchcliffe called Puerto Rico a â€œfloating island of garbage.â€ The president called Trump a â€œfailed businessmanâ€ with â€œno characterâ€ before saying the only garbage â€œfloating out there is his supporters.â€
â€œBiden may have done some pretty significant harm [to the Harris campaign],â€ CNNâ€™s Abby Phillip admitted Wednesday.
The backlash forced Harris to address the situation first thing this morning.
â€œListen, I think that first of all, he clarified his comments. Let me be clear, I strongly disagree with any criticism of people based on who they vote for,â€ the vice president began.
â€œYou heard my speech last night and continuously throughout my career. I believe that the work that I do is about representing all the people, whether they support me or not, and as president of the United States I will be a president for all Americans whether you vote for me or not. I have that responsibility and thatâ€™s the kind of work Iâ€™ve done my entire career and I take it very seriously,â€ she continued.
Harrisâ€™s biggest fans arenâ€™t the only ones worried about the vice presidentâ€™s chances. Top Democrats are too, and some are even beginning to discuss who to blame if Trump wins, Axios reported Friday.
What it will come down to, another Harris supporter said, is the media coverage of the vice president, despite her belief that she is very qualified for the job.
â€œI guess itâ€™s the way the media [has treated her] and I donâ€™t think they are treating her on the same level they are treating Trump,â€ Michelle Cole, a retired investment banker from New Jersey, told the Caller.
â€œI donâ€™t know. Iâ€™m nervous,â€ she said.

title: Florida Sues Biden-Harris DOJ For Allegedly Blocking Trump Assassination Attempt Investigation
content:
Florida sued the Biden-Harris administrationâ€™s Department of Justice (DOJ) Wednesday for allegedly blocking the stateâ€™s investigation into the second Trump assassination attempt.
Federal officials almost immediately began â€œtaking steps to halt the stateâ€™s investigationâ€ into Ryan Wesley Routh, who was indicted for attempting to assassinate former President Donald Trump at his Florida golf course in September, the lawsuit states.
â€œEvery day that Florida is prevented from investigating, the Stateâ€™s case becomes harder to prove at trial,â€ the lawsuit states. â€œBy contrast, the federal government suffers no injury from Florida investigating state law crimes, as the State has no intention of interfering with or obstructing the federal investigation.â€ (RELATED: Trump Assassination Attempt Suspect Seeks Judgeâ€™s Recusal From Case)
Republican Florida Governor Ron DeSantis signed an executive order two days after the Sept. 15 attempt directing Florida law enforcement agencies to investigate and ensure violations of state law were referred for prosecution.
Attorney General Ashley Moody wrote a letter Sept. 23 to FBI Director Christopher Wray indicating it would be a â€œmistakeâ€ to frustrate Floridaâ€™s investigation.
In a Sept. 30 response, U.S. Attorney Lapointe said the state cannot conduct investigative activities until the federal prosecution is complete, according to the lawsuit. Federal officials indicated that activities like interviewing potential witnesses are illegal under federal law, the lawsuit states.
Routh was initially charged with two gun offenses. The DOJ later charged him with attempted assassination on Sept. 24.
The statute Routh was charged under states that local authority will be suspended once federal jurisdiction is asserted.
The DOJ declined to comment on the lawsuit.

title: â€˜An Absolute Wimping Outâ€™: Fox News Guest Roasts WaPo Decision To Sit Out Election
content:
Fox News media analyst Howard Kurtz said Friday that the Washington Post was a â€œprofile in non-courageâ€ when it elected not to endorse in the 2024 presidential election.
The Postâ€™s decision, which it announced Friday, followed a similar move by the Los Angeles Times, which said it would make no endorsement Tuesday. Kurtz noted that the non-endorsements, which were ordered by the owners of the newspapers, resulted in a â€œbacklash.â€ (RELATED: â€˜A Case For Panicâ€™: â€˜Morning Joeâ€™ Guest Says Kamala Harris Has â€˜Good Reason To Worryâ€™ About Election)
WATCH:
â€œLook, this is a profile in non-courage, an absolute wimping out. Now Jeff Bezos does have the right to do this, but at the same time, the other 364 days a year, the liberal Washington Post tells us what to think about everything, every issue under the sun, and all of a sudden comes onto the most important question like, â€˜Oh, we couldnâ€™t possibly give you our opinion now,â€™â€ Kurtz, a former Washington Post employee, told Fox News host Martha MacCallum.
â€œAnd so I think Jeff Bezos, by the way, does a lot of business with the federal government through his rocket company, through Amazon, and he may fear that Trump is going to win, and he doesnâ€™t want to exacerbate their already testy relationship,â€ Kurtz said.
MacCallum noted that not only had the Post and Times stayed neutral, but she also noted the non-endorsement decisions from the Teamsters and the International Association of Fire Fighters earlier in the campaign.
â€œIn both cases, L.A. Times and Washington Post, there were editorials drafted favoring Kamala Harris, and the billionaire owner of the L.A. Times not only killed it, but three top editors have now resigned in protest when people have canceled their subscriptions, so the idea that, oh, we donâ€™t want to be divisive and this is up to our readers to make up their minds, sure most newspaper editorials donâ€™t matter much anymore, but it is interesting that they are pulling back on this, the most important decision of the year, after theyâ€™ve lectured us all on every issue,â€ Kurtz said.
â€œTheyâ€™ve been anti-Trump mostly, more recently largely pro-Kamala Harris, and yet both of the owners are saying, I run the place, and youâ€™re not running that Harris endorsement,â€™â€ he continued. (Watch The Daily Caller Documentary â€œCleaning Up Kamalaâ€)
Former President Donald Trump trails Vice President Kamala Harris by 0.1% in the RealClearPolling average of polls from Oct. 11 to 24, but the two are tied when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys.

title: What Happens If Trump Wins?
content:
Blocks from the U.S. Capitol, a limo burst into flames moments after dropping guests off at Donald Trumpâ€™s inauguration.
Flares and bricks flew through its windows. The driver, Luis Villarroel, fled his torched car, which belonged to a Muslim immigrant small business owner.
Throughout D.C., store windows were smashed, car doors dented. Police stood shoulder to shoulder unloading pepper spray on protesters.
In the middle of the chaos, Trump put his hand on the Bible, took an oath and became the 45th president of the United States.
â€œIn 2016, I just donâ€™t think that the population was prepared for it, and thatâ€™s why we didnâ€™t see wider-spread unrest, because nobody expected it to happen,â€ Richie McGinniss, a longtime video journalist who has covered social unrest for years, told the Caller. McGinnis was previously the video director for the Daily Caller.
â€œI hate to say it, but itâ€™s going to be a lot worse [in 2024] than it was in 2016 if Trump wins.â€
In 2016, Trump stunned the nation by defeating Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. Instantly, Democrats were shocked and began to melt down. Images of Clinton supporters falling to their knees, crying and screaming, went viral.
Woman screams â€œNOâ€ as Donald Trump is sworn in as the 45th President of the United States ğŸ˜‚
pic.twitter.com/QDp5uKbWNvâ€” Daily Loud (@DailyLoud) January 28, 2024
Much of the corporate media was no less hysterical, decrying Jan. 20, 2017 as a dark day for America.
Eight years later, after being dragged from courthouse to courthouse, two assassination attempts and being labeled a â€œfascistâ€ by his opponents daily, Trump has a real chance at another victory against long odds. The Daily Caller spoke to various experts across the political landscape about what to expect if that happens. From violence in the streets, to Democratsâ€™ plans to contest a Trump win, to the media meltdown, to election lawfare from Democratic super-lawyer Marc Elias, they all predicted a much more dangerous and extreme response this time around if the â€œthreat to democracyâ€ is democratically elected.
McGinniss told the Caller he is preparing for unrest across the country that will be more intense than what was seen in 2016. He says nearly a decade of persistent anti-Trump messaging will be an accelerant for extremism.
â€œ[Weâ€™ve been] told that, effectively, our country is going to be under a dictatorship if Trump wins,â€ McGinniss told the Caller.
He predicted that violent activists throughout the country would target the nearest avatar of the government they could find, whether that be federal courthouses or police precincts.
Julio Rosas, a national correspondent for The Blaze who has years of experience covering riots and social unrest, had a similar prediction, adding that migrants who have been let into the country under the Biden-Harris administration may join in big cities such as New York and Chicago. Above all, Rosas said protests can be expected because violent demonstrators have never learned their lesson.
Absolute chaos at Union Station after US Park Police moved in to prevent anti-Israel protesters from taking down a U.S. flag. Arrests have been made. Park Police withdrew after securing the US flag, the mob chased them. pic.twitter.com/ZE3Lp6PQHC
â€” Julio Rosas (@Julio_Rosas11) July 24, 2024
â€œWhy itâ€™s a guarantee the left riots is because theyâ€™ve gotten away with it for so long,â€ Rosas told the Caller. â€œThere hasnâ€™t been that huge government crackdown, like January 6.â€
McGinniss said he has seen the warning signs of organized protests in the event of a Trump victory. Maryland Rep. Jamie Raskin, an influential figure among House Democrats, hasnâ€™t committed to certifying a Trump victory, telling Axios that he would only move forward if the former president â€œwon a free, fair and honest election.â€
Such comments led McGinniss to warn that Democrats are already preparing to hit the streets, especially if the party apparatus attempts to cloud the legitimacy of Trumpâ€™s victory.
â€œIn that case, youâ€™d see not just pockets of rioting and stuff, but youâ€™d see actual organized, â€˜stop the stealâ€™ style stuff,â€ McGinniss said.
â€œWhen that happens on the left, we all know, once the sun goes down, thereâ€™s a whole other group of people who [come out],â€ he added, noting that â€œmore chaosâ€ helps their chance at â€œkeeping Trump out of office.â€
Raskinâ€™s comments also caught the attention of conservative election integrity advocates and Trump allies.
â€œIt sounds like Jamie Raskin is trying to start a civil war,â€ Mike Davis, a Trump-aligned lawyer and founder of the Article III Project, told the Caller.
History indicates that the Raskins and rioters of the world will be egged on by corporate media.
â€œThe Atlantic story is a great preview of what we can expect, which is pure hysteria over Trump being a fascist thatâ€™s going to use the military to force his will into existence against the American people,â€ The Spectatorâ€™s Washington editor Amber Duke told the Caller. Duke was previously a media reporter and then White House correspondent for the Caller.
The Atlantic story that Duke highlighted was published Tuesday by Editor-In-Chief Jeffrey Goldberg, who alleged that the former president praised Hitler while also disparaging a deceased veteran and her family. Instantly, the family, their lawyer and former Trump administration officials pushed back on the story, with figures close to Trump denying he had made the comments. Vice President Kamala Harris ran with it anyway, giving a rare unexpected address to push the fascism narrative. (RELATED: The Atlanticâ€™s October Surprise On Trump Implodes After Denials Galore From Everyone Involved)
Duke believes this line of attack will intensify as critics paint the former president as a â€œdictator, a fascist who will never give up power.â€
The Harris campaign also appears ready to engage in legal battles after the election. In August, the vice president hired back Marc Elias, one of the partyâ€™s top lawyers. In 2020, Elias played a leading role in hundreds of lawsuits seeking to make it easier to vote and undo Republican efforts to make elections more secure. He did the same in 2022, engaging in nearly 50 lawsuits in an effort to change election laws to Democratsâ€™ liking.
SCOOP:
Marc Eliasâ€™s latest dark money deception.
A super PAC is running ads to boost the Libertarian candidate as a â€œtrue conservativeâ€ who will â€œabolish income taxes.â€
We tracked down the main funder, and itâ€™s directly linked to Elias.https://t.co/hV1cH9dFtf
â€” Chuck Ross (@ChuckRossDC) October 25, 2024
In March, Republicans and their lawyers were concerned about the security of Novemberâ€™s election. Compared to Democrats, the Republican National Committee has been decades behind on the issue because of a 1982 consent decree that forbade them from engaging on many election integrity initiatives. But once that consent decree was lifted in 2018, the party began to rebuild, and by 2024 a fully-funded and staffed election integrity department was created. This cycle, the party has filed more than 100 election integrity lawsuits on issues ranging from removing non-citizens from voter rolls to implementing stricter checks on ballot validity.
A Trump campaign official previously told the Caller that what happened on the election integrity front in 2020 will not happen again in 2024.
Davis agreed.
â€œPresident Trump learned his lesson from 2020 â€¦ He has hired a very good legal team led by David Warrington on his campaign, along with a very good legal team led by RNC Chairman Michael Whatley,â€ Davis told the Caller.
Davis said the legal teams were being far more proactive in getting injunctions against Democratic initiatives this time around: â€œThat was the mistake in 2020: they didnâ€™t get injunctions â€¦ Theyâ€™re doing it this time,â€ he added.
But Republicans agree that regardless of what work they do before Nov. 5, Democrats will turn to lawfare in the days and weeks thereafter if Trump prevails in the election.
â€œDemocrats have used the claim of voter suppression to oppose every good election reform. Every reform proposed, whether itâ€™s voter ID â€¦ cleaning up voter rolls, they always claim thatâ€™s voter suppression,â€ Hans von Spakovsky, a senior legal fellow focusing on election integrity at the Heritage Foundation, said, adding that data shows when voter ID is required, turnout goes up.
â€œBut what I expect is that in any state where they lose, if itâ€™s a close loss, theyâ€™re going to make general claims of voter suppression,â€ Hans explained.
He predicted that wherever an ID requirement was used or people were turned away from the polls, â€œthe voter suppression claimâ€ will be a fixture of Democratsâ€™ post-election narrative.
To defeat Democrats in the legal arena, Davis said the key is for Trump supporters to turn out early.
The early voting blog is updated!
Rs have added 2K to lead, which is now 31,000, or 5%. GOP surge slowed a bit Saturday, but Republicans still gained.
Dems need to decisively win indies to make this a late Election Night.
Down-ballot update, too!https://t.co/Pl43XBMcPA
â€” Jon Ralston (@RalstonReports) October 27, 2024
â€œEarly voting is crucial because it guarantees that your voters can actually vote and donâ€™t get disenfranchised on Election Day,â€ Davis explained, adding that early voting allows the Trump campaign to spend more resources on voters who havenâ€™t turned out yet.
Duke predicted that early voting will be the crutch Democrats use to cope with a Trump victory. She explained she recently heard the argument that because journalists are reporting turnout numbers ahead of time, they are â€œsuppressing turnoutâ€ before the election even arrives.
â€œI guess the Democrats are going to be against early voting because it didnâ€™t go in their favor this time around,â€ Duke remarked.
Violence in the streets, a media meltdown and lawsuits would be predictable results of a second Trump victory. Security concerns may not be top of mind, but former Secret Service members said they should be.
Three months ago the former president took a shot to the head. Since then, reports have shown the Secret Service is not in a position to adequately protect him. The former agents warned that Trump could be in more danger as the 47th president than ever.
â€œThis is uncharted territory for the Secret Service. Iâ€™ve never seen a threat landscape like we see now directed against President Trump,â€ former secret service agent Tim Miller told the Caller.
Miller explained that right now everyone is worried about â€œthe guy on the roof with a rifle,â€ but he raised concerns about a car bomb, a plane, a biohazard attack â€” all things Trump could be susceptible to if the Secret Service isnâ€™t prepared. And as of right now, he told the Caller, it seems as if they are not ready to handle the magnitude of the situation. (RELATED: Despite Skyrocketing Budget, Secret Service Canâ€™t Seem To Find The Money To Protect The President)
â€œThe Secret Service ought to be the most technology-savvy organization in all of government, and yet theyâ€™re 10 years behind the Department of Defense in terms of drone technology,â€ Miller told the Caller.
Miller compared agentsâ€™ lack of experience with drone technology at Trumpâ€™s Butler, Pennsylvania rally to a pro football team showing up to a game without a ball.
Miller made it clear that he didnâ€™t fault the officers themselves for being ill-prepared, rather he saw the leadership to blame.
Rich Staropoli, a former Secret Service agent, told the Caller that Trumpâ€™s high-profile family and global threats will bring additional security concerns not considered under the Biden administration. The biggest issue, however, is the agencyâ€™s lack of ability to retain officers.
â€œWhen I was there, we never had a problem going to other federal agencies and saying, â€˜hey, we need a dozen guys. We need 50 guys,'â€ Staropoli told the Caller, adding that help was provided and legalities were sorted out later.
â€œWhereâ€™s the hesitancy in doing that? But itâ€™s obvious it isnâ€™t being done. Thatâ€™s a problem,â€ Staropoli continued.
There is one other person to consider in the aftermath of the Nov. 5 election: Kamala Harris.
Democrats have rallied behind Harris in 2024 after a tumultuous term as vice president. Her future in Democratic politics could rest in the balance of Nov. 5â€™s results.
â€œThey would not be happy to lose, but either outcome would be fine to them,â€ Duke told the Caller. â€œOn one hand, they win, and on the other they get rid of Kamala.â€

title: â€˜The Dang Thing Would Explodeâ€™: Sen. John Kennedy Suggests Kamala Harris Could Break A Polygraph By Walking Near It
content:
Republican Sen. John Kennedy of Louisiana sarcastically remarked during a Saturday night appearance on Fox News that Vice President Kamala Harris could cause a polygraph machine to blow up by simply walking near it.
Harris has escalated attacks on former President Donald Trump, most recently labeling him a â€œfascistâ€ during a CNN town hall on Wednesday. While speaking to Fox Newsâ€™ Brian Kilmeade, Kennedy said that Harris is falling behind Trump because Americans are â€œuncertainâ€ about what she would do if elected to the presidency. (RELATED: â€˜Youâ€™ve Lied To Usâ€™: Chris Sununu Blasts Kamala Harris For â€˜Absolutely Condescendingâ€™ Campaign)
WATCH:

Vice President Harris has adopted a new strategy. Joy is out. Sheâ€™s adopted the Hillary Clinton deplorable strategy of 2016, which is if you vote for President Trump, you are a bad person.â€

title: â€˜Shut The Hell Upâ€™: Charlamagne Melts Down Over Caller Saying Trump Isnâ€™t â€˜Naziâ€™
content:
Radio host Charlamagne Tha God on Thursday appeared to lose his temper at a Virginia caller named Mike who asserted former President Donald Trumpâ€™s record proves he is not a bigot.
Trumpâ€™s former White House chief of staff, John Kelly, told The New York Times and The Atlantic that the former president exhibited â€œfascistâ€ tendencies and allegedly praised Adolf Hitler, which the Trump campaign has denied. Mike, on â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ said Trumpâ€™s history of publicly associating with prominent black figures indicates heâ€™s not â€œracist,â€ but Charlamagne sharply disagreed, challenging Mikeâ€™s logic and trying to dismantle his argument. (RELATED: Harris Fails To Explain Flip-Flops, Says She Has No Regrets About Biden In First Interview)
LISTEN:
â€œNo disrespect to nobody, man. I know everybody in that radio station more than likely gonâ€™ vote Democrat, but itâ€™s just kind of funny, the rhetoric about Trump being a racist,â€ Mike said. â€œI mean, I do my Googles, man and I see this man having pictures with all kinds of famous black people that you guys are fans of, especially I see him standing next to Rosa Parks. I mean, for crying out loud people, how can this man be a Nazi, a Hitler? That shit is crazy. No disrespect.â€
â€œSo thatâ€™s all it takes? So if you take a picture with a gay person, does that make you gay?â€ Charlamagne asked, to which Mike answered, â€œNah.â€

Iâ€™m not voting this year â€¦ I donâ€™t trust the Democrats, and I damn sure ainâ€™t voting for Hitler Jr. Whatever happens gonâ€™ happen.â€

title: UK Socialist Leader Insists Heâ€™s Still Good Friends With Trump After Party Staffers Plan Trip To Help Harris
content:
United Kingdom (U.K.) Prime Minister Keir Starmer â€” a self-admitted socialist â€” is insisting heâ€™s very good friends with former President Donald Trump, even as Trumpâ€™s campaign has recently filed a complaint against Starmerâ€™s party for sending staffers to campaign for Kamala Harris.
There were reports last week that a high-level Labour Party staffer was organizing a trip to fly approximately 100 party staffers into the U.S. to campaign on behalf of Harrisâ€™ campaign, raising concerns about potential foreign election interference. Trumpâ€™s campaign filed a legal complaint against the Labour Party following the reports, but Starmer brushed aside concerns that the move was illegal and assured reporters on Wednesday that he was still â€œgood friendsâ€ with Trump, according to multiple reports. (RELATED: â€˜Unacceptableâ€™: County Fires Election Worker After Republican Spots Ballot Security Lapse In Realtime)
Starmer is now the prime minister of the U.K. after the Labour Party won the countryâ€™s elections in July, ousting the Conservative Party and former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak from power. Starmer will have to work with either Trump or Harris on maintaining U.S.-U.K. relations depending on which candidate wins in the November presidential elections.
â€œI spent time in New York with President Trump, had dinner with him and my purpose in doing that was to make sure that between the two of us, we established a good relationship, which we did,â€ Starmer told reporters. â€œWe had a good, constructive discussion and, of course, as prime minister of the United Kingdom I will work with whoever the American people return as their president.â€
Starmer also told reporters that Labour had sent staffers to volunteer in previous U.S. elections, according to reports.
â€œTheyâ€™re doing it in their spare time, theyâ€™re doing it as volunteers, theyâ€™re staying I think with other volunteers over there. Thatâ€™s what theyâ€™ve done in previous elections, thatâ€™s what theyâ€™re doing in this election and thatâ€™s really straightforward,â€ Starmer said.
The Labour Party said it isnâ€™t funding the trip and that staffers choosing to go campaign on behalf of Harris have to go on their own dime, according to Politico EU.
The rules and regulations surrounding how foreign nationals can participate in the U.S. election process are strict. Besides the obvious law prohibiting foreign nationals from voting in a U.S. election, they also cannot donate to a political campaign, according to the Federal Election Commission (FEC). Foreign nationals can volunteer for a campaign, but they cannot be a part of the decision-making process as to how the campaign should operate.
The Labour Party insists its staffer trip to the U.S. is in compliance with these laws, according to Politico EU. But the Trump campaign feels there are aspects to the trip that may be crossing the line.
â€œThose searching for foreign interference in our elections need to look no further than [the] LinkedIn post,â€ the Trump campaign wrote in a legal complaint to the FEC.
The Trump campaign did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

title: Walz Reportedly Had Romantic Relationship With Chinaâ€™s Wang In His 20â€™s
content:
Kamala Harrisâ€™ running mate Tim Walz allegedly had a passionate romance with the daughter of a high-ranking Chinese Communist Party (CCP) official, the Daily Mail reported Monday.
Walz engaged in the secret tryst with Jenna Wang, then an English language teacher, during his 1989 teaching stint in the Chinese city Foshan, she told the Daily Mail.
Wang claimed the pair did not show any public affection to each other as it apparently would have bothered Wangâ€™s father, Bin Hui, a high-ranking CCP official and chairman of a labor union in her home city Guilin, according to the outlet. Walz married Gwen Whipple in 1994.
â€œMy father would have been very, very angry and sad if he had found out,â€ Wang told the outlet.
The pair allegedly slept together and spent nights romantically dancing to the song â€œCareless Whisperâ€ by George Michael, according to the outlet.
The pair apparently talked about getting married, she told the Daily Mail. She claimed she left her teaching post in 1992 because she thought their relationship would become official.
Things soured, however, when Walz allegedly insinuated Wang was only marrying him for a US passport.
â€œThis was very offensive,â€ Wang told the outlet. â€œI wasnâ€™t giving up my life and my position to move to Nebraska, a cold place in the middle of nowhere that most Chinese people had never heard of.â€
Wang said the way Walz treated her made her feel â€œlike a prostituteâ€ and claimed she contemplated killing herself as a result, the Daily Mail reported.
â€œKnowing now that he wasnâ€™t going to marry me made me feel cheap and common,â€ Wang told the outlet. (RELATED: â€˜Timmy Got Issuesâ€™: Edgar The Puppetâ€™s Rap Debut | MUSIC VIDEO OUT NOW)
Walzâ€™s alleged clandestine affair is another chapter in what is becoming a long and complex Chinese backstory for the Democratic Minnesota governor.
After his initial August 1989 teaching trip to Foshan, Walz started to head up yearly summer visits to China with students from Nebraska and Minnesota, according to the Daily Mail.
His cultural enrichment extended both ways as he also invited CCP officials to his Nebraska classroom in 1996, according to exclusive reporting from the Daily Caller News Foundation (DCNF).
He also appointed a man affiliated with a minor Chinese political party â€œloyalâ€ to the CCP to a state board in Minnesota in May 2020, according to the DCNF.
Walz received a mountain of criticism after seemingly lying about being in China during the deadly Tiananmen Square protests of 1989. The protests took place from April to June 1989, according to Britannica. Walz previously claimed, in separate instances, that he was there in May and June 1989. He later walked back those statements and claimed he was a knucklehead. CheckYourFact reported that Walz likely did not travel to China until August of that year.
â€œTim lied about Tiananmen Square and heâ€™s lied about other things,â€ Wang told the Daily Mail
â€˜This is a very crucial moment in history and a man like this does not appear to have the character and integrity to do one of the most important jobs in the world,â€ Wang concluded.

title: â€˜There Wasnâ€™t Oneâ€™: Dana Bash Says Kamala Harris Failed To â€˜Close The Dealâ€™ On Policy During Town Hall
content:
CNN host Dana Bash conceded Wednesday night that Vice President Kamala Harris was not able to â€œclose the dealâ€ with voters on policy during a town hall hosted by the network.
Harris took part in the town hall moderated by CNN host Anderson Cooper, during which she called former President Donald Trump a fascist, but also delivered â€œword saladâ€ answers. Bash said that Harris did not outline any legislative priorities for a potential administration. (RELATED: â€˜She Did Very Poorlyâ€™: Geraldo Rivera Hammers Harris Over Response To Border Questions)
WATCH:
â€œIâ€™ll just tell you what Iâ€™m hearing from people who I have been talking to, and that is that if her goal was to close the deal, theyâ€™re not sure she did that. And, you know, some people have asked, is she being held to a different standard? Maybe,â€ Bash said. â€œBut thatâ€™s maybe the world that sheâ€™s living in.â€
â€œAnd on the question of who she is, people are understanding that a little bit more. But what she will do, the question about her legislative priorities, name one, there wasnâ€™t one,â€ Bash told CNN host Jake Tapper. â€œYou know, some more of her personality and her sort of character questions about your weaknesses or what mistakes did you make, not necessarily the answers there. Having said that, any time that she can be in front of an audience and interacting with voters is a win as far as her campaign goes, and they are very happy about that.â€
Harris initially rarely did interviews and had not taken questions at a press conference since replacing President Joe Biden after he announced he would not seek reelection July 21. She did a media blitz earlier in October, which included an Oct. 16 interview with Fox News host Bret Baier, who pressed the vice president on the border and Bidenâ€™s declining health.
Prior to the interview with Baier, Harris did interviews or appearances with â€œ60 Minutes,â€ shock jock Howard Stern, the co-hosts of â€œThe View,â€ the â€œCall Her Daddyâ€ podcast and CBS late-night host Stephen Colbert. (Watch The Daily Caller Documentary â€œCleaning Up Kamalaâ€)
A Wall Street Journal poll shows Trump leading Harris by two points, 47% to 45%, with the vice presidentâ€™s favorability at only 45% compared to a 53% unfavorable rating two weeks before the Nov. 5 election.
Trump trails Harris by 0.2% in the RealClearPolling average of polls from Oct. 8 to 22, with the gap increasing to 0.6% when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys.

title: Feds Fund â€˜Environmental Justiceâ€™ Literacy And â€˜LGBTQ+â€™ Health In Chicago Public Schools As Students Fall Behind
content:
Roughly 40% of public school students in Chicago are chronically absent, commonly defined as missing at least 10% of days in a given school year, and the vast majority of the students actually showing up to class lack proficiency in math and reading. Amid these conditions, CPS asked federal agencies for funds to increase studentsâ€™ â€œliteracy for environmental justiceâ€ and to improve â€œmental health equityâ€ for racial minority and â€œLGBTQ+â€ pupils, according to government spending records.
The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) awarded over $400,000 to CPS in August after the district requested funds to help improve the health of its â€œLGBTQ+â€ and newcomer students, according to government spending records. The six-figure grant will help address the issues that arise from higher rates of risky sexual behavior, drug usage and worse mental health statuses among LGBT students. (Stream The Daily Callerâ€™s documentary â€˜Cleaning Up Kamalaâ€™ HERE)
Even as the proportion of chronically absent students remains high, and as test scores remain low, CPS boasts a graduation rate of 83%. The Illinois Policy Institute, a right-of-center think tank, has accused CPS of â€œpromoting students who havenâ€™t mastered critical skillsâ€ and argued that doing so â€œis unfair to those students and sets them up for frustration later in life.â€
Another grant appeal CPS made to HHS cites the disproportionately poor health outcomes of black and â€œLatinxâ€ students to request resources to fund â€œtraining for [a] mental health equityâ€ program that â€œlinks mental health awareness with a foundational understanding of bias-based harm,â€ records show. The grant, worth nearly a half million dollars and awarded to the district in August, will train school administrators to improve their proficiency in â€œrecognizing, preventing, responding to and transforming incidents of bias and discrimination.â€
As of 2023, over 80% of CPS students between third and eighth grade failed to meet grade-level standards for math with roughly three-quarters failing to meet the standards for reading, according to the Illinois Policy Institute. While students struggle with basic literacy in Chicago, the school board has appealed to the federal government to foster â€œliteracy for environmental justiceâ€ among students, according to federal records.
The Department of Commerce (DOC) approved a $75,000 grant proposal from CPS to prepare students for â€œsuccess in civic lifeâ€ by teaching them to investigate and understand â€œscientific solutions which build resilience to extreme weather and climate change,â€ according to federal spending records.
As CPS requested financial assistance to fund environmental and racial justice, the district faced a half-billion-dollar deficit coming into this school year, The Washington Post reported. The financial shortfall was the product of CPSâ€™ refusal to make spending cuts as the districtâ€™s $2.8 billion in COVID-19 relief funding dries up. Even as the district faces an uncertain financial future, the local teachersâ€™ union is pushing for more hiring and increased pay.
â€œThis is what it looks like when you burn a district down,â€ Georgetown University education professor Marguerite Roza told The Post. â€œIt is a level of dysfunction that feels beyond destabilizing, enough to make people lose confidence in the system.â€
Amid the failure to resolve the budgetary tension with the mayor, every member of Chicagoâ€™s school board resigned in October.
CPS, DOC and HHS did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s requests for comment.

title: DOJ Sends Muskâ€™s PAC Warning Over $1 Million Voter Lottery
content:
The Justice Department(DOJ) reportedly notified Elon Muskâ€™s America PAC that its $1 million sweepstakes for registered voters in key swing states might contravene federal regulations, according to The Wall Street Journal.
These payments might breach laws against compensating people to register or vote in elections involving federal candidates, according to the DOJâ€™s letter, WSJ reported. Muskâ€™s political action committee has been actively promoting the chance to win $1 million for registered voters in Pennsylvania and six other pivotal states who pledge their support for free speech and gun rights by signing a petition.
The America Pac declined to comment but a spokesperson earlier claimed their cash awards were entirely legal, suggesting that the outcry from media only aids their cause. â€œThe PAC is confident in the legality of this initiative and the predictable media meltdown is only helping America PACâ€™s efforts to support President Trump,â€ a representative said earlier this week, WSJ stated.
The Justice Department has written to Elon Muskâ€™s America PAC cautioning him that giving cash payments to voters who sign a petition might violate federal law, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/4AcFbc6jic
â€” WSJ Politics (@WSJPolitics) October 23, 2024
Three voters from Pennsylvania and one in North Carolina have secured million-dollar rewards, with daily drawings set to continue through Election Day, targeting both new and existing registrants, WSJ reported. Musk stated that the million-dollar rewards from his PAC come without conditions, except for the expectation that winners advocate for his petition.
The sweepstakes aims to boost voter registrations in battleground areas as he fervently supports former President Donald Trumpâ€™s re-election bid. Musk announced at a Pennsylvania rally for Trumpâ€™s campaign Saturday evening that he will give $1 million daily to one individual. (RELATED: British Group With Ties To Harris, Democrats Aims To â€˜Kill Muskâ€™s Twitter,â€™ Documents Say)
UCLA law professor Rick Hasen previously raised a question about whether a constitutional amendment is necessary to curb the campaign influence of ultra-wealthy individuals like Musk. Hasen pointed out on MSNBC that under current law, efforts to curb election spending by the ultra-rich have been deemed unconstitutional, affirming the legality of Muskâ€™s activities with his super PAC and other ventures.
The Justice Department and America PAC did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

While on a trip to New Hampshire to talk about lowering the cost of prescription drugs, President Joe Biden said â€œwe gotta lock him upâ€ after discussing what he expected Trump to do during a second term. Biden in NH lists what Trump would do as president and says: â€œwe gotta lock him upâ€ and then, appearing to realize how his comments would be taken, adds: â€œpolitically, lock him up.â€ pic.twitter.com/cw3X8RzKn2

title: The Leftâ€™s â€˜Jim Crow 2.0â€™ Propaganda Crumbles For Good As States Set Early Voting Records
content:
Since the 2020 election and its climax on Jan. 6, 2021, the Democratic Party, its activists and its media apparatchiks have portrayed Republican-led election integrity efforts as a sinister plot to disenfranchise black voters and rebuild Jim Crow South.
The unhinged rhetoric had its origins in the battleground state of Georgia, where, in March 2021, the state passed a law that placed restrictions on absentee ballots and enhanced the verification process for said ballots, requiring a photo ID, driverâ€™s license or state ID number or the last four digits of oneâ€™s Social Security number instead of a signature match. President Joe Biden attacked the new rules, which he described as â€œJim Crow in the 21st Century,â€ and accused Georgia Republicans of voter suppression. In the aftermath, the Biden Department of Justice (DOJ) launched a lawsuit against the state, while Major League Baseball (MLB) boycotted its own All-Star Game in Atlanta. (RELATED: Georgiaâ€™s New Voting Law â€” Myths And Facts)
Biden and the Democratic Party only escalated their rhetoric nearly a year later, with Biden doubling down on the â€œJim Crowâ€ propaganda.
â€œTheir endgame? To turn the will of the voters into a mere suggestion â€” something states can respect or ignore,â€ Biden said in Atlanta, Georgia, in January 2022. â€œJim Crow 2.0 is about two insidious things: voter suppression and election subversion. Itâ€™s no longer about who gets to vote; itâ€™s about making it harder to vote. Itâ€™s about who gets to count the vote and whether your vote counts at all. Itâ€™s not hyperbole; this is a fact.â€
Despite the hysteria, Georgia saw a record turnout for the 2022 Midterm Elections. Now in the 2024 Election, the battleground state, which broke for Biden and delivered the Senate to Democrats in 2020, is shattering its previous record, with over 1.4 million voters casting a ballot in just one week of early voting.
Other Republican-controlled swing states, such as Texas and North Carolina, have also taken steps to ensure election integrity. Texas passed its own election security bill in 2021 after Georgiaâ€™s in March of that year. In September 2024, officials announced that the North Carolina State Board of Elections had removed 747,000 names from the stateâ€™s voter rolls within the past 20 months for reasons including death, felony convictions or a failure to register new addresses after moving to a different county.
Like Georgia, North Carolina saw a new record in early voting this election, with more than 350,000 ballots casted Oct. 17. Another 150,000 ballots were casted by afternoon of Oct. 18, even though the Western half of the state is still reeling from the devastation of Hurricane Helene, according to The Washington Post.
Republican Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry signed an election integrity executive order in August that requires the stateâ€™s Office of Motor Vehicles to share names of foreign nationals and non-permanent residents with the Secretary of Stateâ€™s office. State agencies must include a notice that U.S. citizenship is required to vote when distributing voter registration materials, according to the order. None of these rules come close to the level of disenfranchisement seen throughout the actual Jim Crow South, before Civil Rights legislation in the 60s. And of course, Louisiana has already set a new record for early voting, with 176,882 ballots cast Oct. 18., a 1.3% increase from the first day of early voting in 2020.
Early voting in Texas starts Monday, and if Georgia, Louisiana and North Carolina are any indicators, the Lone Star state will also see a record or two broken. The pace of 2024â€™s early voting might also point to a record-breaking voter turnout across all states.
Whether more Americans turn out to vote in 2024 than 2020, these early numbers should finally put to bed the leftâ€™s fear-mongering that Republicans are instituting a new wave of Jim Crow. Although itâ€™s difficult to say whether Democrats believe their conspiracies, their rhetoric is nonetheless a potent, if poisonous, political attack that does more harm than good to U.S. elections. It is also an insult to the black Americans who lived through actual Jim Crow and to the Civil Rights activists who worked to overturn racist laws, not laws that simply require so much as photo ID to vote.

title: Jake Paul Reveals Why Heâ€™s Supporting Trump
content:
Jake Paul threw his support behind Donald Trump for the 2024 U.S. Presidential election in a passionate video posted Oct. 31.
Paul acknowledged that he couldnâ€™t actually vote himself, after rescinding his right to do so when he moved to Puerto Rico. He noted that his inability to vote â€œdoesnâ€™t mean I canâ€™t present my 80 million-large audience with proper facts, numbers and data to encourage them to vote in the proper direction to quite literally save America,â€ he said.
Paul went on to quote stats that read strongly in Trumpâ€™s favor, and he knocked Harrisâ€™ celebrity endorsements.
Paul began by noting he was prepared for the backlash after sharing his political views.
â€œUh nervous, scared to make this video because of what it means in terms of my career, my life, people coming after me â€” more accusations, more turmoil, more
division, potentially,â€ he said. â€œHowever, I just want to provide information to the potentially undecided voter the things that I have seen over the past couple of
years that have led me in a certain direction as to who I am supporting in this presidential election.â€
Paul brought up how the economy, the border crisis and gender ideology were all issues that have swayed him in favor of Trump.
He reiterated that he expected backlash for presenting his views in the video but declared he was not scared of the â€œliberal left media.â€ He then encouraged his fanbase to see through the celebrities that endorsed Harris. (Stream Daily Callerâ€™s latest documentary â€˜Cleaning Up Kamalaâ€™ HERE)
â€œDo your own research, and base that research in the truth, not just reckless propaganda, or your favorite pop star telling you to vote a certain way and you believing them because you love their song,â€ Paul said.
â€œMost of your favorite celebrities, athletes, all of them are secretly conservative because the left has created a world where conservatives like me speaking out have major, major consequences,â€ he said.
Paul clarified that the comments made by Hinchcliffe about Puerto Rico were not uttered by Trump himself, and put the focus back on Trumpâ€™s accomplishments, compared to Harrisâ€™ failures. He pointed to the fact that inflation has been worse under the Biden Administration than during the Trump years.
Kamala has â€ basically no accomplishmentsâ€ while in office, Paul said,
He went on to detail his perception of Trump.
â€œDo I think Donald Trump is a perfect human being? No, I donâ€™t think anybody on this planet is a perfect human being, myself included. Donâ€™t judge people off of a character that the media has portrayed them to be,â€ he said.
â€œTo be frank, Iâ€™m not concerned with Donald Trumpâ€™s character flaws or what heâ€™s done in the past â€” what Iâ€™m concerned with is how good of a president he is, because that is his job and that is whatâ€™s going to affect the people of This Nation.â€
Paul criticized the current dynamic of conservatives not being able to voice their opinions without major backlash from the left.
â€œThatâ€™s only going to get worse unless people like myself stand up and say fuck the system.â€
â€œI canâ€™t sit back and watch this blasphemy unfold in front of me any longer,â€ Paul said. (RELATED: Usher Creates Cringe Video With Kamala Harris After Saying Heâ€™s Staying Out Of Politics)
â€œEven if you hate me for making this video, my message to you is, I love you even if you are lost. Genuinely, from the bottom of my heart, I have love for all of the people of America.â€
â€œDo the right thing and vote for Donald Trump.â€

title: â€˜Transparently Politicalâ€™: Jonathan Turley Says Soros-Backed DA Trying To Pull Elon Musk Off Campaign Trail
content:
George Washington University law professor Jonathan Turley said Thursday that Philadelphia District Attorney Larry Krasnerâ€™s suit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk was â€œtransparently political.â€

I think the filings his office has made are transparently political,â€ Turley said. â€œThey want to pull Musk off the campaign and into a Philadelphia courtroom. If you are going to be competing in this lottery, you have to be participating in the political process. The other side is saying itâ€™s illegal to pay people to register or to vote.â€
Musk, who funds America PAC, a super-PAC that is seeking to boost former President Donald Trump in Michigan, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, North Carolina, Georgia, Arizona and Nevada, announced Oct. 20 he would give $1 million each day to a random signatory to a petition on the PACâ€™s website.

Crime in Philadelphia has skyrocketed during Krasnerâ€™s tenure as district attorney, with a news anchor noting that over 1,000 people had been killed in 20 months in a contentious September 2022 interview with the district attorney.

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams To Stand Trial In April On Federal Corruption Charges
content:
Democratic New York City Mayor Eric Adams is set to go to trial on federal corruption charges starting April 21, 2025, a U.S. judge ruled on Friday.
U.S. District Judge Dale Ho set the date at a hearing in Manhattan federal court over the opposition of Adamsâ€™ defense lawyer, Alex Spiro, who wanted the trial over the mayorâ€™s alleged dealings with Turkish officials to end by March, well before the Democratic primary election in June, according to Reuters. Adams pleaded not guilty in September, with Spiro predicting he would be acquitted and warning of â€œgrave, grave democratic concernsâ€ if Adams does not have enough time to clear his name before voters go to the polls.
â€œIt doesnâ€™t give him a realistic chance,â€ Spiro said, Reuters reported. Judge Ho, however, pointed out the necessity for a fair and thorough process, citing the need for more time to review and turn over evidence, including potential classified materials.
Federal prosecutors in Manhattan charged Adams in September with allegedly accepting bribes, including flight upgrades and luxury hotel stays, as well as illegal campaign contributions, in exchange for pressuring city officials to greenlight Turkeyâ€™s new 36-story consulate, despite alleged safety concerns. The trial, expected to last about a month, will examine these and other actions the prosecution alleges constitute a breach of public trust. (RELATED: Major Blue City Mayor Undermines Harrisâ€™s â€˜Fascistâ€™ Accusation Against Trump, Makes Call To â€˜Dial Down The Temperatureâ€™)
Democrat New York City Mayor Eric Adams was indicted on five federal charges relating to illegal contributions to his 2021 campaign.
Here are the charges: pic.twitter.com/mSWffq6rwo
â€” Daily Caller (@DailyCaller) September 26, 2024
Adams received an unexpected nod from former President Donald Trump, who, like Adams, faces a legal battle while campaigning for office. â€œGood luck with everything, they went after you,â€ Trump said during an event, Newsweek reported.
Trump also faced 34 felony charges over alleged falsification of business records tied to a â€œhush moneyâ€ payment to adult film actress Stormy Daniels. The jury found Trump guilty in May.
Adams claims heâ€™s been targeted by the Biden Department of Justice for his comments on the illegal immigration crisis.
â€œDespite our pleas, when the federal government did nothing as its broken immigration policies overloaded our shelter system with no relief, I put the people of New York before party and politics,â€ Adams said. â€œI always knew that if I stood my ground for all of you, that I would be a target â€” and a target I became.â€

content:

And Harris would do much better if she talked with some detail about exactly what she will do. Not what she wants, not her objectives, but how sheâ€™s going to get there,â€ Luntz said. â€œTrump basically has reached the ceiling of his votes and thatâ€™s enough for him to win.â€

I agree with her campaign in that assertion, but sheâ€™s not going to get there until she gives voters what they need to know to have faith, trust and confidence in her,â€ the pollster added. â€œItâ€™s a good strategy that sheâ€™s doing, but I assure you, if sheâ€™s just beating up on Donald Trump, sheâ€™s going to fail.â€
Luntz added what Trump and Harris â€œsay and how they say it the last 48 hoursâ€ of the campaign â€œthat will determineâ€ the ultimate vote tally.

title: Steve Bannon Eligible For Home Confinement But Prison Couldnâ€™t Process His Release In Time, Warden Says
content:
Former Trump advisor Steve Bannon is now eligible for home confinement, but the prison was unable to process his request due to his short sentence, the warden wrote Tuesday.
Though Bannon has 10 time credits under the First Step Act that could have allowed his release from the Federal Correctional Institution in Danbury, Connecticut, to home confinement on Oct. 19, his sentence is too short to secure approval, Acting Warden Darek Puzio told Bannonâ€™s attorneys in a letter. Bannon is set to be released when his full sentence is up on Oct. 29.
â€œThe Regional Reentry Management Office overseeing your clientâ€™ s release area advised their Residential Reentry Centers, which monitor home confinement placements, that they will not accept placements under 30 days,â€ Puzio wrote.
Bannonâ€™s attorneys asked the judge Monday to grant Bannonâ€™s request for early release in light of the wardenâ€™s admission.
â€œBut for that bureaucratic processing delay, Mr. Bannon presumably would have been released to home confinement two days ago,â€ his attorneys wrote. â€œThere is no reason for Mr. Bannon to remain in prison despite earning those credits.â€
A spokesperson for the Federal Bureau of Prisons told the Daily Caller News Foundation the bureau â€œdoes not comment on the conditions of confinement for any incarcerated individual.â€ (RELATED: Steve Bannon Asks To Be Released From Prison Pending Appeal)
Bannon reported to prison for his four-month sentence July 1 after the Supreme Court declined to postpone the sentence pending his appeal.
He was convicted in 2022 on contempt of Congress charges for ignoring a subpoena from the Jan. 6 committee. A federal appeals court upheld the conviction in May.
Bannon called Vice President Kamala Harris the â€œQueen of Mass Incarcerationsâ€ in a statement to the National Pulse on Friday, saying she isâ€detested by black and hispanic men who are refusing to turn out and vote for her.â€
â€œShe has done nothing to implement President Trumpâ€™s heroic First Step Act, in fact welcoming hundreds of thousands of hardened illegal migrant criminals while allowing US citizens eligible for early release to rot in prison,â€ he said. â€œNo mass deportations, but continual mass incarcerations.â€

Bannon was was taken into custody July 1 following an order from Judge Carl J. Nichols granting prosecutorsâ€™ motion requiring the â€œWar Roomâ€ host to serve the four-month sentence he received in Oct. 2022.
Bureau of Prisons spokesperson Randilee Giamusso confirmed Bannonâ€™s release, according to NBC News. Bannon started his sentence shortly before Vice President Kamala Harris replaced President Joe Biden on the Democrat ticket.

title: Dem-Appointed Election Official Assures Voters Drop Boxes Are One Of â€˜The Most Secureâ€™ Ways To Vote
content:
Democratic Wisconsin Election Commissioner Ann Jacobs claimed Tuesday that drop boxes were among â€œthe most secureâ€ ways to vote, blaming â€œconspiracy theoristsâ€ for causing voters to be skeptical of their reliability.
In-person early voting in the swing state started Tuesday, USA Today reported. MSNBC host Chris Jansing noted during the interview with Jacobs that the number of known drop box locations in the state had declined to 107 from over 500 in the 2020 election, with the Wisconsin election commissioner saying â€œconspiracy theoriesâ€ are to blame for the sharp decline. (RELATED: NY Times Poll Shows Harrisâ€™ Support Among Key Voter Bloc In â€˜Dangerously Low Territoryâ€™)
WATCH:
â€œI tell them that it is the most secure way short of handing your ballot to your clerkâ€™s hands. It goes through,â€ Jacobs claimed. â€œWe have guidelines for the Wisconsin Elections Commission, for all of the communities in the state on how to make sure theyâ€™re safe and secure, how to make sure that the chain of custody between the drop box and the clerk occurs.â€
â€œI always tell people, think about how many people touch a piece of mail, if you put it in your mailbox to go out into the mail stream, it goes to your postal carrier, it goes to a sorting entity,â€ Jacobs said. â€œFor a lot of the state of Wisconsin, it goes to one of the two major cities, either Minneapolis in Minnesota or to Milwaukee, and then it gets redistributed and redelivered. So drop boxes are just a great, safe way to turn in your absentee ballots, and itâ€™s disappointing that conspiracy theorists have caused that to be limited for some voters.â€
Former President Donald Trump leads Vice President Kamala Harris by 0.4% in Wisconsin, according to the RealClear Polling average of polls taken from Sept. 28 to Oct. 20, with six of the last seven polls showing the former president either in the lead or a tie. The vice president leads Trump by 0.6% when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys of the state.
Trump won Wisconsin in the 2016 election, edging former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton by 0.7%, and lost to then-former Vice President Joe Biden by 0.7% in 2020. In both years, the opinion polls understated Trumpâ€™s support by at least six percentage points.

title: Republicans Hopeful â€˜Historicâ€™ Early Vote Turnout Could Enable Unexpected Swing State Candidate To Flip The Senate
content:
LAS VEGAS, Nevada â€” Republican Senate candidate Sam Brown has polled behind the Democratic incumbent for his entire race, but the party is hoping a strong early vote turnout will carry him across the finish line.
While the race has narrowed, Brown still trails opponent Sen. Jacky Rosen by around 4%, according to the Real Clear Polling average. Republicansâ€™ unusual early voting lead has them feeling optimistic a victory for former President Donald Trump could mean down-ballot success.
â€œWeâ€™ve got a great shot,â€ Brown told the Daily Caller News Foundation at a Las Vegas campaign event on Friday, citing â€œhistoric turnoutâ€ in early voting.
A veteran who survived with serious burn injuries from an explosion in Afghanistan, Brown calls himself a fighter. He believes he can be the one to hand his party the Senate majority.
Brown was just two points behind Rosen in the most recent Trafalgar Group poll of Nevada voters between Oct. 25 and Oct. 28, narrowing from Rosenâ€™s five point lead earlier in the month.
Republicans have an over 40,000 vote lead in the state between mail ballots and in-person early votes, according to numbers released Monday night. In Clark County, typically known as a â€œfirewallâ€ for Democrats, Republicans are down only around 3,000 votes.
â€œThe rural counties are turning out in a massive number, completely offsetting what has been, you know, the firewall the Democrats used to have in Clark County and Washoe County,â€ Brown told the DCNF.
Despite Democrat efforts to flip Washoe County, Brown said â€œRepublicans are still holding an advantage there.â€ (RELATED: Swing State Republicans Are Leaning Into Ballot Harvesting â€” And It Seems To Be Working)
Long-time Nevada political reporter Jon Ralston has been stressing that this pattern is unprecedented. He warned on Sunday that Democrats must shift the trend or â€œcarnage ensues.â€
â€œI know people want to keep comparing this year to 2020 or 2022, but at the risk of repeating myself: This is a unicorn year,â€ Ralston, editor of The Nevada Independent, wrote Monday on his early voting blog. â€œWe have never seen this.â€
In 2022, Republican candidate Adam Laxalt lost to Democratic Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto by just over 9,000 votes.
Last week, the GOP-aligned Senate Leadership Fund dumped a last-minute $6.2 million into the race for TV, radio and digital ads in an effort to flip Rosenâ€™s seat. Real Clear Polling also changed the race label Oct. 18 from leans Democrat to â€œToss Up.â€
Brown told the DCNF that people he speaks to at the polls are â€œenthusiastic.â€
â€œAlmost everyone who walked by was wanting to stop and take pictures,â€ he said. â€œThereâ€™s optimism and hope that you can see. That people see that the American Dream that they feared was at risk is not dead and that hope is right around the corner.â€
Brown visited Reno on Saturday for a Save Womenâ€™s Sports rally with Riley Gaines in support of the University of Nevada, Reno Womenâ€™s Volleyball team, which decided to forfeit its game against San Jose State University over a male player. At an veterans event Monday, Republican Arkansas Sen. Tom Cotton joined Brown to campaign. (RELATED: â€˜Iâ€™m The Underdogâ€™: Dave McCormick Sees â€˜Momentumâ€™ In Uphill Battle For Pivotal Senate Seat)
â€œWe put a lot of effort into reaching out to our Hispanic community, reaching out to our Asian American Pacific Islander community, reaching out to our black community,â€ Brown told the DCNF. â€œThis is a campaign for all Nevadans, not just Republicans.â€
Brown met on Friday with Asian American and Pacific Islander voters at a Chinese restaurant before heading to an event at the Clark County GOPâ€™s office with Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Whatley, where he spoke to volunteers.
Whatley outlined how Brown could be the one who carries Republicans into the majority.
â€œWe know weâ€™re going to win West Virginia. Joe Manchin didnâ€™t even run. That gives us 50,â€ he said. â€œWhere are we going to get 51? Sam Brown.â€
In Pennsylvania, Republicans could pick up a seat in Senate candidate Dave McCormickâ€™s tightening race. The party may also have opportunities in Ohio, Wisconsin and Michigan, Whatley said.
â€œBut Iâ€™ll tell you what: for my money, our 51st vote is coming right out of Nevada,â€ Whatley said.

title: ROOKE: These Are The Early Results That Will Tell Us The Winner On Election Night

In fact, Virginia early vote is looking tremendous enough for the GOP that perhaps Lara is not the only TRUMP you will see in the Commonwealth before Election Day. Stay tuned!â€

Virginiaâ€™s early voting data shows that almost 51% of Democrats have returned their ballots or voted in person so far. Republicans are not far behind, with 42% doing the same. Democrats currently hold a that Republicans hope to pick up.

title: Dem Strategist Says Harris Being â€˜So Scriptedâ€™ Has â€˜Offended Some Votersâ€™
content:
Democratic strategist Dan Turrentine said Wednesday that â€œsome votersâ€ are frustrated with Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ tendency to stick to scripted responses during interviews.
Harris began granting more interviews in October after initially avoiding them following her campaign launch on July 21. Turrentine, on â€œThe Megyn Kelly Show,â€ based his observation in part on the voters he communicates with on â€œThe Morning Meeting,â€ a show he co-hosts on journalist Mark Halperinâ€™s 2WAY platform, adding that Harris typically only goes off-script when attacking former President Donald Trump. (RELATED: Harris Fails To Explain Flip-Flops, Says She Has No Regrets About Biden In First Interview)
WATCH:
â€œHer message discipline has been very intense. She has stuck to her kind of narrow set of talking points to the point where I think sheâ€™s offended some voters. I hope they havenâ€™t thrown their hands up and locked in for Trump, but it is something you see,â€ Turrentine said. â€œYou know, we hear it on our show, you see it in the data, both the campaignsâ€™ and whatâ€™s out there publicly, that there is frustration that she is so scripted and so tight in her answers.â€
â€œAnd I think some of her best moments on the campaign have been when sheâ€™s leaned forward and had passion and energy and kind of gotten off the talking points, which really, the one issue where we see that is when itâ€™s anti-Trump,â€ he added. â€œLike, you can tell she dislikes the guy so much. It really probably is the animating reason why sheâ€™s running.â€
Turrentine also asserted that he believes â€œthe average voterâ€ would say â€œshe just hates Trumpâ€ if asked why they think Harris wants to be elected as president.
â€œI donâ€™t know if thatâ€™s going to be successful or not, but itâ€™s the only place that she kind of lets the guard down, lets the hair down and really shows who she is and how she feels,â€ he said.
One voter on â€œThe Morning Meetingâ€ recently said, â€œSheâ€™s fake, sheâ€™s scripted, she gives a lot of word saladâ€ when asked what she finds most troubling about Harris.
When radio host Charlamagne Tha God brought up criticism about Harris sounding â€œscriptedâ€ during their recent town hall, the vice president responded, â€œThat would be called discipline.â€
â€œThe reality is that there are certain things that must be repeated to ensure that I have everyone know what I stand for and the issues that I think are at stake in this election,â€ she added. â€œAnd so it requires repetition.â€
As her campaign comes to its end, Harris has changed her messaging from promoting joyfulness to attempting to characterize Trump as a danger to the United States, The New York Times reported. Pollster Frank Luntz said Tuesday that Harris will â€œfailâ€ to win the election â€œif sheâ€™s just beating up on Donald Trump.â€
Trump currently holds small leads over Harris in each of the seven top swing states, according to the RealClearPolling averages.
