title: New York Voter Delivers Two-Word Response When MSNBC Asks If â€˜Threat To Democracyâ€™ Attack On Trump Resonates
content:
A voter in New York needed only two words Monday when an MSNBC reporter asked if Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ attacks on former President Donald Trump as a â€œthreat to democracyâ€ resonated with him.
Harris and her running mate, Democratic Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota, have escalated attacks on former President Donald Trump, with Harris labeling him a â€œfascistâ€ during a CNN town hall and Walz comparing Trumpâ€™s Sunday rally at Madison Square Garden to a 1939 rally at the iconic venue held by the Nazi-sympathetic German American Bund. The voter took a few seconds to think before answering the unidentified MSNBC reporterâ€™s question. (RELATED: â€˜Itâ€™s Helpful If Youâ€™ll Answer The Questionâ€™: Harris Faulkner Chides Dem Guest For Spinning When Asked About Kamala Harris Comparing Trump To Hitler)
â€œHow does that message resonate with you?â€ the reporter asked.
WATCH:
â€œIt doesnâ€™t,â€ the voter responded.
Harris trails Trump by 0.1% in the RealClearPolling average of polls from Oct. 11 to 26, with the former president maintaining that lead when Green Party candidate Dr. Jill Stein, independent candidate Cornel West and Libertarian candidate Chase Oliver are included in surveys.
â€œWhy not?â€ the MSNBC reporter asked.
â€œBecause it feels political to me, it feels like a line that is being used,â€ the voter explained.
Inflation, the cost of living and the economy were viewed as either a top issue or â€œvery importantâ€ by over 80% of respondents to a CNBC poll conducted Oct. 15-19 that showed Trump leading Harris by 2%.
Republicans in the past have criticized Democrats over their portrayal of Trump as a â€œthreatâ€ to democracy, citing previous assassination attempts during the 2024 campaign.
A Secret Service agent thwarted a suspected assassination attempt on Trump in September by firing shots at Ryan Wesley Routh, who was allegedly lurking near Trump International Golf Club. The former president was shot in the right ear while giving a speech at a July 13 campaign rally in Pennsylvania, where a rally attendee was killed and two others wounded.

title: Gun Range Organizer Says Reporter Got Shot Because He And Kunce â€˜Didnâ€™t Listenâ€™ To Safety Advice, Messages Show
content:
The man who set up the gun range for Democratic Missouri Senate candidate Lucas Kunceâ€™s event, where a bullet ricocheted off a target and struck a reporter, appeared to claim that Kunce and the reporter ignored safety advice, according to messages in a private Facebook group reviewed by the Daily Caller.
Chad Everett Downs, the man who claims to have set up the gun range and who has told reporters he lives across the street from the range, commented on a story about the incident in a Facebook group. He said he was there and that Kunce and the reporter did not listen when they were told where they should stand while shooting. Downs, who may not be allowed to own a firearm due to felony charges, then said that it was perfectly normal to get hit with fragments while shooting steel.
Missouri court records show that Downs was charged with 17 counts of felony perjury in August and has been issued a criminal summons and waived his preliminary hearing, according to the Kansas City Star. â€œHis ex-wife in a court filing earlier this month alleged the man owns or has access to guns in violation of his bond conditions,â€ the outlet states.
After a user asked if Downs was the person in a picture with Cunce and a KSHB reporter, Downs replied by saying, â€œYeah. Those dudes were told where to stand. They didnâ€™t listen.â€ Downs said when you shoot steel, â€œyou always get frag. Iâ€™ve been hit probably 250 times.â€
He then started arguing with another member of the Facebook group, saying: â€œso behind the firing line is bad?? Yeah your training sounds pretty intense. Youâ€™re basically a Navy Seal.â€ (RELATED: â€˜Couldâ€™ve Killed Someoneâ€™: Conservatives Blast Dem Candidate For Gun Photo-Op That Injured Reporter With Shrapnel)
â€œI just gave them a place to shoot. Told them what I thought, then they did what they wanted to,â€ Downs said. â€œDo you know someone whoâ€™s been killed by a small fragment??â€ (RELATED: Stray Bullet Strikes TV Reporter At Democratic Senate Campaign Event)
â€œ[Y]our range your responsibility. That is the lamest cop out lâ€™ve ever seen in my life,â€ one of the Facebook users replied to him.
READ MORE HERE:
DAILY CALLER OBTAINED â€” Coâ€¦ by Henry Rodgers
Kunceâ€™s campaign has said, â€œSafety is important to us, which is why the range was set up and run by a NRA Training Counselor.â€ Downsâ€™ Facebook account says he is a â€œNRA training counselor.â€
The Daily Caller contacted Downs to try to interview him about the incident and his comments, to which he said he would give an interview â€œfor $5,000 if you want to know what really happened.â€
Downs also told the Caller: â€œI made a video of the range with exact distances and where everyone was standing.â€ He would not share the video with the Caller, however.

title: Harris Touts Latest Celebrity Endorsement As Polls Indicate High Prices Remain Americansâ€™ Top Priority
content:
Democratic presidential nominee and sitting Vice President Kamala Harris championed her latest celebrity endorsement Friday at a Texas campaign event centered mainly around abortion, despite votersâ€™ insistence that the economy is their greatest concern as November approaches.
Singer Beyonce formally endorsed Harris at the rally where the two slammed the stateâ€™s 6-week abortion ban, according to Fox News. Harris has made abortion access a major component of her campaign, even though many of the latest polls show Americans care most about rising costs.
â€œIâ€™m not here as a celebrity, Iâ€™m not here as a politician, Iâ€™m here as a mother,â€ Beyonce told the crowd of 30,000, according to Fox. â€œA mother who cares deeply about the world my children and all of our children live in. A world where we have the freedom to control our bodies.â€
The economy remains the single most important issue for voters this election, far outweighing abortion, immigration and the environment, according to an October Gallup poll. Prices have risen more than 20% under the Biden-Harris administration, with inflation reaching a high of 9% year-over-year in June 2022 before slowly ticking back down.
Harris bashed former president and Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump at the rally for appointing three conservative justices to the Supreme Court who later helped to strike down the landmark Roe v. Wade court case, returning the authority to create abortion laws to the states, Fox News reported.
â€œTexas, what weâ€™re experiencing here is a health care crisis, and Donald Trump is the architect of it,â€ Harris said, according to Fox News.
Celebrity endorsements generally do little to affect Americansâ€™ voting habits, according to a poll conducted in May by USA TODAY and Suffolk University. (RELATED: â€˜Why Would Any Christian Vote For Her?â€™: Pro-Life Orgs React To Harrisâ€™ â€˜Anti-Religious Freedomâ€™ Abortion Stance)
Beyonce joins a growing list of celebrity endorsements the Democratic candidate has received, including from former president and first lady Barack and Michelle Obama and Taylor Swift.
The Harris campaign did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

content:
A group of abortion doctors on stage at Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harrisâ€™s rally in Houston Friday appeared to pass the buck as a rally-goer suffers a medical emergency.
Video shows dozens of doctors wearing white coats appear to frantically look around as the crowd shouted for a medic. Dr. Richard Todd Ivy, the OB/GYN of 25 years standing at the podium, tried to continue his pro-abortion remarks before he acknowledged the Harris supporterâ€™s health crisis.
â€œI think someone needs some medical assistance over here,â€ Ivy said, pointing his finger in the direction of the emergency.

The crowd cheered moments later, and one female physician told Ivy, â€œtheyâ€™re okay. Theyâ€™re okay.â€ Another voice was heard confirming, â€œtheyâ€™re goodâ€ before Ivy continued his remarks.
It is unclear exactly who helped the rally-goer experiencing the health crisis.
Standing below a blue screen with the words â€œVote for Reproductive Freedom,â€ the OB/GYN doctor moved on from the medical emergency to tell his audience that abortion access is a â€œhealthcare crisisâ€ in Texas. Harris has emphasized abortion as a closing message of her 2024 campaign. Former First Lady Michelle Obama took the stage Saturday with the vice president in Michigan and pointed the finger at men, claiming a Trump presidency would pose a danger to women on the issues of abortion and teen pregnancy.
â€œDo not, do not put our lives in the hands of politicians, mostly men, who have no clue or do not care about what we as women are going through, who donâ€™t fully grasp the broad reaching health implications that their misguided policies will have on our health outcomes,â€ the former first lady pleaded in her speech.
Pop icon Beyonce introduced Harris at her Texas rally Friday. Although various news outlets led readers to believe Beyonce would sing a song â€” most likely Harrisâ€™s campaign walkout theme, â€œFreedomâ€ â€” the musician only spoke into the microphone for five minutes.
Some rally-goers began to boo Harris as she delivered remarks as many attendees were dissatisfied that Beyonce did not give a musical performance. However, Harris repeated the same line she told protesters shouting â€œJesus is Kingâ€ earlier in October â€” to send her hecklers down the street for a smaller rally.
Kamala lures supporters into the event expecting a free BeyoncÃ© concert. Then when they realize theyâ€™ve been hoodwinked they begin to BOO her. She then tells HER supporters to go down to the Trump rally! This campaign is a TOTAL DISASTER. pic.twitter.com/E1EUnfNya7

title: Texas AG Reports â€˜Sophisticated Actorsâ€™ Stealing Identities Of Others To Circumvent Campaign Finance Laws
content:
Republican Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton announced the findings Monday of an investigation into Democrat mega funder ActBlue following reports alleging that donors to the site were using other peopleâ€™s identities.
Paxton enumerated his findings in the ongoing case in a press release. He said through a letter to the Federal Election Commission that potential donors can exploit existing election law loopholes to funnel millions of dollars worth of donations under other peopleâ€™s names.
Paxton exhorted the FEC to close the existing loopholes to prevent any fraud.
â€œOur investigation into ActBlue has uncovered facts indicating that bad actors can illegally interfere in American elections by disguising political donations,â€ Paxton said. â€œIt is imperative that the FEC close off the avenues we have identified by which foreign contributions or contributions in excess of legal limits could be unlawfully funneled to political campaigns, bypassing campaign finance regulations and compromising our electoral system. I am calling on the FEC to immediately begin rulemaking to secure our elections from any criminal actors exploiting these vulnerabilities.â€
BREAKING: Our investigation into ActBlue has uncovered facts indicating that bad actors can illegally interfere in American elections by disguising political donations.
It is imperative that the FEC close off the avenues we have identified by which foreign contributions orâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/8E5vfaYxDL
â€” Attorney General Ken Paxton (@KenPaxtonTX) October 21, 2024
Paxton alleged that his investigation corroborated reports that illegal donors were stealing peopleâ€™s identities to make payments of up to thousands of dollars. The donors would often give multiple times a day, he said.
The investigation also found that the actors involved in this alleged criminal scheme were highly sophisticated, to a degree that even Paxtonâ€™s civil investigators had a hard time tracing the transactions.
â€œThe Attorney Generalâ€™s civil investigators do not commonly see this kind of criminal-style evasiveness, and do not have the technical expertise to comprehensively review the tremendous scope of transactions at issue,â€ Paxton noted in the FEC letter. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: ActBlueâ€™s New Security Measures Donâ€™t Address Fundraising Loophole Flagged By GOP Lawmakers)
Election Watch is an organization dedicated to monitoring FEC data for so-called smurf accounts. A smurf is a donor account whose identity may have been stolen from an unwitting individual. According to Election Watch data, smurf accounts made over $2 billion in political donations using Texas residentsâ€™ identities from 2017 to April 2023. There were over 14 million transactions tracked from those accounts during that time, the data shows
Paxton recommended that the FEC mandate a cross check of all political donations using credit, debit, gift cards and prepaid cards to ensure that the donor identity matches the identity listed on the card. His letter also recommended that prepaid cards and gift cards should only be accepted if this cross check can be done with the entity that issued the card in question.
The ActBlue controversy has extended beyond the state of Texas and has garnered national attention in recent months. Republican Wisconsin Representative Bryan Steil sent a letter Sept. 18 directing five state attorneys general, including Paxton, to investigate ActBlue and its facilitating smurf donations.
The Daily Caller has reached out to Paxton and is waiting for comment.

title: Nebraska Senate Race Tightens As Election Day Draws Closer
content:
Republican Sen. Deb Fischer has a narrow lead in the Nebraska Senate race against independent opponent Dan Osborn with just eight days left until the election, according to a New York Times/Siena College poll released Monday.
Fischer is leading by two percentage points at 48% percent to Osbornâ€™s 46%, according to the poll. Among likely voters surveyed in Nebraska, 5% either refused to answer or said that they were undecided voters, according to the poll.
Former President Donald Trump is leading in Nebraska by 15 percentage points at 55%, while Vice President Kamala Harris trails behind at 40%, according to the poll. Harris is leading among the stateâ€™s independent voters by 10 percentage points, according to the poll results.
â€œThis race is neck-and-neck, but make no mistake, the momentum is on our side,â€ Osborn said in a statement shared with the Daily Caller News Foundation. â€œDeb Fischer has spent 12 years doing the bidding of her corporate donors while leaving hardworking Nebraskans behind, and in 8 days, Nebraskans will come together to fire her and her self-serving agenda once and for all.â€
Democrats have led a push to flip the Senate seats in various red states, including Nebraska, Texas and Florida. Several far-left dark money groups have helped to fund Osbornâ€™s senate campaign. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: ActBlueâ€™s New Security Measures Donâ€™t Address Fundraising Loophole Flagged By GOP Lawmakers)
The Nebraska Supreme Court ruled on Oct. 16 to accept voter registration applications from some former felons for the 2024 presidential election. Republican Nebraska State Sen. Mike McDonnell announced on Sept. 23 that he opposed changing how the state allocates its electoral college votes.
Nebraskaâ€™s Senate race is not the only race that has candidates neck-and-neck, with national polling averages for Harris and Trump remaining tight as the presidential race enters its final stretch. Trump is leading nationally by 0.1 points at 48.5% while Harris remains narrowly behind at 48.4%, according to polling averages from RealClear Polling.
Fischerâ€™s office did not immediately respond to a request for comment from the DCNF.

title: â€˜Couldâ€™ve Killed Someoneâ€™: Conservatives Blast Dem Candidate For Gun Photo-Op That Injured Reporter With Shrapnel
content:
Conservatives and gun advocates criticized Democratic Missouri Senate candidate Lucas Kunce on Tuesday and Wednesday for a gun range photo-op that resulted in a reporter being injured by shrapnel.
Kunce, who is aiming to take Republican Missouri Sen. Josh Hawleyâ€™s seat in November, was at a gun range Tuesday with former Republican Illinois Rep. Adam Kinzinger when a TV reporter was wounded with shrapnel. In response, critics slammed Kunce and the photo-op, pointing out violations of gun safety, like shooting steel at too close of a range. (RELATED: Conservatives Reveal Plan To Awaken Sleeping Giant Voter Demographic That Could Decide White House, Senate)
â€œThey are shooting steel at 5-7 yards with rifles, which couldâ€™ve killed somebody given the force with which the bullets will ricochet off the steel targets at that distance,â€ CEO of The Federalist and gun range owner Sean Davis said on X. â€œYou would instantly get permanently banned at my range if you did that. Zero questions asked.â€
Great day at the range today with my friend @AdamKinzinger. We got to hang out with some union workers while exercising our freedom. Always have your first aid kit handy. Shrapnel can always fly when you hit a target like today, and youâ€™ve got to be ready to go. We had four firstâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/Qu4YxfrtrU
â€” Lucas Kunce (@LucasKunceMO) October 23, 2024
â€œThere are at least two canisters of explosive Tannerite powder on the table, down range from where guns are being fired,â€ Davis said on X. â€œThat couldâ€™ve potentially killed or seriously injured someone if someone shot it or if someone was stupid enough to be shooting close enough to steel for a ricochet to hit it.â€
There appeared to be bottles of explosive compound Tannerite, which is commonly used on gun ranges but is kept at safe distances, on the table close to active gunfire, according to Kunceâ€™s post on X. The manufacturer of the compound stresses that it should be stored safely when not in use and that misuse could result in â€œserious injury or death.â€
Typically, Tannerite targets are placed downrange at a minimum of 100 yards, according to the manufacturer guidelines.
Kinzinger was also photographed using what looked to be a high-powered scope on short-range targets, according to Kunceâ€™s post on X.

Kunce, a former United States Marine, has supported gun control expansion in the past, including raising the age limit to buy a gun to 21, expanding red flag laws and expanding background checks, according to a 2022 interview with NPR. In comparison, Hawley has been a staunch advocate for gun rights in the Senate, receiving an â€œAâ€ rating from the National Rifle Association.

title: Nearly 1 Million Illegal Migrants Benefiting From â€˜Quiet Amnestyâ€™ Under Biden Admin, House Report Reveals
content:
Nearly 1 million illegal migrants in the United States have benefited from â€œquiet amnestyâ€ by the Biden-Harris immigration court system, according to a report released Thursday.
Over 700,000 illegal migrants have had their cases administratively closed, terminated or dismissed, allowing them to remain in the country â€œindefinitelyâ€ without being subject to immigration consequences, according to a report released by the House Judiciary Committee, led by Ohio GOP Rep. Jim Jordan. The findings, which the committee dubbed as â€œquiet amnesty,â€ come amid record levels of illegal immigration into the country under the current administration.(RELATED: Migration Crisis Fueled Rise In Tuberculosis Cases, Study Finds)
â€œFor almost four years, Americans have watched as President Joe Biden and border czar Vice President Kamala Harris have abandoned the southwest border and welcomed nearly 8 million illegal aliens into the United States,â€ the report stated.
â€œThrough administrative maneuvering at both the Justice Department and [the Department of Homeland Security], the Biden-Harris Administration has already ensured that nearly 1 million illegal aliens can remain in the United States without the possibility of deportationâ€”and that trend shows no sign of stopping,â€ the report went on.
When a non-citizen enters the U.S. unlawfully, they can be placed into removal proceedings and eventually go before one of the roughly 700 immigration judges across the country.
Due to the unprecedented border crisis and wave of foreign nationals applying for asylum, the immigration court system has faced a massive backlog, the report detailed. The backlog grew from 1.2 million cases at the end of the Trump administration to nearly 3.5 million cases by the end of the third quarter of fiscal year 2024 â€” marking a 175% increase.
The Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR) additionally reported nearly 109,100 cases as â€œnot adjudicatedâ€ in fiscal year 2023, meaning that the cases were completed but not adjudicated on the merits of the claims, according to the House report. There were 109,568 asylum cases not adjudicated in just the first nine months of fiscal year 2024, already surpassing the total previous fiscal year. (RELATED: â€˜I Love Kamalaâ€™: Migrants Fear Trump Victory As Caravan Heads To US)
For comparison, there were just 12,960 total asylum cases reported as â€œnot adjudicatedâ€ from fiscal years 2017 to 2020 â€” combined, according to the House report.
The Biden-Harris administration additionally failed to file the required documentation to begin immigration court removal proceedings for around 200,00 cases, resulting in the â€œoverwhelming majorityâ€ of those non-citizens being able to remain in the country indefinitely, the report found.
â€œInstead of actually adjudicating illegal aliensâ€™ cases based on the merits of aliensâ€™ claims for relief â€” such as whether an alien has a valid and successful asylum claim â€” immigration judges under the Biden-Harris Administration have been tasked with rubberstamping case dismissals, case closures, and case terminations, all of which allow illegal aliens to remain in the United States without immigration consequences,â€ the report stated.
â€œThis sort of quiet amnesty has become a staple of the Biden-Harris Administrationâ€™s immigration courts,â€ the report continued.
The Department of Justice, which oversees EOIR, declined to comment for this story.

title: Harris Does Damage Control After Bidenâ€™s â€˜Garbageâ€™ Comment Derails Her Closing Argument Speech
content:
Vice President Kamala Harris was forced to do damage control Wednesday after President Joe Biden called supporters of former President Donald Trump â€œgarbageâ€ while she was giving her campaignâ€™s closing argument speech.
While on a get-out-the-vote call hosted by Voto Latino, the president responded to a joke made by comic Tony Hinchcliffe during a Trump rally in which he equated Puerto Rico to â€œfloating island of garbage.â€ Biden called Trump a â€œfailed businessmanâ€ with â€œno characterâ€ before going on to say the only garbage â€œfloating out there is his supporters.â€ The vice president responded to Biden calling roughly half the country â€œgarbage,â€ saying he had clarified the remarks and that she did not believe in criticizing people based on who they vote for.
â€œListen, I think that first of all, he clarified his comments. Let me be clear, I strongly disagree with any criticism of people based on who they vote for,â€ the vice president began.
â€œYou heard my speech last night and continuously throughout my career. I believe that the work that I do is about representing all the people whether they support me or not and as president of the United States I will be a president for all Americans whether you vote for me or not. I have that responsibility and thatâ€™s the kind of work Iâ€™ve done my entire career and I take it very seriously,â€ she continued.
The White House attempted to quell outrage over Bidenâ€™s comments Tuesday night, posting a written transcript of his comments, modifying â€œsupportersâ€ (as it was understood to many) to â€œsupporterâ€™s,â€ arguing that the president was addressing Hinchcliffe.
â€œ[Biden] referred to the hateful rhetoric at the Madison Square Garden rally as â€˜garbage,'â€ White House spokesperson Andrew Bates wrote in a tweet alongside the transcript.
.@POTUS referred to the hateful rhetoric at the Madison Square Garden rally as â€œgarbage.â€
Transcript: pic.twitter.com/4ocg36lDNw
â€” Andrew Bates (@AndrewJBates46) October 30, 2024
But the response only fueled outrage further as pundits and social media users were quick to question the use of the apostrophe.
My write up:
I also asked the WH how they knew Biden only meant â€œsupporterâ€™sâ€ as they have it in this transcript.
Did they talk to Biden to ask him what he meant? The spokesperson asked to go off the record. We declined. They didnâ€™t comment further. https://t.co/IFLJAcyvXS https://t.co/KaQZqdoPFu pic.twitter.com/xvKdLYhBnv
â€” Alex Thompson (@AlexThomp) October 30, 2024
Apostrophe gate continued https://t.co/DbxMFNUEq7
â€” Jacqui Heinrich (@JacquiHeinrich) October 30, 2024
The presidentâ€™s twitter account then put out a statement clarifying what he meant.
â€œEarlier today I referred to the hateful rhetoric about Puerto Rico spewed by Trumpâ€™s supporter at his Madison Square Garden rally as garbageâ€”which is the only word I can think of to describe it,â€ a post from the presidentâ€™s twitter account reads. â€œHis demonization of Latinos is unconscionable. Thatâ€™s all I meant to say. The comments at that rally donâ€™t reflect who we are as a nation.â€
Earlier today I referred to the hateful rhetoric about Puerto Rico spewed by Trumpâ€™s supporters at his Madison Square Garden rally as garbageâ€”which is the only word I can think of to describe it. His demonization of Latinos is unconscionable. Thatâ€™s all I meant to say. Theâ€¦
â€” Joe Biden (@JoeBiden) October 30, 2024
The firestorm came as Harris was on stage at the Ellipse in the nationâ€™s capital for her closing arguments in her campaign. The vice president attempted to draw on the location of her speech, the last place Trump spoke before the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol Riot, and the danger the former president poses to the country. Her remarks, in many ways, have been overshadowed by Bidenâ€™s comments. (RELATED: Harris Completes Pivot To Failed â€˜Democracyâ€™ Message With Speech At J6 Site)
A reporter followed up Wednesday, asking Harris if she sympathized with Americans who were offended by the presidentâ€™s comments.
â€œI am running for president of the United States, I will be traveling to three states today to do what I have been doing throughout, which is talking with the American people about the fact that, first of all, I get it in terms of the concerns they have about challenges like the price of groceries,â€ Harris responded. â€œSecond, my highest priority is to address that and to lift them up around their ambitions and aspirations and dreams and why I have a plan to strengthen the economy.â€

title: Trump Moves To Dismiss Election Interference Case Over Jack Smithâ€™s Unlawful Appointment
content:
Lawyers for former President Donald Trump filed a motion Thursday to dismiss special counsel Jack Smithâ€™s election interference case, arguing that Smith was illegally appointed and should no longer receive public funds, according to court filings.
The election interference case between Trump and Smith has escalated over the past month, with Judge Tanya Chutkan releasing a redacted version of Smithâ€™s 165-page brief on Oct. 2, detailing the caseâ€™s evidence. Trumpâ€™s legal team now claims that the â€œunjust caseâ€ violates the â€œConstitutionâ€™s Appointments and Appropriations Clausesâ€ due to Smith not being properly appointed â€œby law.â€
â€œEven if Smith is a valid officer, which he is not, he is a principal rather than an inferior officer and his appointment is plainly unconstitutional because he was never nominated by the President or confirmed by the Senate. This conclusion follows from the lack of effective oversight over Smith, coupled with the extremely broad jurisdiction described in the appointment order,â€ the filing states. â€œIn addition, unless and until he is removed, the duration of Smithâ€™s tenure is governed by his subjective determination of when his so-called â€œworkâ€ is â€œconcluded.â€ These features of Smithâ€™s role also violate the Appointments Clause.â€
In November 2022, Attorney General Merick Garland named Smith to oversee the case involving the former president, which his lawyerâ€™s claim violated the appointments clause, according to the filing. They argue Smith, as a â€œprivate-citizen,â€ was appointed to â€œtarget President Trump, while President Trump was campaigning to take back the Oval Office from the Attorney Generalâ€™s boss, without a statutory basis for doing so.â€
On July 15, Judge Aileen Cannon, who oversaw Jack Smithâ€™s second case against former President Trump regarding mishandling classified documents, granted a motion by Trumpâ€™s lawyers to dismiss the case on the grounds that Smithâ€™s appointment as special prosecutor was unlawful. In support of their motion, Trumpâ€™s filing also cited U.S. Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomasâ€™ written opinion on presidential immunity, in which he noted, â€œthere are serious questions whether the Attorney General has violated [our Constitutional] structure by creating an office of the Special Counsel that has not been established by law.â€
Trumpâ€™s lawyer referred to President Joe Bidenâ€™s recent remarks at New Hampshireâ€™s Democratic National Committee office this week, where Biden called to â€œlock upâ€ Trump before quickly clarifying he meant â€œpolitically lock him up.â€ (RELATED: Victor Davis Hanson Issues Dark Warning On What Dems Might Do If Trump Wins In 2024)
The legal team also called for Smith and his office to be cut off from â€œspending additional public funds,â€ claiming they violated the appropriations clause, which â€œdoes not apply in order to take more than $20 million from taxpayersâ€”in addition to Smith improperly relying on more than $16 million in additional funds from other unspecified â€˜DOJ componentsâ€™â€”for use in wrongfully targeting President Trump and his allies during the height of the campaign season.â€
Trumpâ€™s team asserts that Smith and his office have been â€œdrawing funds from the Treasury without authorization by statuteâ€ and â€œspending money in violationâ€ of the law.
During a Thursday interview with radio host Hugh Hewitt, Trump said he would fire Smith within â€œtwo secondsâ€ if he wins the 2024 election, calling him a â€œcrooked person.â€
Trumpâ€™s lawyers had argued against releasing Smithâ€™s new briefing on presidential immunity, however, Chutkan denied the request and released the remaining evidence. In an Oct. 18 written response Chutkan stated that withholding the special counselâ€™s evidence would amount to â€œelection interference.â€

title: Black Caller Who Doesnâ€™t â€˜Trustâ€™ Dems Clashes With Charlamagne Over â€˜Not Votingâ€™ Harris
content:
Radio host Charlamagne Tha God sparred with a black caller on Thursday about his refusal to vote for Vice President Kamala Harris, despite his disdain for former President Donald Trump.
While 92% of black voters supported the Democratic presidential candidate in 2016, that number has dropped to 78% in 2024, according to a recent New York Times/Siena College Poll. The caller argued on â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ that Democrats have failed to earn his vote, pledging not to vote for Harris even though he views Trump as â€œHitler Jr.â€ (RELATED: Harris Fails To Explain Flip-Flops, Says She Has No Regrets About Biden In First Interview)
LISTEN:
â€œIâ€™m not voting for Hitler Jr. and if I had to be honest with you â€¦ I donâ€™t trust the Democrats, bruh. As a black man in America, we done been lied to so long. Promises have never been kept,â€ the caller said. â€œIâ€™ma just keep it a buck. Iâ€™m not voting this year â€¦ I donâ€™t trust the Democrats and I damn sure ainâ€™t voting for Hitler Jr. Whatever happens gonâ€™ happen.â€
â€œWell if you not votinâ€™ and Hitler Jr. wins, then you know you gonâ€™ have to blame yourself,â€ Charlamagne retorted. â€œYou gonâ€™ have to take some of the blame.â€
Trumpâ€™s former White House chief of staff John Kelly told The New York Times and The Atlantic that the former president had â€œfascistâ€ tendencies and allegedly praised former Nazi leader Adolf Hitler. The Trump campaign has denied the allegations.
â€œI think the Democrats should take the blame because theyâ€™ve let down the black community so long. Just like you said the other day Charlamagne, they keep cominâ€™ at black men,â€ the caller said. â€œThey send [former president] Barack Obama, I donâ€™t why the hell every four years they send Barack Obama just to talk to black men and chastise us about voting but like you said, 52% of white women is what got Trump in office.
â€œSo why ainâ€™t nobody never cominâ€™ at white people about voting? Why is it always up to black men? And then when they get in office, the things they promised us, it never comes to fruition,â€ he added. â€œIâ€™m fatigued, Charla.â€
Obama on Oct. 10 urged black men to back Harris while speaking at a Pittsburgh-area campaign office, asserting he thinks a reason for their reluctance is they â€œarenâ€™t feeling the idea of having a woman as president.â€
â€œIâ€™m with you. I understand the fatigue, but you know, not voting is never an option for me â€™cause I like to complain, you know what I mean? You really canâ€™t complain if you donâ€™t participate in the process,â€ Charlamagne said. â€œI gotta participate in the process.â€

title: â€˜Serious Problem For Blacksâ€™: Kamala Harrisâ€™ Dad Once Warned Against Mass Immigration
content:
Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ father, Donald Harris, once co-authored a treatise in which he argued mass immigration was dangerous for the United States, particularly for black Americans.
The 1988 book titled â€œBlack Economic Progress: An Agenda for the 1990sâ€ described immigration as â€œa particularly serious problem for blacksâ€ due to there being fewer jobs available for working-class Americans, according to the New York Post. Donald Harris was reportedly a Marxist economist and currently has a strained relationship with his daughter, the sitting vice president, following his divorce from her mother and a difficult custody battle.
â€œTrends in international trade have moved against U.S. workers,â€ the treatise reads, according to the Post. â€œU.S. immigration laws have been modified in ways that increase the influx of low-skilled workers, who compete with native-born youths and low-skilled adult workers for low-skilled jobs.â€
â€œThis shift has been a particularly serious problem for blacks, who constitute a high proportion of the low-skilled adult workers,â€ the book continues, according to the Post.
Kamala Harris assumed the unofficial role of â€œborder czarâ€ under the Biden-Harris administration during which there were roughly 8.5 million migrant encounters along the U.S.-Mexico border. The vice president proclaimed in August her new-found support for the building of a wall along the southern border after repeatedly criticizing former President Donald Trump for his stance on immigration and previously referring to his plan for a wall as â€œun-American.â€
An October House Judiciary Committee report revealed that nearly one million illegal migrants currently reside in the U.S. without consequences or fear of deportation under â€œquiet amnestyâ€ due to their immigration cases being closed, terminated or dismissed. (RELATED: Kamala Harris Supported Taxpayer-Funded Sex Change Surgeries For Illegal Immigrants)
The Harris campaign did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: Trump Leading Harris in Key Swing State Two Weeks Before Election Day, Poll Finds
content:
Former President Donald Trump is leading Vice President Kamala Harris in Georgia as election day draws closer, according to a Tuesday poll from the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (AJC).
Trump is leading at 47% while Harris is at 43%, which is outside of the pollâ€™s margin of error of 3.1 percentage points, according to the AJC. Of likely voters that were polled, 8% said that they are still undecided.
Georgia is considered a key battleground state in the 2024 presidential election. The swing state began its first week of voting on Oct. 15 and set an early voting record as 196,000 residents cast their ballots, according to WALB.
There are more than seven million active voters in the state, according to WALB.
A Georgia judge decided on Oct. 15 to block a rule about the state hand-counting ballots on election day amid concerns that it could slow down announcing election results.
While Trump is leading across battleground states, the presidential race is still tight. The Republican candidate has a 1.2 point lead, pulling 48.4% support across seven top battleground states compared to Harris trailing behind at 47.2%, according to polling averages from RealClear Polling.
Harris is ahead of Trump nationwide, with a lead of 0.8 points at 49.3% compared to Trumpâ€™s 48.5%, according to national polling averages from RealClear Polling. (RELATED: Dem Senator Claims Major Swing State Faces â€˜Voter Suppression,â€™ Despite Being Confronted On â€˜High Turnoutâ€™)
Trump has made significant strides among black voters. The Democrats have been attempting to shore up support for Harris from black voters amid concerns of weak enthusiasm from the key voting bloc.
â€œThe most recent polling shows what Team Trump already knew, Georgians from Catoosa to Camden County are tired of the cost-of-living skyrocketing and drugs flowing across the open border into our communities,â€ Morgan Ackley, Georgia Communications Director for the Trump campaign said in a statement shared with the Daily Caller News Foundation. â€œPresident Trump is winning or tied in every battleground, including Georgia, because his message is resonating with voters across the country. This November Georgia will say no to Kamala Harris and yes to Donald Trump and his America First policies.â€

title: Supreme Court Wonâ€™t Block Pennsylvania Ruling Allowing Voters With Rejected Mail-In Ballots To Cast Provisional Votes
content:
The Supreme Court declined Friday to block a lower court ruling finding Pennsylvania voters whose mail-in ballots are rejected over errors can cast a provisional vote.
Justice Samuel Alito wrote the question is of â€œconsiderable importanceâ€ but noted that even siding with the Republican National Committee (RNC) at this time â€œcould not prevent the consequences they fearâ€ in a statement joined by Justices Clarence Thomas and Neil Gorsuch.
The Pennsylvania Supreme Court ruled 4-3 on Oct. 23 to allow voters a second chance to cast a provisional ballot in-person when their mail ballots are rejected, a decision Republicans argued â€œdramaticallyâ€ changed the rules and â€œdeparted from the plain terms of the Election Code.â€
Republicans asked the Supreme Court to block the ruling on Monday, writing in their petition that this is â€œthe second consecutive presidential election in which the Pennsylvania Supreme Court has changed important election rules at the last minute.â€
â€œEven if the Pennsylvania Supreme Courtâ€™s decision does not change the outcome of any election, the question of whether the provisional ballots can be added to the vote total would remain a concrete dispute this Court can review,â€ the RNC argued in its emergency application. â€œReviewing that courtâ€™s authority to do so â€” even after Election Day (when the pressure of an imminent election would be absent) â€” would provide invaluable guidance for future elections.â€™â€
Alito wrote that the lower courtâ€™s decision â€œconcerns just two votes in the long-completed Pennsylvania primary.â€
â€œStaying that judgment would not impose any binding obligation on any of the Pennsylvania officials who are responsible for the conduct of this yearâ€™s election,â€ he wrote. â€œAnd because the only state election officials who are parties in this case are the members of the board of elections in one small county, we cannot order other election boards to sequester affected ballots.â€
The Pennsylvania Democratic Party previously told the justices the RNC offered â€œno sound reasonâ€ to block the lower court decision. (RELATED: â€˜Invites Fraudâ€™: Key Swing State Could See Repeat Of 2020â€™s Ballot-Counting Chaos Thanks To Court Ruling)
â€œPut simply, the Pennsylvania Supreme Courtâ€™s holding that a voter whose mail ballot is not counted may exercise her statutory right to vote provisionally (rather than being disenfranchised altogether) was a straightforward and correct interpretation of Pennsylvania law,â€ the party wrote in its Wednesday filing.
â€œIn an effort to cast the decision below as essentially lawless, the RNC quotes selectively from the Pennsylvania Election Code, abandoning any attempt to present accurately or fairly the actual interpretive problem the Pennsylvania Supreme Court faced,â€ attorneys for Butler County voters Faith Genser and Frank Matis argued in a court filing Wednesday.

title: Joe Scarborough Calls On Harris To Disavow Past Support Of Taxpayer-Funded Sex Changes For Prisoners
content:
MSNBCâ€™s Joe Scarborough on Thursday urged Vice President Kamala Harris to renounce her previous support for taxpayer-funded sex changes for prison inmates.
Harris has previously indicated she supports tax-payer funded sex changes for transgender prison inmates and illegal immigrants. Scarborough, during a conversation with comedian Bill Maher on â€œMorning Joe,â€ said it should be â€œvery easyâ€ for Harris to reverse her position, which she espoused during her 2020 presidential campaign. (RELATED: Kamala Harris Co-Sponsored Bill That Would Force Schools To Let Male Athletes Compete In Girlsâ€™ Sports)
WATCH:
â€œKamalaâ€™s big, I think, challenge here to win over the undecided voters is to convince them that sheâ€™s not part of what they suspect she might be, sort of a stealth version of the worst excesses of the left,â€ Maher said. â€œI said thereâ€™s a coalition of [former President Donald] Trump voters, people who really like him, they certainly are those, and then thereâ€™s people who donâ€™t necessarily like him that much, but they still think heâ€™s less crazy than stuff that strikes them as aggressively anti-common sense that takes place on the left, and thatâ€™s why they keep running that ad about sex changes in prison.â€
Maher and Scarborough both noted they frequently see a Trump campaign advertisement alleging Harris backs these operations for prisoners and illegal immigrants during football games.
â€œBy the way, itâ€™s very easy to say: â€˜Yeah, I said that in 2019. I was in a competitiveâ€™ â€” now she did say â€” I think she said this was the law under Trump too,â€ Scarborough said. â€œHe didnâ€™t change it, but itâ€™s very easy to say, â€˜I donâ€™t believe that anymore.â€™ And on that issue, she should.â€
When Fox News host Bret Baier recently inquired about her current stance on the operations for illegal immigrants, Harris stated, â€œIâ€™ll follow a law,â€ asserting that itâ€™s â€œa law that Donald Trump actually followed.â€
Radio host Charlamagne Tha God in September said the Trump campaign ad â€œwas effective,â€ particularly because of how it aired during football games, adding that he doesnâ€™t want his taxes funding sex changes for these individuals.
CNN senior data reporter Harry Enten said Wednesday that he thinks a reason Harris is losing ground with independent voters is because they perceive her as â€œtoo liberal.â€ She currently lags behind Trump in all of the seven top battleground states, according to the RealClearPolling averages.

title: Democrats Fight To Make Elections Less Trustworthy
content:
Democrats are fighting to make elections less secure in multiple key states just days before the Nov. 5 election.
Election legislation has already been a focal point of the 2024 campaign, especially as the Republican National Committee (RNC) beefs up its election integrity department, but the battles are set to continue beyond Nov. 5. In the weeks leading up to the election, Democrats have signed legislation prohibiting voter identification while Biden-Harrisâ€™s Department of Justice has sued Alabama and Virginia for attempting to take illegal immigrants off their voter rolls.
â€œWhatâ€™s so bizarre about that lawsuit, the two lawsuits that DOJ has filed â€¦ that is the exact opposite of what DOJ should be doing, it is a criminal violation of federal â€“ in fact, itâ€™s a felony for an alien to register to vote,â€ Hans von Spakovsky, a senior legal fellow focusing on election integrity at the Heritage Foundation, told the Daily Caller. (RELATED: Watch The Daily Callerâ€™s Documentary â€˜Riggedâ€™)
â€œAnd so what the DOJ ought to be doing is going to Virginia and saying, â€˜can you please give me the files of each of these voters so we can investigate and potentially prosecute them?â€™ And no, instead, theyâ€™re saying, â€˜no, you have to keep on the voter rolls aliens who are breaking federal law,'â€ von Spakovsky continued.
In August, Republican Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin signed an executive order to make the state more frequently remove noncitizens from the voter rolls. The DOJ then moved to sue the state on Oct. 12, alleging that the Virginia State Board of Elections had violated the federal National Voter Registration Act (NVRA), which states that voter rolls may not be cleaned up 90 days before an election. Bidenâ€™s DOJ further claimed that the executive order, signed 90 days out from Nov. 5, produced a â€œsystemic removalâ€ which can apparently cause voters to be confused and affect eligible voters. (RELATED: GOP States Remove Thousands Of Noncitizens Off Voting Rolls As Election Day Nears)
Itâ€™s stunning that, just 11 days before the presidential election, a federal judge is ordering Virginia to reinstate individuals who have self-identified as noncitizens on the voter rolls. Virginia is prepared to take this to the U.S. Supreme Court if needed! pic.twitter.com/fyjlWBUlnQ
â€” Glenn Youngkin (@GlennYoungkin) October 25, 2024
Similarly, Alabama was sued by the Biden-Harris DOJ after Secretary of State Wes Allen identified 3,251 registered voters that had been issued noncitizen identification numbers by the Department of Homeland Security and sought to remove them from the rolls. The DOJ alleged that, like in Virginia, it was too close to election day.
â€œThe right to vote is one of the most sacred rights in our democracy,â€ Assistant Attorney General Kristen Clarke of the DOJâ€™s Civil Rights Division said in a statement. â€œAs Election Day approaches, it is critical that Alabama redress voter confusion resulting from its list maintenance mailings sent in violation of federal law.â€
In Virginiaâ€™s case, Biden-appointed U.S. District Court Judge Patricia Giles issued an order blocking Virginiaâ€™s efforts to remove the estimated 1,600 individuals that the state believes have â€œself-identifiedâ€ as noncitizens. On Sunday, the Virginia Attorney General Jason Miyares said he would be filing an emergency appeal to the Supreme Court in response.
A Trump-appointed judge sided with the DOJ in Alabama and ordered the state restore the voters who they had taken off the voter rolls as a result of Allenâ€™s order.
In Texas, Republican Gov. Greg Abbott previously announced that his administration had purged more than 6,500 noncitizens from state voter rolls. The cleaning of the voter rolls is a result of a 2021 bill Abbott signed into law which instated numerous election security measures like uniform statewide voting hours, banned drive-through voting and gave more power to poll watchers.
â€œI was surprised they havenâ€™t sued Texas yet. Texas also announced that he did take 6,500 aliens off the voter roll. Iâ€™m expecting Texas will get sued by DOJ also,â€ von Spakovsky told the Caller.
ğŸš¨BREAKING â€” BIDEN-HARRIS DOJ SUES TO KEEP ILLEGALS ON VOTER ROLLS
Yesterday, the Biden-Harris DOJ sued the State of Alabama for fighting to remove potential noncitizens and illegal aliens from their voters rolls ahead of the 2024 election. pic.twitter.com/i2XE9i5sGv
â€” America First Legal (@America1stLegal) September 28, 2024
Democratic California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a law on Sept. 29 that prohibits local governments from requiring identification to vote. The legislation was brought forward by Democratic state Sen. Dave Min after a ballot measure was presented in Huntington Beach that would require identification at the polls, according to Politico.
â€œForbidding, actually forbidding it. The state has no ID requirement, and yet, when one town said, â€˜Well, we really want to do this,â€™ they pass a law preventing that from happening. In general, every time states have tried to clean up their voter lists to take off people who have died and moved away, Democrats sue them so they want inaccurate voter lists,â€ von Spakovsky told the Caller.
The early voting blog is updated!
Rs have added 2K to lead, which is now 31,000, or 5%. GOP surge slowed a bit Saturday, but Republicans still gained.
Dems need to decisively win indies to make this a late Election Night.
Down-ballot update, too!https://t.co/Pl43XBMcPA
â€” Jon Ralston (@RalstonReports) October 27, 2024
About a week out from the election, political experts have started to discuss what the aftermath of a Trump victory could look like. From protests, to lawfare, to security concerns, the Daily Caller spoke to a variety of experts who predicted a dangerous and extreme response from Democrats if Trump wins. (RELATED: What Happens If Trump Wins?)
Von Spakovsky told the Caller he expects Democrats to claim voter suppression through lawsuits following a Trump victory. Mike Davis, a Trump-aligned lawyer and founder of the Article III Project, explained that even if Democrats prepare to sue, the state of election integrity is not close to what it was in 2024.
â€œPresident Trump learned his lesson from 2020 â€¦ He has hired a very good legal team led by David Warrington on his campaign, along with a very good legal team led by RNC Chairman Michael Whatley,â€ Davis told the Caller.
â€œThat was the mistake in 2020: they didnâ€™t get injunctions â€¦ Theyâ€™re doing it this time,â€ Davis added, explaining that the RNC legal team has been far more proactive in the 2024 election cycle.

title: How Unions Spent Millions Of Tax Dollars Boosting Democrats Ahead Of Election Day
content:
Six large public unions have funneled tens of millions of dollars, much of which came from taxpayer-funded dues payments, into aiding Democrats in their bid for power this election cycle.
A handful of large public-sector unions pumped well over $60 million into political organizations, with the lionâ€™s share going toward helping Democrats win races at every level of government, according to the latest set of campaign finance disclosures.
The Daily Caller News Foundation included the Service Employees International Union (SEIU), the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME), the National Education Association (NEA), the American Federation of Teachers (AFT), the National Association of Letter Carriers (NALC) and the American Federation of Government Employees (AFGE) in its analysis of campaign finance records. In 2020, these six labor organizations were the top political contributors among unions representing public sector employees, according to OpenSecrets.
Unions are legally prohibited from contributing membership dues directly to federal political campaigns, according to the Department of Labor. They can, however, donate revenue derived from membership dues to super PACs and 501(c)(4) advocacy organizations, both of which often work to elect candidates. (Stream The Daily Callerâ€™s Documentary â€˜Lawlessâ€™ HERE)
Indeed, some of the committees that received the most money from public sector unions were super PACs aimed at delivering legislative majorities and the White House to Democrats.
The House and Senate Majority PACs, committees working to elect Democrats to the upper and lower chambers of Congress, collectively pulled in about $15 million from public unions, according to campaign finance records. The Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee and Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee, which play similar roles, brought in just over $1 million from public-sector union PACs. Future Forward, the primary organization focused on delivering the White House to Vice President Kamala Harris, meanwhile, took in $3 million from public unions.
â€œObviously, if you have government employees who are working, you are going to pay them,â€ Capital Research Center research director Michael Watson, an organized labor expert, told the DCNF. â€œIf you then, on top of that, enact collective bargaining, their salaries that were paid for with taxpayer money are going to go to the union which is going to do union stuff, part of which is supporting liberal candidates.â€
Watson went on to explain that taxpayers arenâ€™t just seeing their tax dollars going to support partisan Democrats, but that those donations are also leading to officials being elected who then direct more public funds into union coffers.
â€œThe double whammy is that those liberal politicians that the union is sending money to support, if they win, are then going to be negotiating with the unions,â€ Watson continued.
President Joe Biden, for instance, transferred $36 billion worth of public funds to bolster a union pension pool in December 2022, The Associated Press reported. The Biden-Harris administration is also pushing student loan debt forgiveness, a policy nonpartisan government analysts say could cost the public but is celebrated by public sector unions as a boon for their members.
Watson pointed to Democratic Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson, a former union organizer, as a prime example of the taxpayer funds going through the cycle of being used by unions to support liberal politicians who then advocate for more taxpayer funds to flow to unions, thus expanding the amount organized labor can spend on political advocacy to reap even more rewards. Johnson is pushing against much of the city government to take out a $300 million loan to give Chicago teachers, who make an average of $93,000 per year, a 9% raise, The Economist reported.
The mayorâ€™s push for increased teacher pay comes as the cityâ€™s public schools faced a half-billion-dollar deficit coming into this school year. The national SIEU and AFT, the second-largest teachers union in the country, collectively gave Johnson over $2.5 million this election cycle, federal campaign finance records show.
Other PACs that raked in considerable funding from public sector unions include pro-abortion committees like EMILYâ€™s List, major liberal committees affiliated with American Bridge and Priorities USA as well as climate-focused organizations, disclosures show. The SEIU, AFT and NALC also put roughly $1.8 million into one of the committees that helped put on the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.
The NALC stood out from the rest of the unions in that, even though most of its political donations went to Democratic-aligned PACs, it made some contributions to right-leaning committees. PACs like the National Republican Senatorial Committee, the National Republican Congressional Committee, the Republican Mainstreet Partnership and Republican Kentucky Rep. James Comerâ€™s leadership PAC collectively brought in hundreds of thousands of dollars from the NALC.
â€œWhat some unions, I think youâ€™re seeing it more now with the Teamsters under their new leadership with Sean Oâ€™Brien and I think with what may be the case with the letter carriers, is that they are behaving more like a traditional special interest group,â€ Watson told the DCNF. â€œWhat the Teamsters under Oâ€™Brien and the letter carriers for a long time have been is â€˜look, if you cover us on the issues that matter to us â€¦ if youâ€™re scratching our back, weâ€™ll scratch yours even if we donâ€™t agree on any other policies.'â€
Watson said the letter carriers are likely concerned with federal postal funding.
Of the funds not donated to explicitly Democratic committees, much of them went to other union political committees, which tend to spend primarily on supporting liberal candidates, disclosures show. Labor organizations can also internally spend funds on political activities, which means the full extent of public union political spending isnâ€™t contained in records maintained by the FEC. The SEIU, NEA, AFT and AFSCME, for instance, launched a joint canvassing effort on Oct. 21 aimed at increasing voter turnout in swing states to support the Harris-Walz ticket, according to a press release.
â€œEvery election cycle, union bosses flood the American political system with billions of dollars to push forward a radical political agenda that boosts union officialsâ€™ power over workers, and is directly contrary to the priorities and interests of millions of the members union bosses claim to â€˜represent,'â€ National Right to Work Committee president Mark Mix told the DCNF. â€œThis corrupt cycle of forced dues-funded political influence is especially egregious when it comes to government union bosses, who siphon dues out of taxpayer-funded salaries and use the money to elect politicians who are more loyal to their union backers than the voters they are supposed to represent. This doesnâ€™t just harm taxpayers and voters who see bloated budgets and unaccountable elected officials, but also undermines the individual rights of government employees who are forced to accept unionsâ€™ monopoly â€˜representationâ€™ despite deep personal or ideological objections to union boss-advocated positions.â€
The SEIU, NEA, AFT, AFGE, AFSCME and NALC did not immediately respond to the DCNFâ€™s requests for comment.

title: EXCLUSIVE: â€˜Way Too Liberalâ€™: New Ad Slams Swing District Dem For Wanting To Serve Illegal Immigrants Govâ€™t Handouts
content:
A political action committee (PAC) released an advertisement Tuesday that highlights Pennsylvania Democratic candidate Janelle Stelsonâ€™s support for amnesty for illegal migrants and the costs to taxpayers that would come with it, the Daily Caller News Foundation has learned.
The Win It Back PAC (WIB PAC) launched the ad ahead of the Nov. 5 election between Republican Pennsylvania Rep. Scott Perry and Stelson â€” rated as a toss up by Cook Political Report as of Oct. 18. The ad, titled â€œChef,â€ portrays Stelson as a â€œworld-renownedâ€ chef and liberal, serving tax credits, social security and healthcare to illegals at the expense of the Pennsylvania taxpayer. (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Texas Republicans Press Biden-Harris Admin Over â€˜Turning A Blind Eyeâ€™ To Non-Citizen Voters)
â€œFive-star reviews, a tasting menu to die for and a world-renowned chef: liberal Janelle Stelson,â€ the video says. â€œBut the hottest restaurant in town is only for illegal aliens, and Pennsylvanians foot the bill.â€
WATCH:
Stelson pledged her support for amnesty for some illegal immigrants during a March 27 interview, with the WIB PAC ad noting the policy would result in Pennsylvaniansâ€™ tax dollars going to government benefits for non-citizens.
â€œTax credits for illegals, social security for illegals and the main course: gold-plated healthcare â€” compliments of the chef Janelle Stelson,â€ the video states. â€œWay too liberal and too expensive for Pennsylvania.â€
Stelson reportedly outraised Perry by a massive $2.85 million to $900,000 in the last fundraising quarter. The candidates, super PACs and Washington-based political committees had poured over $14 million into the race as of Oct. 17.
Roughly 8.5 million migrant encounters occurred along the U.S.-Mexico border during the four fiscal years of the Biden-Harris administration, compared to approximately 3 million under former President Donald Trump. The National Border Patrol Council â€” a union representing about 18,000 Border patrol agents across the country â€” endorsed Trump during a campaign rally in Prescott Valley, Arizona, on Oct. 13.
The Stelson campaign didnâ€™t immediately respond to a request for comment.

title: â€˜Harassed And Suedâ€™: Turley Slams Biden-Harris Admin After Court Blocks Stateâ€™s Effort To Clean Voter Rolls
content:
George Washington University law professor Jonathan Turley criticized the Department of Justice Friday after a federal judge ordered Virginia to reinstate hundreds of non-citizens to the voter rolls.
A federal judge ordered Virginia to halt its effort to remove non-citizens Friday, granting an injunction requested by the Justice Department in a suit filed Oct. 12. Turley said the DOJ had previously approved the lawâ€™s use in the past under Democratic governors. (RELATED: â€˜This Is Ridiculousâ€™: Leo Terrell Rips DOJ For Going After State That Removed Non-Citizens From Voter Roll)
â€œThe Biden Administration argued that some or many of these were citizens who simply had bureaucratic problems or errors when they were at the DMV filling out forms. But the problem is that Virginia is a little different from Alabama,â€ Turley told â€œAmericaâ€™s Newsroomâ€ co-hosts Bill Hemmer and Dana Perino. â€œAs Gov. [Glenn] Youngkin pointed out, this was approved by the Department of Justice years ago under then-Gov. [Tim] Kaine, who ironically is on the ballot this election. And they say this has been used within the 90 days before an election, which is that critical so-called quiet period. And so the state is saying look, this is a rather odd timing of the events. Department of Justice green-lights this law, no objection in past years used by Democrats allegedly even during this period and suddenly when we use it, when we remove non-citizens, it becomes a problem.â€
WATCH:
â€œVirginia was saying that these are basically actions that have been taken on the books for years,â€ Turley said. â€œWhen the DMV kicks back information to us saying that someone has identified themselves correctly or incorrectly as a non-citizen, that person then has 15 days to correct that and even if they donâ€™t correct that, they can file provisional ballots so that their vote will count as they continue that effort. But this federal judge is saying no, just put them back on the voting rolls.â€
Youngkin criticized the courtâ€™s ruling in a statement released Friday, telling Fox News host Harris Faulkner the state would appeal.
â€œWhat the governor is saying is look, this is information supplied by the voter. Itâ€™s an automatic system. Keep in mind, Virginia doesnâ€™t know who these people are gonna vote for. Itâ€™s not like thereâ€™s an effort to target one group,â€ Turley said. â€œThis is an automated system that kicks over and says there is an anomaly here, a conflict, this person has identified themselves as a non-citizen. Many may have done it incorrectly or there might be an error and why they have these belts and suspenders, but part of the problem the states have here is that they feel like theyâ€™ve been harassed and sued by the Biden Administration at every turn over voter ID and other laws.â€ (Watch The Daily Caller Documentary â€œRiggedâ€)
â€œA new poll just came out that showed that over 80% of American citizens support voter ID and citizenship proof for voting. Over 80%,â€ Turney continued. â€œI mean, how many issues in todayâ€™s politics can you name where there is over 80% of agreement?â€

title: â€˜Completely Fabricated Personaâ€™: Woman Doug Emhoff Allegedly Slapped Breaks Silence
content:
An ex-girlfriend who Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff allegedly slapped in a fit of jealousy broke her silence on the matter Thursday.
Emhoffâ€™s ex-girlfriend, who asked the Daily Mail to use the alias â€œJane,â€ confirmed allegations from three friends that Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ now-husband â€œslapped [her] so hard [she] spun aroundâ€ during a celebrity event in 2012.
â€œWhatâ€™s frightening for a woman thatâ€™s been on the other end of it, is watching this completely fabricated persona being portrayed,â€ Jane said.
Doug Emhoffâ€™s ex-girlfriend speaks out telling how Kamalaâ€™s husband forcefully slapped her for flirting with another man https://t.co/hATb8qcMx4 pic.twitter.com/h5jLEwseXe
â€” Daily Mail Online (@MailOnline) October 24, 2024
Jane told the outlet she and Emhoff, whom she started dating in March 2012, took a â€œfairytaleâ€ trip to the amfAR gala dinner south of France on May 24, 2009. A long taxi line outside the Hotel du Cap around 3 a.m. prompted Jane to try to pay a valet $100 to let her and Emhoff skip the line â€” but she alleged a drunken Emhoff reacted violently when he incorrectly assumed she was flirting with another man.
â€œAs Iâ€™m talking to him, Doug got out of the line, comes up, turns me around by my right shoulder. Iâ€™m completely caught off guard. Iâ€™m not bracing,.Iâ€™m in four inch heels, wearing a full-length gown, and itâ€™s between 2-3 a.m.,â€ Jane said.
â€œHe slaps me so hard I spin around, and Iâ€™m in utter shock,â€ she alleged. â€œThere had been no fight, no argument. It had been a completely fantastic event. I am so furious. The only thing I could think to do was slap him back. I slapped him on one side, and on the other cheek with the other hand.â€
â€œIn that moment, his mask had dropped and I saw his dark side,â€ Emhoffâ€™s ex-girlfriend alleged, later adding that Emhoff said they were â€œevenâ€ the day after.
Jane said Emhoff confided in her in April 2012 that the nanny he had an extramarital affair with and impregnated before his 2009 divorce filing, Najen Naylor, accused him of causing her to miscarry their baby. She said Emhoffâ€™s admission made her rethink their relationship, according to the outlet. (RELATED: From #MeToo To #NotYou: Where Are All The Feminist Celebrities On Emhoff?)
Psaki Tells Emhoff Heâ€™s Reshaping Masculinity
â€œAll I did was ask him one question, and he told me the whole story,â€ Jane told the Daily Mail. â€œWithout skipping a beat, and staring straight ahead at the road, he tells me he had an affair with his daughterâ€™s teacher and that subsequently she claimed that she was pregnant. Heâ€™s telling me this very casually like itâ€™s no big deal.â€
Jane told the outlet Emhoff admitted to yelling at Naylor but did not say whether he struck her, according to the outlet. She said Emhoff told her in a matter-of-fact manner that he â€œgot really angryâ€ at his then-pregnant mistress, who threatened a lawsuit over accusations that he caused her miscarriage.
Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) records obtained by the Daily Mail show that police were called to the house where Naylor lived at 8:14 p.m. on June, 28, 2009. The call was deemed a priority level three, a â€œlife threatening emergency, lights and sirens on.â€
Emhoff Condemns Toxic Masculinity In 2023
Emhoffâ€™s accuser told the outlet she was initially hesitant on speaking out publicly and has been telling the same story years before the vice presidentâ€™s husband became famous.
â€œHeâ€™s being held out to be the antithesis of who he actually is. And that is utterly shocking,â€ she added.
Emhoff And Jill Biden Kiss
None of the female celebrities supporting Harris have spoken out against Emhoffâ€™s alleged misconduct â€” a stark departure from 2016â€™s #MeToo movement. Popular singers including Taylor Swift, Pink and Ariana Grande and Hollywood icons such as Oprah Winfrey and Jennifer Lopez continue to advocate for Harris despite her husbandâ€™s alleged misdeeds.
While ignoring Emhoffâ€™s accusations, many female celebrities, including Olivia Rodrigo, Jennifer Lawrence and Billie Eilish, exert their feminist energy toward promoting Harrisâ€™s pro-abortion agenda.

title: Swing State Republicans Are Leaning Into Ballot Harvesting â€” And It Seems To Be Working
content:
LAS VEGAS, Nevada â€” For thousands of attendees at a Trump rally Thursday in Las Vegas, volunteers stood ready to collect mail-in ballots on-site.
The strategy is a major shift for Nevada Republicans, who opposed the legalization of ballot harvesting in 2020. Now, conservative activists and GOP operatives are leaning into the new rules, asking voters to bring ballots to rallies and doing whatever it take to make it easy for Republicans get their votes in early.
â€œWe donâ€™t like early voting, but itâ€™s how the game is,â€ Turning Point Action Las Vegas field representative Schayden Gorai told the Daily Caller News Foundation, explaining these are â€œthe rules that the Democrats have set.â€
Early voting numbers have been strong for Republicans, who lead Democrats by nearly 24,000 votes between in-person and mail ballots as of Friday morning. If Democrats canâ€™t change the current margins, which have them up in mail ballots but trailing Republicans by 25% for in-person early voting, longtime Nevada political reporter and editor of The Nevada Independent Jon Ralston wrote Thursday night the party is in â€œbig, big trouble.â€
Take a deeper look at Nevada â€” and what it could mean for the rest of the country.
Ds arenâ€™t showing up for @KamalaHarris. If that happens around the country, the missing red wave of 2022 could show up in 2024 as a tsunami.
These are the in-person early voting stats for 2024â€¦ https://t.co/S5gf6hYUzb pic.twitter.com/tQfR19c2oE
â€” Victor Joecks (@VictorJoecks) October 25, 2024
Former President Donald Trump â€” and others who spoke at the Turning Point sponsored rally Thursday, including Vivek Ramaswamy, Charlie Kirk and Tulsi Gabbard â€” urged supporters in the crowd to get out early and bring others along.
Prior to the rally, a text blast was sent out letting attendees know about the ballot drop off option. Fliers and other messaging likewise encouraged supporters to bring their ballots.
Republicans launched the new approach when Trump spoke in Reno earlier this month. Now that more people know about the option, campaign staff say the method is gaining some traction.
â€œWe had a whole envelope full of ballots dropped off today, which is really exciting to see,â€ Halee Dobbins, GOP communications director for Nevada and Arizona, told the DCNF during the rally. â€œThe margins are always close, but we donâ€™t want to leave one vote on the table.â€ (RELATED: Tailgates, Apps And Marylanders: Conservativesâ€™ Strategy To Win In Southern Pennsylvania)
While many voters maintain reservations about mail ballots, the messaging is landing with some.
Jennifer McGrath, a Las Vegas resident of two years who has volunteered for the Trump campaign, appreciates the convenience of dropping off her ballot while sheâ€™s already at the rally. She said it helps her avoid the risk of an issue coming up on election day that prevents her from making it to the polls.
â€œI also received a receipt which lets me know how to check on the status of my ballot,â€ she said. â€œThat way within about 48 hours I will know that my ballot has been delivered to the vote center and counted.â€
The collection at the rally is only part of a broader strategy Turning Point calls â€œballot chasing.â€
â€œWeâ€™ve hired full time staffers here, especially in congressional district three, in our low propensity targeted districts and precincts to help to get out that vote,â€ Gorai said.
At around 20 â€œSuper Chaseâ€ events in the past month, volunteers and staffers partnered together to door knock and ensure voters have what they need.
â€œThat might be taking them to the polls, helping them to get the ballot in the mail, helping them to take that to a drop box, whatever it might look like,â€ Gorai said. â€œWhatever is easier for the voter is how we approach that ballot.â€
While I was in Summerlin assisting voters and knocking on doors, I asked @Lexieeebb to help me with folks who have reached out way across town, to pick up their ballots!
She secured +2 Republican Ballots for @realDonaldTrump and @CaptainSamBrown!
Use the @TPAction_ App and seeâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/1D4AhgJfnQ
â€” Schayden GoraiğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ (@schaykg) October 22, 2024
While there has been a more aggressive effort to secure ballots, those working with the Trump campaign believe the GOPâ€™s election integrity efforts have also given voters the confidence to turn out in greater number.
The state party has pushed poll watchers to Clark and Washoe county locations and launched a hotline in southern and northern Nevada.
â€œI think just having a presence, Republican voters knowing that there are volunteer poll watchers at these locations monitoring the process, I think it really helps those folks,â€ Nevada GOP executive director Alex Watson told the DCNF. â€œJust knowing that we have people there that have the best thoughts in mind for the election, making sure itâ€™s safe, secure for everybody.â€
Nicole Kelly, a political and election law attorney who served as the Republican National Lawyers Associationâ€™s Nevada Political Director in 2022, told the DCNF that highlighting how GOP lawyers are involved in the process has given voters faith issues will be handled in timely manner, not just after election day.
Nevada State Democratic Party spokesperson Carlos Perez criticized Republicans in a statement to the DCNF for â€œparticipating in the same legal process theyâ€™ve been telling lies about for years.â€ (RELATED: Election Litigation Could Shape The Race In Battleground States. We Wonâ€™t Know Until The Votes Are Cast.)
â€œAs weâ€™ve said all along, this election will be close and Nevada Democrats will continue to use every tool at our disposal to ensure we elect Democrats up and down the ballot,â€ Perez said.
Watson believes the main driver of Republicans turning out to vote early is genuine enthusiasm.
â€œPeople want to go out and vote for the president,â€ Watson said. â€œWeâ€™re seeing the messaging really hitting on like the economy and inflation, and I think thatâ€™s been a winning message for us, especially in this state. Weâ€™re a tourism-based economy, so we get hit hard when the inflation is high and the economy is bad.â€
Trump voters who spoke with the DCNF at the rally and early voting sites consistently named the economy and immigration as top concerns. Multiple who voted early said they just wanted to get it out of the way.
One first-time voter said she has been a long-time Trump supporter but choose to finally vote because itâ€™s been â€œso badâ€ the last three years. â€œWe need to make a change,â€ she said.
A 32-year Democrat who has lived in Las Vegas for nearly four decades told the DCNF he switched his registration this year to vote for Trump in the caucus.
Republicans messaging aims to motivate voters by assuring them their vote will make an impact and making sure they understand how crucial it is in a swing state like Nevada.
â€œYouâ€™re at the center and at the heart of this election,â€ Republican Florida Sen. Marco Rubio told Las Vegas voters Thursday. â€œI truly believe that how this state goes is how the election is going to go.â€

title: Trump Leading Harris In State GOP Hasnâ€™t Won In Nearly 25 Years: POLL
content:
A poll released late Sunday revealed Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump holds a slight lead in New Hampshire, a state Republicans havenâ€™t won in 24 years.
Friday polling showed the former president remained three points behind Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris in New Hampshire but has since flipped the lead, now ahead 50.2% to 49.8%, according to the NH Journal. The last time the state voted red was for former President George W. Bush over then-Democratic nominee Al Gore.
â€œThereâ€™s a reason Kamala Harris has been spending money in New Hampshire,â€ Karoline Leavitt, a Trump campaign spokesperson and New Hampshire native, told the NH Journal. â€œSheâ€™s on defense and knows President Trump is on the path to victory. To my fellow Granite Staters who want to keep our beautiful state safe, business-friendly, and free â€” get out and vote for President Trump. Kamala Harris is a radical liberal who would destroy New Hampshire and America forever.â€
Republican gubernatorial candidate Kelly Ayotte also holds a lead over Democratic nominee Joyce Craig in the state by nearly four percentage points, polling at 51.9% to Craigâ€™s 48.1%, according to the NH Journal.
NEW HAMPSHIRE
Praecones Analytica / @NewHampJournal poll:Trump 50.2% (+0.4)
Harris 49.8%622 RV, 10/24-26
â€” Political Polls (@Politics_Polls) October 28, 2024
Trump lost the state in his election bids in both 2016 and 2020, with President Joe Biden winning the state by over 7% in 2020.
Recent polling shows Trump leading Harris by two points nationally, 47% to 45%, according to The Wall Street Journal. Harrisâ€™ favorability among voters has also fallen from 50% in August to 45% in late October with her approval rating as vice president falling to just 42%, her lowest since announcing her presidential campaign.
The economy remains the most important issue for voters in New Hampshire, with 34% reporting it as their top issue this election, according to an earlier Emmerson College poll. New Hampshire voters were also 54% less likely to vote for a candidate that supported men competing in womenâ€™s sports, the NH Journal poll found. (RELATED: Voters Trust Trump Over Harris On Most Important Issue, New Poll Finds)
The poll surveyed 622 registered voters between Oct. 24 and 26 with a margin of error of +/- 3.93%.
The Trump and Harris campaigns did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.
