title: Social Media Erupts Over Video Appearing To Show Harris Supporter Screaming At Child In Stroller
content:
A video trending on social media appearing to show a Kamala Harris supporter screaming at a child in a stroller Friday in Houston sparked strong reactions from viewers, including the Trump campaign.
The video shows a white woman in a blue crop top and black shorts getting into the face of a little blonde girl as she seemingly yelled, â€œI donâ€™t give a fuck, your dadâ€™s a [bitch?]!â€ A black woman standing beside the apparent Harris supporter then yanks her away from the childâ€™s face and appeared to confront her for lashing out at the toddler. A man in a blue shirt holding a microphone is next seen lifting the child out of the stroller after the supposed Harris supporter was chided by other rally-goers.
Amidst the reactions of the surrounding crowd, the man, using the microphone, then asks the woman, â€œAre you ashamed at all? Are you ashamed?â€
â€œNo,â€ she responds.
â€œLook at her face, everyone look at her face,â€ the man continued, referring to the girl viewers speculated to be his daughter.
â€œWhy would you bring her here?â€ the woman appears to retort as the video ends.
Among the reactions from social media accounts was one from the Trump campaign, who put the apparent Harris supporter on blast for her alleged behavior. (RELATED: Democratic Senator Marvels That Trump Support In Key Battleground State Is â€˜Astonishingâ€™)
â€œWhat type of deranged lunatic would scream at an innocent child like this?â€ Trump campaign press secretary Karoline Leavitt wrote on X (formerly known as Twitter). â€œApparently a Kamala Harris supporter.â€
What type of deranged lunatic would scream at an innocent child like this?
Apparently a Kamala Harris supporter. pic.twitter.com/dNfzJuvxBG
â€” Karoline Leavitt (@kleavittnh) October 26, 2024
â€œKamala support screams in little girlâ€™s face and taunts her. Decency is on the ballot,â€ Trump campaign senior communications adviser Steven Cheung wrote.
Kamala supporter screams in little girlâ€™s face and taunts her.
Decency is on the ballot. https://t.co/cqoCmS5OgY
â€” Steven Cheung (@TheStevenCheung) October 26, 2024
Other social media users also weighed in on the supposed Harris supporterâ€™s viral behavior toward the child.
â€œSo much joy!â€ Collin Rugg wrote, mocking Harrisâ€™s abandoned â€œjoyâ€ slogan.
Liberal woman starts screaming at a baby prompting a Kamala Harris supporter to intervene and pull her away.
So much Joy!
The incident happened outside of Harrisâ€™ Houston rally.pic.twitter.com/Q9cU6Iyjfy
â€” Collin Rugg (@CollinRugg) October 26, 2024
â€œThe hysteria being pushed by the left is making people mentally ill,â€ X user @bonchieredstate commented.
A Kamala Harris supporter screams in the face of a young child in a stroller.
The hysteria being pushed by the left is making people mentally ill. pic.twitter.com/5F9laSmK23
â€” Bonchie (@bonchieredstate) October 26, 2024
â€œFriends, you have to be absolutely deranged and soulless to be a grown adult screaming in a young toddlerâ€™s face like this,â€ author and podcast host David Harris Jr. chimed in.
Kamala Harris supporter screams in the face of a little girl over her dadâ€™s support for Trump.
Friends, you have to be absolutely deranged and soulless to be a grown adult screaming in a young toddlerâ€™s face like this. pic.twitter.com/h2L3fAbbYW
â€” David J Harris Jr (@DavidJHarrisJr) October 26, 2024
â€œLetâ€™s make this vile demon famousâ€¦â€ X user @texan_maga wrote.
Deranged #KamalaHarris supporter screams in the face of a child
What an ignorant, self-entitled shrew.
Letâ€™s make this vile demon famousâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/yzQKiySkHA
â€” ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡²Salty Texan (@texan_maga) October 26, 2024
Although some social media users floated a potential identity of the woman seen screaming at the child, it was not immediately confirmed. What prompted the supposed Harris supporterâ€™s reaction is currently unclear. Others speculated the man was a protestor who wielded a Bible and microphone to confront Harris supporters.
The incident took place at Democrat presidential nominee Kamala Harrisâ€™s rally in Houston. Various media outlets speculated pop star BeyoncÃ© would perform a song when she appeared on stage. Rather than sing, however, BeyoncÃ© merely spoke for about five minutes to introduce Harris.

title: Trump Within Striking Distance Of Harris In State GOP Hasnâ€™t Won Since New Millennium
content:
Former President Donald Trump has closed within striking range of Vice President Kamala Harris in New Hampshire, a state the GOP hasnâ€™t claimed in a presidential race since 2000.
A new Emerson College Polling/WHDH poll, conducted Oct. 21-23, shows Harris with a narrow lead of just three points over Trump, garnering support from 50% of likely voters compared to Trumpâ€™s 47%. Third-party candidates pull 2%, with 1% of voters still undecided.
This slim margin signals a more competitive race than many anticipated in the Democratic-leaning state as Trump gains momentum in a state that President Joe Biden carried by over 7% in 2020. Recent polling shows a noticeable shift among male voters in favor of Trump, while Harris maintains a lead among women similar to Bidenâ€™s in the last election.
â€œHarrisâ€™ margin among women is similar to that of Biden in 2020 â€” however, male voters have shifted about two points toward Trump,â€ Spencer Kimball, executive director of Emerson College Polling, said. â€œIn addition, Harris is underperforming Bidenâ€™s 2020 support among independent voters, who break for Harris by 13 points, but broke for Biden by about double that amount.â€
Trump cuts Harris lead to 3 points in New Hampshire: Poll https://t.co/nlf7U1zdF6
â€” The Hill (@thehill) October 25, 2024
Economic concerns dominate the political landscape in New Hampshire, with 34% of respondents identifying the economy as their top issue, followed by housing affordability at 26%, which may play into Trumpâ€™s hands as he campaigns on promises of financial recovery and job creation, pressing an agenda aimed squarely at discontent over inflation and rising costs, Emerson College Polling stated. For Harris, addressing these economic anxieties will be critical as she works to consolidate her base in New Hampshire. (RELATED: Voters Trust Trump Over Harris On Most Important Issue, New Poll Finds)
Other polls conducted recently suggest trouble for Harris as well, in a tight race for Arab American support, a new Arab News/YouGov poll shows Trump edging out Harris, with 45% backing Trump over Harrisâ€™s 43%. As the election nears, Harrisâ€™s team is reportedly concerned about her standing in key swing states like Michigan, where Arab American and Muslim communities could prove pivotal.
With just under two weeks until election day, Trump holds a slight 47%-45% lead nationally over Harris, according to a Wall Street Journal poll released Thursday. This shift follows Augustâ€™s poll, where Harris held an advantage, now within the margin of error.

title: Chinese Student Accused Of Voting Illegally â€” And His Vote Will Reportedly Count
content:
Michigan officials have charged a Chinese national for allegedly voting in the 2024 elections illegally, and there is reportedly no way for election officials to remove his vote now that itâ€™s been tabulated.
An unidentified University of Michigan student, who is described as a Chinese national and not a U.S. citizen, allegedly registered to vote and cast a ballot in the 2024 general election, according to a Wednesday statement from the Michigan Secretary of State Jocelyn Bensonâ€™s office and the Washtenaw County Prosecutorâ€™s office. The announcement comes just six days from Election Day, with polls showing Michigan up for grabs. (RELATED: Biden-Appointed Judge Blocks Virginia Effort To Remove Non-Citizens From Voter Rolls)
â€œWe are grateful for the swift action of the clerk in this case, who took the appropriate steps and referred the case to law enforcement,â€ read a joint statement from Benson and the Washtenaw County Prosecutorâ€™s Office. â€œWe are also grateful to law enforcement for swiftly and thoroughly investigating this case.â€
â€œAnyone who attempts to vote illegally faces significant consequences, including but not limited to arrest and prosecution,â€ the statement continued.
The individual registered to vote on Sunday, signed a document which identified himself as an American citizen and entered his ballot into a tabulator, according to Bensonâ€™s office. However, the University of Michigan student later reached out to his local clerkâ€™s office and asked if he could get his ballot back.
Despite it being an unlawful vote, the Chinese manâ€™s ballot is expected to remain counted in the general election because there is no way for election officials to obtain it now that itâ€™s been put through a tabulator, according to sources familiar with the stateâ€™s election laws that spoke with the Detroit News. This is reportedly because ballots are designed to not be tracked back to an individual voter.
A spokesperson for the Michigan Secretary of Stateâ€™s Office did not immediately respond to a request for comment from the Daily Caller News Foundation on whether the vote could be removed before the conclusion of the general election.
The Chinese national has been charged with perjury, for making a false statement on an affidavit with the intention of securing voter registration, and for attempting to vote as an unauthorized elector, according to Bensonâ€™s office. The second crime is a felony that is punishable by up to four years in prison and a fine of $2,000.
News of the alleged incident comes as Michigan remains largely deadlocked in the polls between former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris. The Real Clear Politics (RCP) polling average shows the two candidates statistically tied, Harris up by half a percentage point.
At the same time, GOP states have battled the Biden-Harris Justice Department in the courtroom over the ability to purge non-citizens from voting rolls. The Justice Department recently forced Alabama to reverse its efforts to clean voter rolls, while the Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed Virginia to keep the non-citizens they removed off the books.

title: â€˜Ask Yourself A Basic Question About Network Integrityâ€™: JD Vance Calls Out CNN Host Over â€˜Russia Hoaxâ€™ Coverage
content:
Republican vice presidential nominee J.D. Vance called out CNN host Jake Tapper Sunday over coverage of the â€œRussia Hoaxâ€ when Tapper asked a slew of questions about recent comments made by the former president.
Former Trump chief of staff John Kelly told the New York Times that Trump meets the definition of a fascist in an article released Tuesday. Tapper repeatedly pressed Vance with questions likening Trump to the â€œdictatorâ€ Kelly claimed he would rule as, but Vance brought up CNNâ€™s coverage of false claims of Russian interference in the 2016 election.
â€œAsk yourself a basic question on network integrity. You guys talked about the Russia Hoax non-stop,â€ Vance said.
â€œThe FBI was investigating it!â€ Tapper interjected. â€œThe FBI was investigating it so we were covering thatâ€”â€
â€œAnd so you took the words of unnamed FBI agents and put them on your network as though they were the gospel truth. You did it again and again,â€ Trumpâ€™s running mate chided.
Vance admonished CNN for leading viewers to incorrectly believe former President Donald Trump conspired with Russian President Vladimir Putin to interfere in the 2016 election. Hillary Clintonâ€™s 2016 presidential campaign paid a tech firm that â€œexploitedâ€ access to Trump Tower and later at the White House in an attempt to link Trump to Russia.
Tapper said â€œnoâ€ various times as the GOP vice presidential candidate called out his network, repeating the argument that CNN covered the FBI investigation. (RELATED: DOJ Launches Russia Collusion Investigation in Alleged Effort To Combat Foreign Election Interference)
â€œCan we talk about the issues that Americans care about?â€ Vance asked.
â€œIâ€™m talking about things that Donald Trump has said,â€ the CNN host rebutted. â€œIf you have an issue with whether or not heâ€™s talking about the economy enough, thatâ€™s between you and your running mate. Iâ€™m talking about things he has said this week.â€
Vance assured Tapper that Trump talks at length about topics concerning the American people at every single campaign rally, including remarks on energy, housing, and the border.
â€œKamala Harris and her media allies â€” and I would put CNN in this category,â€ Vance said, prompting an immediate rejection from Tapper of CNNâ€™s alliance with Harris.
â€œYou guys seem to care more about Donald Trumpâ€™s past than the future of the American people. Weâ€™re running this campaign on making the American Dream affordable,â€ Vance added.

title: Bomb Threat Forces Swing State County GOP Headquarters To Close
content:
The Republican committee headquarters in Montgomery County, Pennsylvania, was forced to close its doors on Saturday after staff received a bomb threat by phone, according to a press release.
Pennsylvaniaâ€™s GOP stated that an â€œangryâ€ caller made a â€œprofanity-laced bomb threatâ€ to the Montgomery County office around 11:07 a.m. The state GOP noted that this incident isnâ€™t isolated, as the party has experienced an increase in violent threats since September.
â€œNothing will stop us from working to elect those who will put our country back on track,â€ Republican Party of Pennsylvania Chairman Lawrence Tabas wrote.
â€œAnd there should be unanimous agreement that political violence has no place in our elections, especially after an innocent Butler County husband and father lost his life to political violence,â€ Tabas added. â€œWe emphatically urge Pennsylvanians to voice their opinions by voting, not violence and intimidation.â€
In early September, an Erie County GOP staffer allegedly received death threats from a state resident, who threatened to kill the worker if they did not respond. (RELATED: â€˜Itâ€™s Horribleâ€™: Undecided Pennsylvania Voter Panel Unanimously Opposes Harris Calling Trump â€˜Fascistâ€™)
â€œI will KILL YOU IF YOU DONâ€™T ANSWER ME!â€ â€œGONNA F***ING FIND YOU AND SKIN YOU ALIVE AND USE YOUR SKIN FOR F***ING TOILET PAPER, YOU F***ING KKK**T!â€ the test message stated, according to the press release.
Later, on Oct. 10, protestors â€œforcibly enteredâ€ the Delaware County Republican headquarters, reportedly threatening to â€œkill staffâ€ and refusing to allow them to leave the building, according to the press release. During the incident, two female volunteers told authorities they felt threatened by the four protestors, the Mainline Times & Suburban reported.
â€œThis type of harassment â€” a descent into threats or intimidation â€” ought to have no no place in our community,â€ Republican Party officials told the outlet at the time. â€œWe condemn it in the strongest possible terms, and call on our friends across the aisle to do the same.â€
By Oct. 17, an unspecified number of GOP-affiliated individuals received an anonymous letter warning that if former President Donald Trump wins this November, their â€œpropertyâ€ and family â€œmay be impacted,â€ the press release reported.
â€œShould your candidate winâ€¦we know where you live, you are in the data base. In the dead of a cold winters night, this year, or next and beyond, there is no knowing what may happen. Your property, your family may be impactedâ€¦â€ the letter stated. â€œYou tread on me at your peril, motherf****r. We look forward to visiting in the future.â€
The stateâ€™s GOP noted local police departments, Democratic Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiroâ€™s Election Integrity Task Force and the FBI have been made aware of the threats.
Shapiroâ€™s office and the FBI did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: â€˜I Have To Beg To Differâ€™: Katie Couric Disputes Charlamagneâ€™s Claim Harris Is â€˜Authenticâ€™
content:
Journalist Katie Couric pushed back against radio host Charlamagne Tha Godâ€™s description of Vice President Kamala Harris as â€œauthenticâ€ during a Thursday podcast.
Charlamagne, on â€œNext Question with Katie Couric,â€ argued Harrisâ€™ response to him during their recent town hall when he raised criticism about her sounding â€œscripted,â€ which made him view her as genuine. Couric disagreed, saying Harris seems hesitant to say anything that might provoke a backlash and tends to avoid clearly explaining â€œher true policy position.â€ (RELATED: Harris Fails To Explain Flip-Flops, Says She Has No Regrets About Biden In First Interview)
WATCH:
â€œI think she said something in the beginning of our conversation when I brought up the fact that people say sheâ€™s very scripted, you know, people say she sticks to her talking points. She said, â€˜Youâ€™re welcome,â€™ you know? â€˜I call that discipline.â€™ And it made me think about something,â€ Charlamagne told Couric in response to her question about his perception of Harrisâ€™ authenticity during their town hall. â€œI think that weâ€™ve seen such a lack of discipline since [former President] Donald Trump came on the scene that we forgot what that looks like.â€
â€œSo when you have a politician who is in an interview or in a conversation and theyâ€™re being disciplined, as she says, and getting their message across and telling us what their policies are and, you know, detailing their policies, itâ€™s kind of like, â€˜We want to be entertained,â€™ right? And thatâ€™s not what I think we need from our politicians,â€ he added. â€œSo, to say, do I think she was being authentic? Yeah, I think she was being authentically who she is, which is a very disciplined, seasoned veteran politician.â€
Voters have criticized Harris for how she answers questions on the campaign trail, with Couric echoing some of their sentiments in response to Charlamagne.
â€œI have to beg to differ with you on that point. I think that she takes a really long time to get to her point, and that she does rely on talking points too often. I think sheâ€™s gotten much better than she used to, but itâ€™s almost as if sheâ€™s afraid to say something that will later come back to haunt her,â€ the journalist said. â€œAnd I find the fact that she just doesnâ€™t really articulate to me her true policy position and that she isnâ€™t really directly answering the questions a lot of times.â€
â€œThatâ€™s been my experience and my experience watching her. I just wish she would say, â€˜This is our plan,â€™ or, â€˜Youâ€™re right, a lot of illegal immigrants have come into this country during the Biden administration, but this is why, and this is what I want to do about it moving forward.â€™ You know?â€ she continued. â€œI donâ€™t find her explanation of policy that compelling compared to, say, someone like [former President] Bill Clinton or [former President] Barack Obama.â€
Charlamagne acknowledged he â€œcan understandâ€ Couricâ€™s views on the vice president.
Journalist Mark Halperin said recently that Harrisâ€™ â€œlack of decisivenessâ€ remains her primary weakness.
That, to me, is her Achillesâ€™ heel; that is the thing that bedevils her,â€ Halperin said. â€œBecause public speaking â€” sheâ€™s not a stupid person â€” public speaking on tough questions, even if theyâ€™re not asked in a tough way, involves on-your-feet, making decisions about what to say. And you donâ€™t want to annoy anybody or anger anybody or commit a political error.â€

title: Harris Completes Pivot To Failed â€˜Democracyâ€™ Message With Speech At J6 Site
content:
WASHINGTON, D.C. â€“ Vice President Kamala Harris used her closing argument, one week out from the election, to complete a messaging pivot at the Ellipse, where Trump once addressed his supporters hours before the Jan. 6 Capitol Riot.
Harris, surrounded by her usual â€œfreedomâ€ signage, told tens of thousands of her supporters that Trump was â€œobsessed with revenge,â€ is a â€œpetty tyrantâ€ and would seek to use the military against his enemies if elected to the White House on Nov. 5. The vice president, adding that the former president was â€œout for unchecked powerâ€ and had an enemies list, further drew on the location of her speech within the first few minutes of her closing argument to try to prove Trump is such.
Harrisâ€™ closing arguments displayed a larger campaign message in the final weeks of the election, one that has shifted from one of â€œjoyâ€ to that of calling Trump a fascist, â€œunhinged,â€ â€œunstableâ€ and unfit to lead.
â€œLook, we know who Donald Trump is. He is the person who stood at this very spot nearly four years ago and sent an armed mob to the United States Capitol to overturn the will of the people in a free and fair election,â€ Harris said.
â€œDonald Trump has told us his priorities for a second term. He has an enemies list of people he intends to prosecute. He says one of his highest priorities is to set free the violent extremists who assaulted those law enforcement officers on January 6th,â€ the continued.
Harrisâ€™ final message is one that closely mirrors President Joe Bidenâ€™s campaign messaging of pinning Trump down as a â€œthreat to democracy,â€ which often touched on the Jan. 6, 2021 Capitol riot to illustrate their point.
The Daily Caller spoke to several rally goers at Harris rally, some of who echoed the vice presidentâ€™s message that â€œdemocracyâ€ was on the line in the 2024 election and feared a dangerous Trump if he was elected.
â€œI think itâ€™s our democracy [that is at stake,]â€ Jason Vaughn, a nurse practitioner from the south visiting D.C. for the rally and work, told the Caller, â€œI believe Trump is a fascist.â€
â€œI think he has figured out that he has all this power, and the Supreme Court has told him he can do whatever he wants, and I think he is going to run with that if he is around. Itâ€™s do or die,â€ Marcus Reed, a government employee who lives in D.C., told the Caller.
While her supporters worried about the potential of Trump with unchecked power, the vice president told them in her speech that he could weaponize the military against them.
â€œDonald Trump intends to use the United States military against American citizens who simply disagree with him. People he calls â€” quote â€” â€˜the enemy from within.â€™ This is not a candidate for President who is thinking about how to make your life better,â€ she said.
â€œThis is someone who is unstable, obsessed with revenge, consumed with grievance, and out for unchecked power,â€ Harris continued.
Bidenâ€™s messaging reportedly made top Democrats anxious as it wasnâ€™t landing with voters, but still the campaign continued with it. At one point, Biden met with historians to help frame his speeches around â€œthe ongoing threats to democracy and democratic institutions both here in America and around the world, as well as the opportunities we face as a nation,â€ the White House previously said.
Itâ€™s something Biden has continued to parrot despite dropping out of the race. White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters Wednesday that the president thinks Trump is a fascist.
â€œYou have heard from this president over and over again about the threats to democracy,â€ Jean-Pierre said. â€œAnd the president has spoken about that. You have heard from the former president himself that he is going to be a dictator on day one. This is him, not us. This is him.â€
About an hour before, Harris had unexpectedly given remarks from her residence in response to a report from The New York Times and The Atlantic. Both outlets conducted interviews with former Trump chief of staff John Kelly, who said the former president â€œmet the definition of a fascistâ€ and admired figures like former Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler.
The Atlantic article citing Kellyâ€™s comments additionally alleged that Trump disparaged a deceased veteran and her family. The Trump campaign alongside former officials, the deceased veteranâ€™s family and their lawyer have all gone on the record to deny the story.
Harris has repeatedly spoken about Kellyâ€™s comments anyways.
â€œIt is clear from John Kellyâ€™s words that Donald Trump is someone who, I quote, â€˜certainly falls into the general definition of fascist.â€™ Who vowed to be a dictator on day one and vowed to use the military as his personal militia to carry out his personal and political vendettas,â€ the vice president said.
â€œDonald Trump is increasingly unhinged and unstable, and in a second term, people like John Kelly would not be there to be the guard rails against his propensities and his actions,â€ she continued.
Kamala Harris, who calls Trump a fascist, and Joe Biden, who calls Trumpâ€™s supporters garbage, have something to say about the divisiveness of Trumpâ€™s rhetoric.
â€” David Sacks (@DavidSacks) October 30, 2024
A few hours after her remarks and Jean-Pierreâ€™s comments, the vice president said she believed Trump was a fascist.
â€œYou quoted General Milly calling Trump a fascist. You yourself have not used that word to describe him. Let me ask you tonight, do you think Donald Trump is a fascist?â€ CNN host Anderson Cooper asked Harris.
â€œYes, I do,â€ Harris said without hesitation. â€œAnd I also believe that the people who know him best on this subject should be trusted.â€
But since Harris has pivoted to the message that seemingly played into Bidenâ€™s demise, her own party has started to fret about the vice presidentâ€™s election chances.
â€œIt doesnâ€™t play well in communities that are struggling to make ends meet, and thatâ€™s the problem. Theyâ€™re talking to the wrong people,â€ Sherry Gay-Dagnogo, a former state representative and Detroit school board member who is backing Harris, told Politico. â€œWe canâ€™t keep campaigning on modes of fear.â€
I made a promise to the people of our country: I will fight for you, regardless of who you vote for, and be a president for all Americans. Here is my closing argument. https://t.co/rOqLcTB0TR
â€” Kamala Harris (@KamalaHarris) October 29, 2024
During her speech, the vice president drew parallels between the 2024 election to the American revolution, as in both situations, she argued power needed to be wrestled from a â€œpetty tyrant.â€
â€œJust like I always have. Nearly 250 years ago, America was born when we wrested freedom from a petty tyrant,â€ she said. â€œAcross the generations, Americans have: Preserved that freedom. Expanded it. And in so doing, proved to the world that a government of, by and for the people is strong and can endure. And those who came before us â€” the patriots at Normandy and Selma. Seneca Falls and Stonewall. On farmlands and factory floors.â€
â€œThey did not struggle, sacrifice and lay down their lives, only to see us cede our fundamental freedoms, only to see us submit to the will of another petty tyrant,â€ Harris continued.
Taylor, a Maryland woman in case management supporting Harris at her D.C. rally, expressed fear at the thought of Trump being president. The Caller omitted Taylorâ€™s last name for the sake of anonymity to allow her to discuss her views freely.
â€œItâ€™s scary to think that Donald Trump will be back in office, and Project 2025, he is saying he isnâ€™t using it but it was written, so thatâ€™s scary,â€ Taylor told the Caller.
Other Harris supporters at the Ellipse thought that the very rights they hold today could disappear if Trump reaches the White House again.
â€œEveryoneâ€™s freedoms,â€ a Maryland woman in the travel industry, given anonymity to speak freely, told the Caller. â€œEven the right to vote.â€

title: â€˜Why Not?â€™: Trump Tells Rogan Heâ€™ll Use Tariffs To Eliminate Income Tax, Make America â€˜Richâ€™
content:
Former President Donald Trump said he would seek to use tariffs to potentially eliminate the income tax in a lengthy interview with podcaster Joe Rogan released Friday night.
Trump, who enacted tariffs on steel and aluminum in 2018 during his presidency, sat with the podcaster in a nearly three-hour long episode of The Joe Rogan Experience. Rogan asked Trump if he was â€œseriousâ€ about using tariffs to offset the elimination of income taxes. (RELATED: â€˜He Saved The Steel Industryâ€™: Steelworkers In Key Swing State Explain Why They Endorsed Trump)
WATCH:
â€œTo me, the most beautiful word â€” and Iâ€™ve said this the past couple of weeks, in the dictionary today â€” is the word tariff,â€ Trump told Rogan. â€œItâ€™s more beautiful than love, itâ€™s more beautiful than any â€” itâ€™s the most beautiful word. This country can become rich with the use, the proper use, of tariffs.â€
Trump said he would impose a 200% tariff on John Deereâ€™s tractors if it closed an American factory and moved production to Mexico in September.
â€œDid you just float out the idea of getting rid of income taxes and replacing it with tariffs?â€ Rogan asked. â€œWere you serious about that?â€
â€œWhy not?â€ Trump responded. â€œOur country was the richest, relatively, in the 1880s and 1890s, a president who was assassinated named McKinley, he was the tariff king. He spoke beautifully of tariffs. His language was really beautiful: We will not allow the enemy to come in and take our jobs and take our factories and take our workers and take our families unless they pay a big price and the big price is tariffs.â€ (Watch The Daily Caller Documentary â€œCleaning Up Kamalaâ€)
Vice President Kamala Harris has claimed in ads and in speeches that Trumpâ€™s plan to impose tariffs would act as a â€œnational sales taxâ€ and insisted that it would cost American families $4,000 a year in higher prices, the Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Not To Be Outdone By An Insult Comic, Biden Calls American Voters â€˜Garbageâ€™
content:
President Joe Biden referred to former President Donald Trumpâ€™s supporters as â€œgarbageâ€ Tuesday in a Zoom call with the organization Voto Latino following comments made at a Trump rally by a comedian.
The comments from the president were in response to those made by comic Tony Hinchcliffe on Sunday while speaking at a Trump rally in Madison Square Garden, where the comedian referred to Puerto Rico as a â€œfloating island of garbage.â€ Biden attempted to clarify the comments in an X post Tuesday night after receiving backlash, claiming he was referring to the â€œrhetoricâ€ put out by the comic and not Trump supporters.
â€œDonald Trump has no character. He doesnâ€™t give a damn about the Latino community. Heâ€™s failed a businessman. He only cares about the billionaire friends he had and accumulated wealth for those at the top,â€ Biden said in the video.
â€œAnd just the other day, a speaker at his rally called Puerto Rico a â€˜floating island of garbage.â€™ Well, let me tell you something â€¦ I donâ€™t know the Puerto Rican that I know â€” or a Puerto Rico, where Iâ€™m â€” in my home state of Delaware, theyâ€™re good, decent, honorable people. The only garbage I see floating out there is his supporters. His demonization of Latinos is unconscionable, and itâ€™s un-American. Itâ€™s totally contrary to everything weâ€™ve done, everything weâ€™ve been.â€
Hereâ€™s the video: pic.twitter.com/7hNp3su8k2
â€” Gabe Gutierrez (@gabegutierrez) October 30, 2024
Biden addressed the backlash by condemning the rhetoric against Puerto Rico at Trumpâ€™s Madison Square Garden rally as hateful. He clarified that he believed the alleged divisive language toward Latinos contradicts American values.
â€œEarlier today I referred to the hateful rhetoric about Puerto Rico spewed by Trumpâ€™s supporter at his Madison Square Garden rally as garbage â€” which is the only word I can think of to describe it. His demonization of Latinos is unconscionable. Thatâ€™s all I meant to say. The comments at that rally donâ€™t reflect who we are as a nation,â€ Biden wrote on X.
In a statement reported by journalist Gabe Gutierrez, the White House further emphasized that Biden was referring to the comedian Tony Hinchcliffe, who backs Trump and made disparaging remarks about Puerto Rico. (RELATED: Anti-Trump Journalist Claims Dem â€˜Outrageâ€™ Over Trump MSG Rally â€˜Missesâ€™ Point, Predicts Most â€˜Diverseâ€™ GOP Base Ever)
â€œThereâ€™s a lot going on. I donâ€™t know if you know this, but thereâ€™s literally a floating island of garbage in the middle of the ocean right now. I think itâ€™s called Puerto Rico,â€ Hinchcliffe said at the rally.
The White House initially released a transcript that showed Biden saying â€œsupportersâ€™,â€ with a plural possessive apostrophe. Later on, they updated the transcript to read â€œsupporterâ€™s,â€ implying that Biden wasnâ€™t referring to millions of Americans, but only Hinchcliffe himself. Many on social media, however, werenâ€™t buying it and accused the White House of incorrectly using an apostrophe.
The White House put a fake apostrophe in the transcript but the spoken word is clear. https://t.co/HIN6QulTjZ
â€” Miranda Devine (@mirandadevine) October 30, 2024
Morning Joe readâ€”didnâ€™t playâ€”Bidenâ€™s â€œgarbageâ€ comment to explain it. Another host cited the â€œapostropheâ€ as the culprit again. pic.twitter.com/MDDjLwJ7ZP
â€” Laura Ingraham (@IngrahamAngle) October 30, 2024
â€œThe only garbage I see floating out there is his supporters.â€ Thatâ€™s a direct quote. Thatâ€™s what Kamala Harrisâ€™s boss said. This is how Politico decided to report it:
Do @JonLemire @alexanderburns @politico have an ounce of integrity? Will they correct this obvious falsehood? pic.twitter.com/B1ktGVpLfz
â€” JD Vance (@JDVance) October 30, 2024
Former Daily Caller reporter and now-CNN host Kaitlan Collins on her show Tuesday night doubted the idea that Biden meant â€œsupporterâ€™sâ€ with an apostrophe.
â€œThe White House is trying to say that what President Biden was saying â€” theyâ€™re putting an apostrophe there in â€˜supporters,â€™ saying itâ€™s the singular, I guess referring to the comedian,â€ Collins said. â€œI mean, itâ€™s hard to really look at that when you can listen to it for yourself â€¦â€
Democratic Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro apparently criticized the attack as well on Collinsâ€™ show. â€œI would never insult the good people of Pennsylvania or any Americans even if they chose to support a candidate that I didnâ€™t support.â€
This story has been updated with additional context surrounding the â€œapostropheâ€ fight.

title: Social Media Erupts As Biden Bites Multiple Babies Dressed In Costumes
content:
President Joe Biden skipped the candy and went straight for the baby Wednesday night when he appeared to bite multiple infants dressed up for the annual Halloween celebration at the White House.
Viral video shows the president appear to chomp on a child wearing a chicken costume at the Biden familyâ€™s last trick-or-treat event at the White House. Theme music from the movie â€œJawsâ€ was heard playing as the baby, held by a woman wearing a long red dress, squirmed after Biden bowed his head and made contact.
Biden just bit a baby at the White House pic.twitter.com/i66Lai3lhu

â€œPresident Trump is mingling with garbage men at his rally in Wisconsin. Meanwhile, Joe Biden is literally BITING BABIES at the White House Halloween Party,â€ X user @nicksorter wrote in response to the video. â€œWTF IS THIS TIMELINE?â€
Sorter also posted a close-up image with a Reuters watermark showing Bidenâ€™s mouth apparently chomping down on the babyâ€™s leg.
President Trump is mingling with garbage men at his rally in Wisconsin.

Someone call 911 immediately

Social media users erupted as soon as Bidenâ€™s biting took the Internet by storm.

One X user, @realCCrump, posted a photo of Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump at a Wednesday rally dressed like a construction worker alongside another image of Bidenâ€™s biting a baby around the same time that evening. He wrote, â€œThese two are not the same.â€

title: â€˜Iâ€™m Confusedâ€™: Harris Faulkner Calls Out Dem Who Claimed Economy Is Better Than It Was Four Years Ago
content:
Fox News host Harris Faulkner expressed confusion Friday when a former Democratic lawmaker claimed the economy was in better shape than it was four years ago.
The economy added only 12,000 jobs in October, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported Friday, while also making downward revisions to job gains in August and September that totaled over 100,000. Faulkner asked former Democratic State Sen. David Carlucci of New York why Vice President Kamala Harris wasnâ€™t acknowledging the pain Americans felt. (RELATED: â€˜Itâ€™s Helpful If Youâ€™ll Answer The Questionâ€™: Harris Faulkner Chides Dem Guest For Spinning When Asked About Kamala Harris Comparing Trump To Hitler)
â€œWe do have to talk about this, and Iâ€™m wondering why the vice president isnâ€™t talking about this. Because I have to think they know before we do,â€ Faulkner said. â€œAnd so getting ahead of this with a more juicy message on I feel your pain, sheâ€™s got Bill Clinton, goodness gracious, take him with you. I mean, donâ€™t let him talk about the border, though, because thatâ€™s gonna be a problem for Kamala Harris. But seriously, whatâ€™s going on in the last few days? Thatâ€™s not what weâ€™re seeing.â€
WATCH:
Since President Joe Biden and Harris took office in January 2021, prices have risen by over 20%, while the consumer price index (CPI) peaked at 9% in June 2022. By comparison, the CPI grew by just 1.4% year-over-year in January 2021 when Trump left office, while the average price for a gallon of gas was under $2.25, according to GasBuddy.com.
â€œI think this is a winning issue for Kamala Harris,â€ Carlucci claimed, with Faulkner rebutting, â€œBut sheâ€™s not leading in any of these polls.â€
Carlucci claimed Harris was â€œneck-and-neckâ€ with former President Donald Trump in terms of the economy, to which Faulkner responded, â€œWait, 53 to 45, you think is neck-and-neck?â€
â€œThese are closer than what many people would have said if you only listen to one side and the rallies that Donald Trump does. He acts like the economy is in the toilet, but thatâ€™s just not true,â€ Carlucci claimed. â€œYes, people are struggling, and Kamala Harris knows that and says that, but youâ€™ve got to take it in its entirety. If we look at where we were four years ago, economists were saying we were headed towards a recession, possibly a depression.â€
â€œWhere we were four years ago was heading into 9% inflation, 9% inflation,â€ Faulkner responded. â€œSo exactly four years ago, around the time of the election, what was being handed was 1.4%. So Iâ€™m confused. I donâ€™t think you want to go back four years, â€™cause thatâ€™s an easy conversation to have.â€
Bidenâ€™s approval rating on the economy is only 39.8% in the RealClear Polling average, while only 36% gave him good marks on inflation and only 34.8% approved of his handling of immigration, all of which have been issues emphasized by former President Donald Trump in the campaign against Harris.

title: â€˜Stop The Crimesâ€™: Congressional Leaders Reveal How They Will Usher Immigration Agenda Under Trump Admin
content:
Congressional leaders in both the House and Senate revealed what they have in store for border enforcement and immigration reform if former President Donald Trump reenters the White House.
Beefing up border security and cracking down on interior enforcement are all on the table if Trump is reelected in November, according to several GOP lawmakers who spoke with the Daily Caller News Foundation. Sen Ted Cruz and Rep. Troy Nehls of Texas, along with Rep. Mark Green of Tennessee, have zeroed in on the issue in Congress and say they are ready and waiting to assist the incoming Trump administration. (RELATED: NYPD Refused Detainer Request And Released Illegal Migrant Charged With Attempted Murder, ICE Says)
â€œEvery day we hear about illegal aliens assaulting or murdering another American,â€ Cruz said to the DCNF. â€œIâ€™ve been fighting for justice for Jocelyn Nungaray, a 12-year-old from Houston who was brutally murdered by two illegal aliens released into Texas under the administration of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.â€
â€œNext Congress I look forward to passing and to having President Trump sign into law my Justice for Jocelyn Act,â€ Cruz continued. â€œThis legislation is aimed at ensuring that no child and no family ever again experiences what happened to Jocelyn.â€
Nungaray was a 12-year-old Houston girl who was allegedly sexually assaulted and murdered in June by two Venezuelan men. Federal immigration authorities say the two men entered the United States unlawfully before their arrest for Nungarayâ€™s brutal killing.
The Justice for Jocelyn Act would require the Department of Homeland Security to â€œexhaust all reasonable effortsâ€ to keep an illegal migrant in custody before resorting to releasing them into the interior of the country, according to the legislation. Should an illegal migrant be released, however, the bill would call for continuous GPS monitoring until their removal from the country or the completion of their immigration proceedings.
The legislation also would empower federal immigration officials to immediately deport illegal migrants who violate their terms of their release â€” a proposal that could potentially prevent an incredible number of crimes by illegal migrants who repeatedly encounter law enforcement.
â€œKamala Harris and Joe Biden have released dangerous illegal aliens into our country that have gone on to take the lives of American citizens,â€ Nehls stated to the DCNF. â€œI have introduced pieces of legislation that would remove illegal aliens who fail to comply with their release order and to improve the mandatory tracking and detention of illegal aliens for the entire process.â€
â€œToo many Americans have lost their lives at the hands of illegal aliens that Kamala Harris and Joe Biden let into our country,â€ Nehls continued. â€œCongress must do everything to ensure that Americans are put first, not illegal aliens who shouldnâ€™t even be here in the first place.â€
Nehls, whose district largely covers the Houston suburbs, is a sponsor for the Justice for Jocelyn Act on the House side. Like Cruz, the Republican congressman has also ripped the Biden-Harris administration for the release of illegal migrants when there has been detention space available within Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) facilities.
â€œIn a second Trump administration, the House Committee on Homeland Security will do everything possible to help the United States return to an era of secure borders and robust interior enforcement,â€ Green, who serves as chairman of the House Homeland Security Committee, stated to the DCNF. â€œEnding the Biden-Harris border crisis will require two things â€” policy changes to end the flow of inadmissible aliens into our country, and more funding for interior enforcement to demonstrate that there are consequences to entering illegally.â€
With Green as its chairman, the House Homeland Committee has remained one of the Biden-Harris administrationâ€™s fiercest critics, demanding answers on a slate of immigration-related controversies, such as the vetting process that went into the entry of an Afghan recently arrested for allegedly plotting an Election Day terrorist attack, the alleged failure of the administration to properly vet foreign nationals before they boarded domestic flights, the handling of unaccompanied alien children into the country, among numerous other border issues.
â€œWhile we donâ€™t control the budget process, I believe that providing massive increases for ICE detention and removal operations will be paramount, and I will be vocal about their necessity,â€ Green continued.
All three lawmakers have also been presented with the 2024 Congressional Champions of Interior Enforcement award by the National Immigration Center for Enforcement (NICE) for their legislative efforts. NICE has championed hawkish border policy in Washington, D.C., and tracked data that demonstrates the consequences of lax enforcement â€” such as when the group collected data on how substantially fewer criminal illegal migrants are being removed from the U.S. under the Biden-Harris administration compared to Trumpâ€™s time in office.
There were 423,102 deportations of criminal aliens under the first three fiscal years of the Trump administration, with that number falling to 134,617 during the same time period under the current administration, NICE uncovered. Those numbers marked a 74% decrease in removals altogether.
NICE advocates for the end of catch-and-release of illegal migrants at the border, the abolition of sanctuary city laws, requiring all employers in the country to use E-Verify, among numerous other hawkish policies.
â€œPresident Trump will be ready, Congress just needs to provide the resources,â€ RJ Hauman, president of NICE, said to the DCNF. He added that more detention beds are needed and called for â€œimmediateâ€ GPS monitoring of every illegal migrant on the non-detained docket in order to properly conduct sweeping deportations.
â€œOur champions of interior enforcement will be sure to lead the charge on Capitol Hill,â€ Hauman said.
The lawmakers said they are ready to work with their allies and hit the ground running if Trump occupies the Oval Office in January.
â€œI am deeply grateful to the National Immigration Center for Enforcement for all their work pushing back on the open-borders, anti-enforcement policies of the Biden-Harris administration, and to inform the American people about the damage these policies have caused,â€ Green said of the organization. â€œI encourage my colleagues on the Hill to consider partnering with them in pursuit of creative and effective policy solutions to this self-inflicted crisis.â€
â€œIâ€™ve been proud to work with some great allies on this bill, including the National Immigration Center for Enforcement,â€ Cruz said, referring to his Justice for Jocelyn Act. â€œTogether, we will act to stop the crimes enabled by this Biden-Harris administration.â€

title: ROOKE: Media Hit On Trump Accidentally Confirms Harris Has Major Election Problem Brewing
content:
The Atlantic published a report Tuesday on former President Donald Trump that was supposed to make Americans believe he is a racist bigot and literally Adolf Hitler. But hidden inside the obvious hit piece was the truth about a critical demographic Vice President Kamala Harris is clearly worried about.
When a fellow soldier and his girlfriend murdered U.S. Army Private Vanessa GuillÃ©n in April 2020, Trump brought her family to the White House to pay respects and promised to help them with the burial.
â€œI saw what happened to your daughter Vanessa, who was a spectacular person, and respected and loved by everybody, including in the military,â€ Trump told GuillÃ©nâ€™s mother, later adding, â€œIf I can help you out with the funeral, Iâ€™ll help â€” Iâ€™ll help you with that,â€ he said. â€œIâ€™ll help you out. Financially, Iâ€™ll help you.â€
JUST IN: The sister of Vanessa GuillÃ©n absolutely rips The Atlantic after they released a hit piece on Trump about her sisterâ€™s de*th.
Mayra Guillen says she is voting for Trump after unleashing on the outlet for politicizing Vanessaâ€™s de*th.
The Atlantic tried claiming Trumpâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/VEoMa55QO9
â€” Collin Rugg (@CollinRugg) October 22, 2024
Over four years later, The Atlantic is now trying to turn Trumpâ€™s generosity into a hit piece by claiming that anonymous sources and one disgruntled ex-staff member informed them that Trump told his staff privately that he wouldnâ€™t pay for GuillÃ©nâ€™s funeral bill. The outlet even went as far as claiming that Trump said: â€œIt doesnâ€™t cost 60,000 bucks to bury a f*cking Mexican!â€ (ROOKE: Trumpâ€™s McDonaldâ€™s Visit Tears Down Thin Veil Covering Harris Campaignâ€™s Greatest Weakness)
It was the last line that stood out the most. Not only have multiple people in the room and GuillÃ©nâ€™s family denied the entire contents of the so-called report, but it seems to point to an issue Harris is having with a particular demographic that has recently shifted from Democrat to Republican â€” Hispanic voters.
Wow.
I donâ€™t appreciate how you are exploiting my sisterâ€™s death for politics- hurtful & disrespectful to the important changes she made for service members. President Donald Trump did nothing but show respect to my family & Vanessa. In fact, I voted for President Trump today. https://t.co/o8cDrKOKBVâ€” Mayra Guillen (@mguilen_) October 22, 2024
Why else would The Atlantic, a leftist rag owned by Harrisâ€™ BFF, Laurene Powell Jobs, publish such a thin story based on nameless accusers with the backdrop being that Trump hates Hispanics? They could have accomplished the same goal with just about any storyline during the Trump administration. Still, they chose the death of a Hispanic immigrant solider to drive home their point, which seems to be that Trump apparently hates Hispanics.
There are over 36 million Hispanics in the U.S. with the right to vote, representing nearly 15 percent of eligible voters, according to the Americas Society/Council of the Americas (AS/COA). President Joe Biden carried the majority of Hispanic voters in 2020, despite Trump seeing an increase among their demographic at the ballot box compared to 2016.
I was in the Oval Office (pool correspondent) the day Vanessa Guillenâ€™s family visited. The meeting was somber, respectful, and according to Vanessaâ€™s sister Mayra, very much appreciated. @mguilen_ @FoxNews The Atlantic report alleging Trump disparaged slain Army privateâ€¦
â€” John Roberts (@johnrobertsFox) October 23, 2024
In the latest New York Times/Sienna Poll of registered Hispanic voters, Harris is well below the 66% Biden won in 2020. Just 56% of Hispanics told the poll they were voting for Harris, while 37% said they were voting for Trump. Considering that Biden won in 2020 due to a coalition of Hispanic, Black and Asian voters, Harris being so far behind Bidenâ€™s numbers is likely worrying her and other Democrats. The last Democrat presidential candidate to fall below 60% was John Kerry. (ROOKE: In Fewer Than 10 Words, Brian Stelter Lays Bare Democratsâ€™ White Liberal Ignorance Problem)
Kamala Harrisâ€™s support among Hispanic voters is in dangerously low territory for Democrats, according to a New York Times/Siena College poll, while Donald Trump has maintained his strength with the group poised to play a key role in deciding the election. https://t.co/W9XCL9ILzc
â€” The New York Times (@nytimes) October 13, 2024
Harris is losing critical demographics, like Hispanics and blue-collar workers, that Democrats have counted on in past elections, with only 13 days until Nov. 5. The desperation is evident with the hit piece attempting to portray Trump as a Hilter-esque bigot who hates Hispanics. The Atlanticâ€™s ties to Democrats and Harris only further confirm the suspicion that they need as many Hispanics as possible to break from Trumpâ€™s camp and vote for Harris.
One thing we know for sure, GuillÃ©nâ€™s sister denies The Atlanticâ€™s accusations and announced she voted for Trump.

title: Blue State To Offer Free Birth Control Using Multimillion Dollar Taxpayer Fund
content:
Michigan Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer launched a new program in her state Wednesday offering free birth control to all residents.
The â€œTake Control of your Birth Controlâ€ program will provide Michiganders with condoms, over-the-counter oral contraceptives and emergency contraception starting in November until supplies run out, according to a press release. The program is being administered by Michiganâ€™s Department of Health and Human Services, which was awarded $5.6 million in taxpayer funds to expand family planning services, according to the stateâ€™s budget.
â€œEveryone, no matter how much money they make, deserves to make their own decisions about their own reproductive health and future,â€ Whitmer said in the press release. â€œWith our family planning initiative, â€˜Take Control of Your Birth Control,â€™ we are building on our work to protect reproductive freedom for all Michiganders. By expanding access to essential family planning tools, we are underscoring our commitment to ensuring Michiganders, along with their families and trusted health care providers, can make their own decisions about their own bodies and lives.â€
The Biden-Harris administration on Monday called for private insurance companies to cover the cost of over-the-counter birth control through the Affordable Care Act, which Whitmer praised on X in an announcement for the new Michigan program. (â€˜Buy Votesâ€™: Michigan Republicans Blast State Dems For Trying To Keep Residents On Dole As Election Looms)
Weâ€™re excited to announce this program here in Michigan as @POTUS and @VP have just proposed expanding insurance coverage of birth control. Together, weâ€™re ensuring families have access to the resources they need and protecting reproductive freedom.
â€” Governor Gretchen Whitmer (@GovWhitmer) October 23, 2024
The governor has been a vocal pro-abortion advocate, suggesting she supports the practice through all nine months and even sued prosecutors in her state in 2022 in an attempt to enshrine abortion into the state constitution. The state passed a constitutional amendment that November legalizing abortion through 24 weeks of pregnancy and making it illegal to penalize doctors that perform the procedure.
Whitmerâ€™s office did not immediately respond to the Daily Caller News Foundationâ€™s request for comment.

title: Republicans Outpacing Democrats In Early In-Person Voting In Blue State
content:
Republicans are beating out their Democratic counterparts in New Jersey early in-person voting as of Tuesday, according to data analyzed by Associated Press election researcher Ryan Dubicki.
GOP voters who have already cast their ballots in person in the state total 144,105, compared to 139,524 votes from Democrats, according to the data analysis. Democrats have historically dominated early voting, with many party leaders pushing for supporters to vote early in previous elections.
â€œWhat weâ€™re seeing is phenomenal,â€ New Jersey Republican gubernatorial candidate Jack Ciattarelli said Wednesday on â€œFox & Friends First,â€ Fox News reported. â€œRepublicans are finally embracing the opportunity to vote early. The return rate on vote-by-mail ballots has been fantastic. Local Republican organizations are doing a great job in getting the word out.â€
The last time New Jersey voted for a GOP presidential candidate was in 1988, when Republican Vice President George H. W. Bush beat Democratic Massachusetts Gov. Michael Dukakis, according to Fox News.
Despite the strong showing, New Jersey Democrats are still leading Republicans in mail-in ballots as of Saturday, with 357,924 cast by Democrats, 121,003 by Republicans and 108,270 by unaffiliated voters, according to the New Jersey Globe. New Jersey voters cast a total of 589,353 ballots by mail as of Saturday morning, according to the Globe. (RELATED: Blue State Nowhere Near The Border Is Having To Shell Out Billions Due To Illegal Immigration, Report Finds)
Former President Donald Trump drew nearly 100,000 attendees to a New Jersey campaign rally in May. Several GOP leaders in swing states have adopted a strategy often used by Democrats of encouraging voters to cast their ballots early.
Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris have been locked in a tight presidential race with just six days remaining until Election Day. Trump is leading nationally by 0.4 percentage points at 48.4% to Harrisâ€™ 48.0%, according to polling averages from RealClear Polling.
Of registered voters in New Jersey, 55% said they plan to vote or have already voted for Harris, while 35% said they would vote or already have voted for Trump, according to a Rutgers-Eagleton Poll published on Oct. 30.

title: Panelist Tells Mark Halperin He Will â€˜Not Be Stunnedâ€™ If Trump Narrowly Wins State GOP Hasnâ€™t Won Decades
content:
Radio personality Michael Graham told journalist Mark Halperin Monday that he will â€œnot be stunnedâ€ if Republican nominee Donald Trump narrowly wins New Hampshire in the 2024 election.
Graham cited a New Hampshire Journal/Praecones Analytica poll from Sunday finding Trump with a 50.2% to 49.8% lead over Vice President Kamala Harris in New Hampshire, saying that the state could be a hit or miss for the former president. Graham said on Halperinâ€™s â€œThe Morning Meetingâ€ that New Hampshire is the one state in New England that may fare positively for Republicans, as enough voters may turn out in the state to vote for Trump.
â€œBelieve it or not, in a state the Democrats have carried 7 of the last 8 times, the Granite State, Donald Trump has a massive 50.2% to 49.8% leadâ€¦ A month ago, the polling, Saint Annâ€™s and some and others had Trump losing by about 6.5 [points], and then last Thursday, Emerson came out and Trump was at 50%-47%, losing by 3 [within] margin of error, Graham said, citing the poll. â€œAnd then I of course, everyday, tune in go â€˜The Morning Meetingâ€™ and I heard Seanâ€™s [Spicer] reporting and I got then umbers and I was stunned.â€
Graham further said that â€œsubterraneanâ€ issues, including whether to permit transgender athletes in womenâ€™s sports, is having a major effect on voters in New Hampshire and may help Trump in November. (RELATED: â€˜Difficult For Her To Winâ€™: Mark Halperin Says â€˜Data Everywhereâ€™ Shows â€˜Things Have Moved In Trumpâ€™s Directionâ€™)
â€œI think the two things that are moving in these purple-y states, the big one is Kamala Harris is failing the audition, or the job,â€ Graham said. â€œSheâ€™s just failing. And I think the other one is, you guys have picked up on these subterranean issues that are having effects that people arenâ€™t looking at like these fights over trans issues, guys and girls sports, New Hampshire has been ground zero for thatâ€¦. If you said Trumpâ€™s gonna lose New Hampshire by ten [points], I would not be stunned. If you told me Trump was gonna win New Hampshire by 1 [point], I would not be stunned.â€
Former Trump-era White House press secretary Sean Spicer said he has talked to many New Englanders who had not previously supported Trump are now backing the former president because they are â€œpissed offâ€ by the status quo.
Republican gubernatorial candidate Kelly Ayotte is leading her Democratic opponent Joyce Craig 51.9% to 48.1%, according to the New Hampshire Journal/Praecones Analytica poll. The poll surveyed 622 registered voters in New Hampshire between October 24-26 with a 3.93% margin of error.
A Republican presidential nominee has not won New Hampshire in a general election since former President George W. Bush secured a victory in 2000. Former Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton narrowly beat Trump in New Hampshire 46.8% to 46.5%, while President Joe Biden won by a 7-point margin, 52.7% to 45.4%, against the former president.

title: NEW WSJ POLL: TRUMP TAKES LEAD NATIONALLY
content:
Former President Donald Trump has taken a narrow lead over Vice President Kamala Harris with less than two weeks until election day, according to a Wall Street Journal poll published Thursday.
Trump has pulled out in front with a 47-45 lead, a change from the Journalâ€™s polling in August, which had Kamala ahead by two percentage points. The two percentage points are within the pollâ€™s margin of error.
Harrisâ€™s favorability and job performance numbers have dropped since August while Trumpâ€™s job performance numbers has risen. In August, half of voters viewed her favorably. Now, as of late October, 45 percent view her favorably compared to 53 who view her unfavorably, according to the poll.
Harris is also seeing her worst job performance ratings as vice president since WSJ started asking voters about her performance. Fifty-four percent of voters disapprove of her performance compared to 42 percent who approve.
Exclusive: Trump has taken a narrow lead against Harris in the final weeks of the presidential race https://t.co/fUBlHlSvDb
â€” The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) October 24, 2024
Ad blitzes and â€œthe performance of the candidatesâ€ have contributed to the shift, the outlet reported.
â€œVoters are finally getting to know her,â€ Republican pollster David Lee, who ran the poll with Democrat Michael Bocian, told the WSJ. (RELATED: Wall Street Billionaires Are Starting To Bet On A Trump Win)
â€œThe definitional period is coming to an end, and more people are unhappy with what they have learned about her than what they know about President Trump,â€ Lee said.
Issues that voters appear to trust Trump over Harris on include the economy and immigration. Voters approve of Trump over Harris on the economy by 12 points compared to 8 in August, according to the poll. On immigration, they trust him by 15 points, a leap from the 7-point lead he had over Harris in August.
The Journalâ€™s poll results match other recent polls. While Real Clear Politicsâ€™ (RCP) national polling average still has Harris ahead by a hair â€“ 0.2 percent â€“ the four most recent polls all have Trump ahead by at least a two percent margin.
CNBC and Forbes/HarrisX, which polled likely voters as opposed to the registered voters that CNBC and WSJ polled, both have Trump ahead by two percent nationally.
Rasmussenâ€™s Wednesday poll has Trump up by three percent.
While RCPâ€™s average has Trump slightly behind nationally, heâ€™s ahead in every key battleground. Overall in the swing states heâ€™s up 0.9 percent. In Georgia heâ€™s ahead by 2.2 points. In Wisconsin and Michigan heâ€™s edging Harris by 0.2 percent.
Trump is also dominating in the betting markets. He has a 59 percent chance of winning versus Harrisâ€™ 40.1 percent chance, according to the RCP betting average.
Polymarket, the worldâ€™s largest prediction market, has Trumpâ€™s odds at 61.1 percent.
The shift is a far cry from early August, when Harris jumped out to a significant lead over Trump by most indicators. Harrisâ€™ current 0.2 percent lead in the RCP average is her lowest leading margin since she jumped ahead of Trump on Aug. 5.

title: Gen Z DNC Delegate Rejects Democrats, Says Sheâ€™s Joining Republican Party
content:
A former Democratic National Convention (DNC) delegate released a video Friday declaring her rejection of the Democratic Party as she crossed the political aisle.
Audrey McNeal, a 22-year-old woman who previously was a DNC delegate for both 2020 and 2024 elections, revealed on X she will be voting for the Trump-Vance ticket as she has joined the Republican Party.
â€œIn 2020, I was elected at 18 to become one of the youngest delegates to the Democratic National Convention on behalf of my district. And in 2024, I was elected again to return to the DNC as a delegate,â€ McNeal said. â€œBut this year, Iâ€™m casting my ballot for Donald Trump.â€
I was a lifelong democrat, elected to the DNC twice.
Iâ€™m voting Trump/Vance in November and joining the Republican party as a Constitutional conservative â€“
we have to conserve the freedoms (1A & 2A) we already have outlined in our Constitution. pic.twitter.com/pMk6wMwlx4
â€” Audrey (@Audreyjmcneal) October 26, 2024
McNeal said she was elected in March and wanted to go to the DNC to seek answers on free speech, the border and the economy. The former DNC delegate explained that she became disillusioned after attending the DNC.
â€œAfter reflecting on my time at the DNC, I realized it was no longer the party of free speech and civil liberties that it used to be,â€ McNeal said.
â€œIn fact, Patrick Henry once said that the liberties of a people never were, nor ever will be secure when the transactions of their rulers may be concealed from them,â€ she added. (RELATED: â€˜Youâ€™re Not A Kamala Person, I Know Youâ€™: Trump Makes His Case To Joe Rogan For Why Heâ€™s The Better Candidate)
President Joe Biden endorsed Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris immediately after dropping his reelection bid July 21. Despite prominent Democrats like former President Barack Obama initially suggesting an open primary system be used to determine the partyâ€™s replacement candidate, Democratic leaders eventually decided to skip the democratic process and place Harris at the top of their 2024 ticket.
â€œFor the rulers of the Democratic Party elite to install Kamala Harris as the presidential nominee via stripping the vote of 14 million Americans, including their own delegates such as myself, well that was a decision in a transaction that was concealed,â€ McNeal said.
â€œAnd now Iâ€™m happy to say that in officially joining the Republican Party as a constitutional conservative,â€ the former DNC delegate announced.
Before she denounced the Democratic Party, McNeal told GPB in August that it was â€œempoweringâ€ to be among other young delegates at the DNC.
#ICYMI This year, 15 of Georgiaâ€™s 123 DNC delegates are under 35.
Audrey McNeal is one of those delegates. She lives in Fulton County and said itâ€™s â€œempoweringâ€ to be around other young delegates at the DNC. https://t.co/fG9YYgBOFh (From @gpbnews)
â€” GPB (@mygpb) August 23, 2024
â€œWe all have a common experience coming to the DNC, being really young, having very passionate dreams that we want to see and kind of just being there for each other when it comes to, like, supporting each otherâ€™s campaigns or going to caucus events together,â€ the former DNC delegate said at the time.
McNeal made a new X account in October since joining the Republican Party.
Her first post Saturday quote-tweeted a clip teasing Trumpâ€™s podcast interview on â€œThe Joe Rogan Experience.â€
â€œIt is the function of speech to free men from the bondage of irrational fearsâ€ â€“ Louis Brandeis, US Supreme Court Justice https://t.co/R7Xx8XybGe
â€” Audrey (@Audreyjmcneal) October 26, 2024
â€œâ€˜It is the function of speech to free men from the bondage of irrational fears.â€™ â€“ Louis Brandeis, US Supreme Court Justice,â€ McNeal wrote with the video.
The Daily Caller reached out to Audrey McNeal for comment but has not heard back.

title: â€˜Heâ€™s Not Helpingâ€™: Ex-CNN Analyst Says Bidenâ€™s Call To â€˜Lockâ€™ Trump â€˜Upâ€™ Is â€˜Absolutely Bad For Kamala Harrisâ€™
content:
Former CNN political analyst Chris Cillizza said Wednesday that President Joe Bidenâ€™s comment about having to â€œlock [former President Donald Trump] upâ€ is damaging to Vice President Kamala Harrisâ€™ campaign.
Biden made the â€œlock him upâ€ remark Tuesday at New Hampshireâ€™s Democratic National Committee office, referencing the tight race between Trump and Harris and claiming the former president believes he is immune from â€œphysically eliminatingâ€ threats. Cillizza, on his YouTube channel, said while he does not believe Biden is deliberately undermining Harris, his comment will likely give Trump a boost in his efforts to defeat her. (RELATED: Former Clinton Pollster Says Harrisâ€™ â€˜Inauthenticityâ€™ Is â€˜The Larger Problem She Facesâ€™ In Election)
WATCH:
â€œNow, Biden, probably realizing what a dumb thing he had just said, added, â€˜Politically lock him up. Lock him out, thatâ€™s what we have to do.â€™ Yeah, thatâ€™s the ticket,â€ Cillizza said. â€œUh, come on, man, like we, â€˜Politically lock him up,â€™ what the hell does that mean? When the president of the United States says, â€˜We gotta lock him upâ€™ about the former president of the United States, who has premised almost his entire political life on the idea that the Democrats and the â€˜deep stateâ€™ are trying to lock him up, I mean, itâ€™s really not good.â€
â€œIf the Trump campaign is smart, this will be in a Trump campaign ad. It affirms for the Republican base everything that Donald Trump is saying â€” that secretly the Democrats, from Joe Biden on down, including Kamala Harris, are just out to get him, right? He has said this for years,â€ he added. â€œAnd when the president of the United States says, â€˜We gotta lock him up,â€™ and then says, â€˜Politically lock him up,â€™ yeah, itâ€™s just not good. Look, do I think this ends the race? No, of course not. Do I think Trump would be smart to put it in an ad? Yes, as I said, I do.â€
Four criminal indictments were brought against Trump in 2023 involving alleged election interference and mishandling of classified documents. Trump repeatedly characterized the Manhattan case against him as â€œelection interference,â€ referring to it as a â€œBiden witch huntâ€ and the â€œBiden Case.â€
WATCH:
â€œI do not think Joe Biden is running a secret conspiracy to make Kamala Harris lose, but I do think that when you say things like â€˜We gotta lock him up,â€™ â€˜gotta lock him upâ€™ about Donald Trump two weeks before an election, it affirms everything Donald Trump has been arguing,â€ Cillizza said later. â€œIt makes the Republican base even more rabid to turn out, right? As if they werenâ€™t rabid enough â€” theyâ€™re pretty rabid to turn out. Theyâ€™re going to be even more rabid, so heâ€™s not helping.â€
â€œI get it, but like, he needs to not really do anything like this again. Like, it is absolutely bad for Kamala Harris, and I bet when her campaign read the â€˜We gotta lock him upâ€™ thing, they were like, â€˜Joe, Joe, Joe, Joe, Joe,'â€ he added.
Biden presently has no intentions of appearing alongside his vice president on the campaign trail before Nov. 5, three White House officials and three Harris campaign officials recently told NBC News.

title: EXCLUSIVE: GOP Lawmakers Urge Biden Admin To Investigate Dem Rep With Deep China Ties
content:
Republican lawmakers called on the Biden administration to launch an investigation into a Chinese civic association linked to a New York Democratic congresswoman on Wednesday, according to a letter exclusively obtained by the Daily Caller News Foundation.
Reps. Jim Banks of Indiana, Carlos Gimenez of Florida, Robert Wittman of Virginia and Republican Conference Chair Elise Stefanik of New York urged Secretary of State Antony Blinken to designate the New York-based Henan Association Of Eastern America (HAEA) as a â€œforeign mission,â€ citing â€œits recently reported leading role in Chinese Communist Party (CCP)-led influence operations against American officials,â€ according to the letter. The lawmakers also asked Attorney General Merrick Garland to investigate HAEAâ€™s current and former leaders, including New York Democratic Rep. Grace Meng, who was listed as the groupâ€™s â€œdeputy chairwomanâ€ before she launched her congressional campaign in 2012.
â€œA future Democrat Congresswoman opened the door to the CCP with the help of the United Front, the CCPâ€™s overseas influence operations,â€ Banks, a member of the House Select Committee on the CCP, told the DCNF. â€œGroups like the Henan Association canâ€™t be allowed to wage political warfare against the U.S. on our soil any longer.â€ (RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Dem Congresswoman Was A Fixture At Events Honoring Chinese Communist Party Officials)
â€œThe State Department must designate the Henan Association as a foreign mission,â€ the letter reads. â€œUnder the Foreign Missions Act, an organization should be designated by the State Department as a â€˜foreign missionâ€™ if the entity is involved in the activities of a foreign government or is â€˜substantially owned or effectively controlledâ€™ by a foreign government.â€
Federal prosecutors recently indicted Mengâ€™s former congressional campaign director, Linda Sun, and her husband, Chris Hu, for allegedly acting as unregistered agents of China while Sun worked for New York Gov. Kathy Hochul and former Gov. Andrew Cuomo. The Wall Street Journal subsequently reported Sun had met the â€œheads of key groups identifiable in the indictment as being United Front-linked,â€ naming HAEA and another New York Chinese association.
The so-called â€œUnited Frontâ€ strategy is a â€œunique blend of engagement, influence activities, and intelligence operations that the CCP uses to shape its political environment, including to influence other countriesâ€™ policy toward the PRC and to gain access to advanced foreign technology,â€ according to a 2023 report from the House Select Committee on the CCP.
United Front work is conducted â€œby an extensive and well-documented network of organizations operating in parallel to the Peopleâ€™s Republic of Chinaâ€™s (PRC) foreign ministry and intelligence services that seeks to influence universities, think tanks, civic groups, other prominent individuals and institutions, and public opinion broadly,â€ that House committeeâ€™s report states.
â€œSun allegedly used the Henan Association as her intermediary in conducting official business with, and receiving direction from, PRC officials,â€ the lawmakers stated in their letter. â€œA Henan leader is named as one of the unindicted co-conspirators in Sunâ€™s agent activities.â€
The WSJ previously identified HAEAâ€™s president, Zhang Fuyin, as one of Sunâ€™s two alleged co-conspirators. Mengâ€™s longtime congressional staffer Sydney Li, who is HAEAâ€™s deputy chairman, has also interacted with CCP official and Chinese intelligence personnel, the WSJ reported.
The WSJ reported that during a 2019 China trip, Li hand-delivered a letter from Meng to a CCP intel official alongside Zhang, and the DCNF identified four more instances in which Li gave letters on behalf of Meng to either CCP intel or Propaganda Department personnel.
The lawmakersâ€™ letter also asked the State Department to â€œreview all hometown associations similarly tied to United Front activities for potential designation as foreign missions.â€
â€œOutposts of our Chinese enemy should not be allowed in our country, but if they must be here we must require them to register,â€ Gordon Chang, China expert and author, told the DCNF.
The letter sent Wednesday also presses the DOJ to â€œinvestigate all current and former leaders and associates of the Henan Association for potential FARA violations and prosecute any offenders accordingly.â€The Foreign Agents Registration Act (FARA) â€œrequires certain agents of foreign principals who are engaged in political activities or other activities specified under the statute to make periodic public disclosure of their relationship with the foreign principal, as well as activities, receipts and disbursements in support of those activities,â€ according to the DOJ.
Between 2008 and 2012, HAEA identified Meng as its â€œdeputy chairwoman,â€ but began listing her as â€œhonorary chairwomanâ€ in February 2012, the month before she launched her congressional campaign, the DCNF reported. Mengâ€™s photo was prominently displayed at the top of HAEAâ€™s homepage for over a decade beside the organizationâ€™s chairman and president until the entire website was deleted on Sept. 26, following DCNF reports on her years-long involvement with the group.
The WSJ recently reported Meng denied ever having held any official position with HAEA, claiming she only held an â€œhonorary title,â€ despite a 2008 video in which she introduced herself as HAEAâ€™s â€œdeputy chairwoman.â€
WATCH@RepGraceMeng told @WSJ she had no official role w/ Henan Association of Eastern American (HAEA), claims it was â€œhonorary titleâ€
Meng also claims sheâ€™s â€œno recollectionâ€ of 2008 video where she identifies herself as HAEAâ€™s â€œdeputy chairwomanâ€ to which Iâ€™ve added subtitles pic.twitter.com/LOIlh4JbtKâ€” Philip Lenczycki è”¡å²³ (@LenczyckiPhilip) October 23, 2024
Meng has participated in more than a dozen events alongside HAEA leaders welcoming various CCP delegations to New York, during which sheâ€™s toasted CCP intel personnel, awarded congressional commendations to Communist Party leaders and received several gifts, the DCNF reported, with perhaps the most recent instance occurring in March 2024.
These interactions extend back at least as far as 2008, the DCNF found, and include Mengâ€™s participation in a December 2008 welcome banquet in Queens, New York for the chairman of the All-China Federation Of Returned Overseas Chinese (ACFROC), who Meng referred to as â€œour chairmanâ€ and praised for his â€œleadership,â€ footage shows.
The DOJ has characterized ACFROC as an â€œagencyâ€ of a Chinese intelligence service called the United Front Work Department (UFWD).
ğŸš¨WATCH @RepGraceMeng praise CCP intel agency headğŸš¨by @DailyCaller
â€œâ€¦specially welcoming our Chairman Lin! â€¦ grateful to Chairman Lin for taking care of us â€” really need your leadership!â€
Any congress members working w/ CCP United Front â€œmust resignâ€ â€“ @RepJimBanks pic.twitter.com/x9cURKwuiA
â€” Philip Lenczycki è”¡å²³ (@LenczyckiPhilip) September 9, 2024
The DOJ also alleges that ACFROC hired Mengâ€™s former campaign director, Sun, as its â€œcommittee memberâ€ in September 2019.
Multiple HAEA leaders, including its president, Zhang, as well as the organizationâ€™s chairman are ACFROC members, the DCNF discovered.
â€œThe Biden-Harris DOJ must force foreign influence groups to register to FARA, and groups like the Henan Association should be classified as foreign missions of China,â€ Banks told the DCNF.
Meng and HAEA did not respond to the DCNFâ€™s request for comment.

title: Virginia Asks Supreme Court To Let It Remove Noncitizens From Voter Rolls
content:
Virginia asked the Supreme Court Monday to block a lower court order to return over a thousand alleged noncitizens to the voter rolls.
Virginia Attorney General Jason Miyares vowed to file the emergency appeal Sunday after an appeals court upheld a ruling preventing officials from removing roughly 1,600 individuals who the state says â€œself-identifiedâ€ as noncitizens.
â€œThe injunction, which prohibits the application of a law that has been on the books since the Justice Department precleared it in 2006, will also irreparably injure Virginiaâ€™s sovereignty, confuse her voters, overload her election machinery and administrators, and likely lead noncitizens to think they are permitted to vote, a criminal offence that will cancel the franchise of eligible voters,â€ the state argued in its petition.
U.S. District Court Judge Patricia Giles, a Biden appointee, issued an order Friday blocking Virginiaâ€™s efforts to remove noncitizen voters within 90 days of the election. (RELATED: Biden-Appointed Judge Blocks Virginia Effort To Remove Non-Citizens From Voter Rolls)
The Department of Justice (DOJ) sued Virginia Oct. 12 over Gov. Glenn Youngkinâ€™s executive order to more frequently remove noncitizens.
ğŸš¨ BREAKING: Last night, Virginia filed an emergency stay in the US Supreme Court.
Americans citizens â€” and no one else â€” should determine American elections.
â€” Jason Miyares (@JasonMiyaresVA) October 28, 2024
â€œThe Department of Justice pulled this shameful, politically motivated stunt 25 days before Election Day, challenging a Virginia process signed into law 18 years ago by a Democrat governor and approved by the Department of Justice in 2006,â€ Miyares said in a statement Friday.
â€œMore concerning is the open practice by the Biden-Harris administration to weaponize the legal system against the enemies of so-called progress,â€ Miyares said. â€œThat is the definition of lawfare. To openly choose weaponization over good process and lawfare over integrity isnâ€™t democracy: itâ€™s bullying, pure and simple, and I always stand up to bullies.â€
A federal judge blocked Alabamaâ€™s efforts to remove noncitizens from the voter rolls earlier in October.
